Reviews.Title: “Classy, prime location”
Reviews.Author: Tashafromtulsa
Reviews.Content: I got the hotel for DIRT cheap on a name your own price website. We had to pay a resort fee and some other fees, but it still was an awesome deal. The Valet parking was the best way to go, and the hotel is right by some cool shops and on the beach. The pools were clean and not too crowded, had a neat waterfall and indoor pool as well. I would definitely go back! We went in Nov 2011, and Daytona was EMPTY though. Go eat at the Brickyard lounge, awesome burgers!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hilton on the beach”
Reviews.Author: morefunFl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.....nice clean room, great ocean view, fun places to eat and drink in walking distance. I will stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Daytona. I only ate at the sports bar.... App were 1/2 price during happy hour and the food was good especially when it was 1/2 price. I was there with a group rate of 109.00 which seemed fair. Self parking is across the street and kind of a pain....valet was 19.00 a day. That is my only complaint...they should make the valet charge 10.00 a day and make self parking free......and I'd give the hotel a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “RUN FROM THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Labor Day Weekend and what a nightmare. The hotel staff was obviously frustrated with the management and, at one point, had a server in the Legends Sports Bar tell us how awful the management was... I ordered food to be delivered to our room at check-in...no food (but THEY CHARGED ME FOR IT), we waited forty minutes for our food in Legends AND WE WERE THE ONLY ONES THERE, I ordered room service Coffee for 7 AM the next morning...they never brought the coffee (but THEY CHARGED ME FOR IT). We waited THREE HOURS for towels at the pool and eventually just gave up. The price you pay when you book your room is just the beginning of this odyssey...Parking $20..did you want a fridge $10...microwave? $10 and both PER DAY. Breakfast at Docs? $20 a HEAD (breakfast buffet includes a total of 12 items which included stale pastry's and sausage that sat in a chafing dish so long you couldn't cut the skin). Dinner at Docs (Seafood buffet...lol) $42. a HEAD... the shrimp was BROWN, crab legs were old..the Prime Rib was good but this was a ridiculous price...did you want to get a umbrella and chairs on the beach? $30. and ONLY UNTIL 5PM...Before our trip I emailed the Concierge FOUR times using the link they sent me with my reservation confirmation and no one responded... the front desk personnel were disconnected and uninterested.. The Oceanfront King Room we stayed in was barely adequate...the shower and bathroom floor was dirty... it has clearly NOT been mopped by housekeeping after the previous guest left...we found clothing tags and food on the carpet and GARBAGE in one of the cans underneath the desk. I called housekeeping and a man showed up with extra pillows and towels and "wiped down the bathroom" he also ran the vacuum over the carpet and stood around for a several minutes (no joke) until we TIPPED him to leave. No no no...this is a HILTON in name only and doesn't even come close to the quality you would expect from this brand. Don't walk...RUN... from this hotel. There are several other places on Daytona Beach you can stay and have a much better experience. As a Hilton Honors Member and frequent traveler I can honestly tell you this is in my top ten WORST hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Daytona a Relaxing Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: pinkybeach
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative reviews about the Hilton Daytona Beach before we went there, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was way better than most of the reviews I read. We had an awesome time. Their are two towers and its a long walk between the two. We were in the North Tower and I think it was the best place to be. Walk straight out and hit the beach. There is a food truck parked on the beach everyday. Chairs and umbrellas are available for rent on the beach. I usually take my own but next time I would rent due to it being a time saver for me and less to pack in my car. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel and in walking distance. Lots to do in the area of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: jsmit25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Front Desk was Wonderful, All Staff very friendly, Great service, Clean Room..We have stayed at this hotel several times over the years and have never had a complaint. Highly recommend anyone looking for a Great experience to stay here. ........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week end”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL WAS WONDERFUL. CLEAN, FUN AND ACCOModating. Allie at the front desk made sure our room was delightful and that we had everything we needed. Joyce at the delicious buffet breakfast made sure that I was seated quickly and close in as I had a bad back. Sam at Legends was terrific. I wish I was there longer and will definitly return......Barbara

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: CT_Traveler25
Reviews.Content: Over the past nine months I have stayed at this Hilton on six different occasions. Each visit continues to impress me with the amenities available and excellent service from hotel staff. Even during the busy Labor Day weekend staff were super friendly and efficient. Food in both in the restaurant and in the sports bar are top quality. You cannot beat the location! You can walk to many restaurants and attractions. Don't pay extra for the ocean view...a pool view also gives you a view of the Atlantic and pier that can't be beat. Ask for a room on floor 4 or above.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel right where the action is!”
Reviews.Author: HollyGio
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel to attend a chess tournament so we didn't know what to expect. The hotel is very nice (and large) with two towers. The rooms are very nice with a large bathroom and a second sink in the bedroom - perfect for a family of 4. Our room was on the 8th floor, overlooking the ocean/boardwalk - Beautiful! The elevators are FAST so staying at a high floor is not inconvenient. We also discovered rooms located outside on the ground floor with their own patios. Perfect if you would like to walk right out your door to the beach. The hotel also allows dogs (bonus) and they are allowed on the beach with a leash. They offer valet parking for $19/night or you can self park in the garage across the street for $12. We never used our car the entire 3 1/2 days we were there. You can walk everywhere. On one end of the hotel is a 3 story plaza with shops, restaurants and a theater. There is also an outdoor amphitheater that had concerts going all weekend (Labor Day) but only until 10:00, which was nice for guests to be able to sleep. At the other end of the hotel is the park with a few rides. The wrist bands are the best deal if you plan to ride more than 2. Then there are tourist shops and restaurants and the pier. If you turn the corner on that street, there are lots of other restaurants and shops that we didn't discover until the second day. Zeno's taffy and fudge is awesome! Sicily Pizza is the best ever! The hotel has several good restaurants as well. The beach is awesome! We rented reclining bikes (best at low tide). The hotel has two pools. Since we stayed in the north tower, that is the pool we used. It is located on the 5th floor and has a kids pool and hot tub with pool table, foosball and snack bar. There is also a kids room with toys, games and movies. Be sure to get towels from the pool area before you head to the beach. We loved this hotel and look forward to going back next year. The only negative is when you are ready to come back in from the beach all sandy. They only have a foot wash that barely works and leaves you standing in a pile of sand. Kind of lame for such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Erin K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach / Ocean Walk Village from 8/23 - 8/25. And I had an awesome time. Upon check in we were upgraded to a split-view room so we were able to see the boardwalk and the ocean. The view was incredible. The beds were soft, the room was clean. I am hard pressed to find one bad thing to say about my stay at this hotel. Everything from the location to the staff was wonderful. I will be staying there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: l11ten
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights at the Hilton hotel Daytona beach mid August. we had a beach front room which had a fantastic view of the ocean and beach. the room was clean and big enough but would benefit from having a fridge and safe. the location to the beach is perfect and is also next to a small complex which has a bubba gumps and sloppy joes. The children also enjoyed the kids club within the hotel. there is a great room for the children containing x boxes, Wiis and a table tennis table. there is also a member of staff on hand to supervise them. overall the hotel is nice and it's location in relation to the beach is great, if it's a couple of days of rest you are after then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room - Views Galore”
Reviews.Author: ROlsen32114
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to a "staycation" at the Hilton and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We stayed in a end of hallway suite in the south tower overlooking the boardwalk and Main Street Pier. The room featured two slidding glass doors and a oversized veranda complete with lounge chairs! The king size bed was comfy and we had a flat screen TV in the bedroom and the main living room area. The biggest treat was being able to watch the firesworks show that Daytona Beach offers every Saturday night in the summertime from our private veranda! We had a hard time deciding between the hotel seafood buffet or Hyde Park and the newly opened Joe's Crab Shack. The Hilton goes a step further with the inroom amenities. My favorite flavored coffee creamer was an unexpected surprise. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of the ocean!”
Reviews.Author: Thesoupnazi88
Reviews.Content: You never have to leave this hotel, they have everything you need and more. Rooms were comfortable with a view to kill! On Friday and saturday nights they have an all you can eat buffet worth the money! All hotel staff was very accommodating. Had a wonderful week stay in this hotel with no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Basically nice and a recommend, but...”
Reviews.Author: Steve_N_32819
Reviews.Content: This is about the best hotel in Daytona Beach in terms of location and amenities. There's not much of a dispute there. The lobby and common areas are quite nice, as is the pool and spa area. Here's where they fail: Prices at the bar, NO! Parking is TOO expensive, NO wireless in room (I'm Hilton Gold so it's free - also useless as I have one of those new computers that left the outdated cat-5 port out beginning three years ago, the service in Doc Bales (breakfast restaurant) is a horrid comedy, and the main inside bar is nice enough, but did you notice the sails on the ceiling are yellowed or brown and have caught lots of debris - that when the light hits it, reflects said debris?? Like the giant, dead dragonfly. Attention to detail and cleanliness is items 1 & 2 on the must-haves of hotel accommodation. Clean the #$%^ dragonfly - gross.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, coming back in two weeks!”
Reviews.Author: WilfriedSchreder
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at the Hitlon Daytona Beach/Ocean Walk Village close to a year ago. This hotel was recommended by the curators of the Peabody Auditorium where I was invited to exhibit my photographic work, and I am so pleased they did so. From the grand reception, to the constant smiles, more than helpful staff, comfortable rooms, but most of all: being on the world's most famous beach. I hired a car on two occasions, parking was never an issue, the guys at the valet parking were always available and quick to boot. Their sport's bar was a great place to unwind from my photo trips and grab a quick snack, tried their "posh" restaurant, loved the food although it was a bit pricey. The hotel's business center's staff was VERY helpful, I had to send a few items back home in England. Very hard to find negatives in that place, the only thing I will say is that some parts of the hotel looked very dated compared to others, walking around the hotel and it is very noticeable which is a great shame. But that's not enough to stop me coming back, in fact I am bringing my partner this time for a relaxing break and we're very much looking forward to it. W. Schreder

Reviews.Title: “TOO EXPENSIVE FOR NOTHING!”
Reviews.Author: mrsg324
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for my daughter's dance competition and paid $149 a night PLUS parking (and that was a discounted rate). You had to pay $10/day extra just to have a mini refrigerator in your room. NO FREE WIFI! The rooms are average to say the least and definitely not worth the money! Sure it's a convenient location but I rather drive a little to my destination and pay less and get more for my money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: BTvler
Reviews.Content: The good: Location: right on the beach near good restaurants and shopping. Plenty of poolside bars and good restaurants. Valet parking is reasonably priced and quick. Good service and staff. The steak restaurant is very good. The upper pool bar mixes some great drinks. Price: $112 per night - very good. The bad: Not much to complain about. Don't stay in the bottom level suites that walk out onto the beach: mosquitoes and sand. The breakfast restaurant is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Marie F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hilton's in New York, L.A., and most other major cities, and they have been more than accomodating. But I must say, the Hilton in Daytona Beach need to be updated. It smells of mildew, and when I complained about this, the staff said it was 'to be expected,' because they were on the ocean.... Seriously? The rooms were subpar and the valet 'couldn't find' my car to the point where he was thinking I was mistaken about where I parked and I was thinking it was stolen. For that I could've stayed in a $32 a night roach motel. Very disappointed, Hilton...

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.... where do I even start?”
Reviews.Author: italiangrl71
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Valet parking is $19 and self parking is $12, the self parking is a bit of a walk and depending on what time you go it maybe hard to find a parking spot this was ridiculous so we ended up having to use valet our second night. The lobby is nice, very good feel when you walk in, only problem is I think they were having a problem with the air conditioning because it was very hot inside. We had three rooms, two ocean view and one city view. I was a bit surprised walking into our room, it was not as clean as it could have been, the bathroom was gross, floor was dirty and the shower curtain on the bottom had black on it, mold maybe? I don't know but there were stains all over the walls in the bathroom in various places. The shower head was also gross with rust and green around it! The carpet was clean thank God! And after taking off the out of date cheesy looking comforters the bed sheets were clean. One of the other rooms we had facing the ocean was missing a doorknob in the bathroom from the inside so unless you wanted to get locked inside you could not fully shut the bathroom door. What I didn't like about the balconies is that it was a foot wide! Listen we are at the beach you should atleast be able to sit outside the balcony and enjoy! The beds were comfy as we're the pillows. I didn't like that the pool on the fifth floor was small and for a hotel of this size the main pool was small as well and what a trek it is to get to the pool and the beach for that matter! We were in the north tower and we had to walk all the way thru the hotel lugging beach chairs, coolers etc. just a pain to get to the beach. For a Hilton I expect more and if this is what the Hilton looked like I would hate to see what the other hotels along the beach are like because I expected the Hilton to be top notch. I don't really think I will stay at this hotel again because of the bathroom and the inconvenience of getting to the beach and lack of the pool area. I will take my chances somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “friendly folks”
Reviews.Author: dex49
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this property, and enjoyed it very much. I was there on business/conference, and they have everything you need. From the high end steak house, Hyde Park, to a great sports bar. It's convienent to most things, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. I wanted to check in early, and they were very good at getting a room cleaned to allow me to do so. Will stay there again when in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Beach stay -Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Runningontheroad
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel, lots of people, had several conventions going on during our stay, not very cozy, bathrooms were small, but clean and great direct access to the beach, for the price and no beach view, kinda of expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great location great view”
Reviews.Author: westcoasttraveler707
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night and attended a national convention there for five days, tho we stayed only one night ( and at another resort next door for the other four nights ) we spent most of the days there in the convention , and foud that the staff were very friendy and the restaraunt were better the average.

Reviews.Title: “We're Going Back Next Week”
Reviews.Author: salsasenora
Reviews.Content: From our home in Orlando, we like short drive beach getaways for a change of scene. The Hilton was excellent in every way. Ocean view room with sliding door to a mini-balcony (one foot width), with the sound of waves and ocean breezes putting us into immediate relaxation mode. Large screen plasma TV, comfy beds and lots of plush pillows, a small seating area with table, separate vanity with sink, fluffy towels and bath sheets, hot water and decent water pressure. However, the real pleasures are located outside the room. The pool is average, but who cares when an amazing soft sand beach is just a few steps away with invigorating waves for ocean swimmers/body surfing and shore waters gentle enough for kids to play and build sandcastles. Tip: Two chaises and an umbrella rent for $30.00 for full day. Consider taking your own if driving or buying in shop down the street for longer stays. A paved boardwalk connects guests with lots of entertainment within a short stroll. To the right is "Joyland", with a ferris wheel and bungie car, arcade and food court (full of teens), and a new pier seafood restaurant. To the left is "Ocean Walk" with more restaurants and bars. Across the street is a water park. Dining nearby for any mood or budget. This is an ideal vacation choice for just about anyone, especially families with so many options for all ages. Perfect for girls getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: ashia83
Reviews.Content: We stoped at Deytona beach for one night, just to check it out. We chose the Hilton, because of its brand, we didn't want to get stuck in a dirty old beach hotel. When you pull up, the hotel looks nice and staff is mostly friendly. Our room was ocean front and had a great view. The bathroom was dirty, toothpaste on the mirror frame, shower had mold. The water pressure in the shower was almost non existing, water barely trickled out of the dirty and moldy shower head. The bed was very uncomfortable, springs digging into your back. We woke up with killer back pain. The bed had a comforter on it, places that still use those do not wash them after every guest, its discusting sleeping under someone else's "funk". I made a point of checking the housekeeping cart as they were cleaning out the room next to us, no clean comforters on the cart = dirty comforter for the next guest. When we arrived we decided to go for a walk on the beach, by the exit door to the beach there were bunch of dirty towels on the floor (this was at 5pm) the next morning at 8.30am we were going out the same door and those same dirty towels were still there. We have an oversized vehicle that did not fit in the parking garage. The self parking lot is not secure, and over parking makes it almost impossible to get out of the lot with a larger vehicle. The hotel is outdated with some lipstick renovations, cleanliness is not a priority. There is no WiFi in rooms. Cleanliness is my top reason why I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and at a good price for the location. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was overpriced by about 30%. Internet service was $9.99 per night in the room, most hotels from Motel 6 on up now have free internet services in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This was the perfect weekend getaway location.”
Reviews.Author: beachlovers12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton. The staff was professional and happy. The environment was well managed and sophisticated. The accommodations were clean, private, safe, quiet and modern. Our room was on the 11th floor facing the west revealing a beautiful sunset. The dining choices were delicious. The entertainment and amenities on site provided plenty of activities. The beach front location is right in the heart of all of the action. We have made the Hilton Daytona Beach/Ocean Walk Village our number one vacation hotel for Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: msuhoops04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Illinois and took a lesiure trip down south, eventually ending up in Naples. We went to St. Augustine and then decided to stay at this Hilton. Disappointment #1, parking is $19/day to valet. Self-park is $12, but the lot is across the street and quite a distance if you have several bags. Disappointment #2 THE POOL. Their pool is quite possibly the saddest on the beach resort hotel pool I've ever seen. It was dirty, filled with sand, had no view of the water, and is actually on the second story. Disappointment #3, no beach chairs for guests. One of the reasons I convinced my husband to stay on the water was that I was hoping we'd get to use their beach chairs. The rooms were clean, slightly outdated but very spacious with an ocean view and even a couch and sitting area. This is your typical, oh you're on vacation, we're going to charge you for everything type of place ie: $4.00 plain coffee. It certainly wasn't a terrible hotel, but I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pet Friendly Beach Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amanda41579
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! From the staff to the location to the rooms! We had a cabana suite oceanfront and it was amazing and so convenient when we wanted to go down to the beach or walk over to the restaurants and shops....we didn't have to take an elevator, walk through the lobby then down the stairs, all we had to do was open our door and go! I highly recommend getting one of these rooms if the price is right for you! We were also traveling with our two dogs and sometimes you never know how pet friendly a hotel is especially with this being one of the more upscale hotels on Daytona Beach. When we opened the door to our room there were two huge fluffy dog beds and stainless steel water and dog food bowls waiting for our little guy and girl and they LOVED it! The $50 non-refundable fee is 100% worth it considering we would pay so much more if we left them at a kennel. Just outside our suite was a huge long grassy area where we took the dogs to do their business and walk down the sidewalk to get some exercise. Housekeeping was GREAT also. We didn't want them coming in our room when we weren't there because of the dogs so they were gracious enough to leave us new towels, coffee and toiletry products for us as well as bringing us two HUGE bags of ice to fill up our ice chest! I also read in a previous comment that the televisions were outdated at this hotel, but we had two flat screen tv's in our room, i believe they were about 27" tv's....not really a big deal to me, but I know some people can't live without a tv. Again, this hotel is awesome.....we ate at Bubba Gump, Sloppy Joe's, Winghouse and got some dessert at Coldstone which was all within minutes walking distance from our cabana! We only live 2 & 1/2 hours away in Tampa and I'm thinking of going to this hotel every other weekend haha! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: sstempel1
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a family vacation in Daytona Beach. Our overall experience was not a bad one but I have to say I was disappointed in the Hilton at this location. We chose to vallet park and had no problems getting our car or returning it any of the times we went out. We arrived in the late in the afternoon and the kids wanted to go down to the beach/ pool. When we arrived at the pool area there was no attendant and large pile of towels on the floor in front of the desk. This was frustrating and not a great first impression of the hotel service. Then we couldn't get a straight answer out of any employee we asked about other options. When the attendant arrived (about 10 minutes) he was not overly concerned about the lack of towels and stated it would be awhile before there were any new ones since he had just arrived. We stayed from Tuesday to Saturday and I only saw a person at the pool desk one other time so I can only assume that this is common practice at this facility. The area you walk through just before you get to the pool was disgusting and I cannot believe that the hotel would let such a well traveled area be left in this condition. From the smell and the wet carpet, the water leaking from the ceiling into a bucket on the floor had been left unrepaired for quite some time. There were many options for dining in the hotel and in the surrounding area. We had breakfast at the hotel most mornings and the buffet was very good. We enjoyed the food and staff at Legends sports bar several times during our stay. The food at the steak house was not bad but for the price it was nothing to rave about either. We are from the midwest and it was almost an insult to have the waiter correct us on how we should have our steaks cooked. I am sure he was doing his job by making the recommendations but he could have taken a less condescending tone. Our rooms were clean but small. We stayed in the North tower and I would recommend an ocean view. I was suprised that there were no microwaves or fridges in the rooms, but it was not a problem for us. There are many shops right by the the hotel, and a movie theater too which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach and great location”
Reviews.Author: Robinitz
Reviews.Content: He got an awesome deal on book it mystery hotels. The beach is beautiful but you need to bring your own chairs. The location is perfect if you like a lot around. We went to the free concert next door, had dinner at sloppy joes and shopped all within a few feet of the hotel. Fireworks over the water was a great way to finish the night. The rooms are ok. Lots of restaurants in the hotel. The front desk staff was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good rooms - incovienient parking - zero service”
Reviews.Author: goodytravel
Reviews.Content: Expect to pay for every single thing at the hotel, self parking is $12.00 a night and across the street in an open chain link fenced pot hole filled lot. No refrig, micro or any util in the room. No coffee or a cookie or any freebies of any kind in the lobby, workout center was closed during my week of stay as air conditioning is being repaired. Usually retorts of this kind have some welcome drinks or evening cookies or morning coffee in the lobby each day. Pools were small and crowded. Rooms were nice though very samll and facing the ocean, walk to all daytona night life and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tammy W
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading reviews for it versus other hotels in same area. It did not disappoint. First, it's huge. The combination of South and North Towers and all the restaurants make this a great place to stay and a good daily walk! Check in was a breeze, got a room after 5 mins and I was early at 12:00pm!! Got straight to the room, nice average hotel room with an amazing view of the ocean and all the happenings that go on around this hotel. Had a problem with AC and had repairman there in 10 mins after the call and he went out of his way to fix problem and give me some tourist advice. Beautiful beaches and so many fun things to do around this hotel , that I would stay again. My rooms were clean, the hotel was clean and I had great service the entire trip. Made a girls weekend great!! Tips for this hotel:: stay oceanfront, it is definitely worth the extra money. Also check out earlier than the 11:00am checkout. We waited for a long time for bell service and our car . I've heard we had over 200 rooms checking out at one time. A possible solution for the hotel would be staggering check out times to ease the wait. Otherwise I enjoy the hotel and will be coming back with my family to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get-Away......Not to Shabby. (4 days, 3 nights)”
Reviews.Author: Townsnd
Reviews.Content: William Shatner got me a great deal. Don't be scared to Drop Low $ rates on a 3 1/2 Star Resort. I myself used to Manage a Casino in one of the most populated tourist towns in the world, you learn you don't get if you do not ask. (Vegas) And for a busy on the beach Resort, I got one of the best deals and was not even part of their Club Member discounts. I was asked if I was when I checked in, but never asked if I wanted to sign up with an answer of no. Now for our actual stay. Alma in the Gift shop was such a lovely lady. Only concerns was, Vending Drinks $1.50, Gift Shops $3.20 a piece. They did not fill the machines all weekend long. Guess they figure your at the Hilton, your willing to pay twice as much. Should take out the machines if your not going to fill them. I walked every floor every Machine for Dr. Pepper. (none) I even seen a machine down by the Band Ampi-theater and two other machines on the boardwalk, both sold out. I was told that an employee had the responsibility to fill them. Well he must of been on vacation. Then while searching the floors I seen on the Fifth North Tower floor someones dog decided to relieve himself of prior dinner all over the carpet, and nobody cleaned it up! I say this, because I seen prior review comments to old carpet or sand in carpet. Out dated carpet. Its a seaside Resort. Carpet comes and goes and can look tattered if people do these things in a matter of Months. Yes, furniture was dinged up on edges. But your there for the beach. Not taking up residence like Charlie Sheen on a Binge for three months. And then you still overlook the little things. Room was clean, and house keeping was always willing to change out towels as we needed them. I have learned to keep my own room neat and clean during stays and leave the do not disturb sign on the door at all times. So I know, only we are the ones in and out and no chance of doors ever being left open by others. There was plenty of activities along the boardwalk, and different venue eateries around the resort. We suggest take a drive down to the Ponce Inlet Lighthouse in the evening and then eat at the Inlet Harbor Rest. Great place on the water and more reasonable prices for food. We go somewhere every year for our Anniversary. Now this being first year back on east coast, we will be back when we can stay longer. This is a nice family resort, and the property reflects that. If your a relative of the Hotel's namesake or think you should be, go stay at an adult only or very High Dollar place Resort where you don't have to spend your time worrying about the little things. But if your a family on a budget but want to make sure the place has everything for your family or Adult weekend get-away like my wife and I; this is the place to stay. Oh, last thing; Everyday the regular staff in passing always said hello...goodmorning...hi, I passed several Managers or mid-mangement in passing. Only two ever said one word to us. Being a Manager of such a larger facility, Management should lead by example the 10 & 2 rule. Smile 10 feet away, and greet by the 2 feet away. I always pushed it, and I always followed it myself whether front of the house or back of the house makes no difference. Maybe should try G.E.T. (G-reet; E-ye Contact; Thank for staying) See you again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Lacking the Details that Matter!”
Reviews.Author: buddhabrown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from an overnight stay at the Hilton Daytona Beach / Ocean Walk Village. Honestly speaking, from the quality and service that we've come to expect from the Hilton name we were slightly disappointed. The property itself as well as the prime location right on Daytona Beach was great. But that's where the greatness stopped. We decided to valet park as self parking was indicated as off site which we didn't want to deal with. Arrival and valet was easy enough. Our check-in experience at the front desk not that great. We waited for approximately 5 minutes. When the lady (Preeti) finally looked up and waved us over we got the impression that we were interrupting her busy day. She was about the business. No pleasantries. No real greetings. The hotel is clearly a very busy one so maybe she was burnt out from the day. However as someone who has been very loyal to Hilton this is not interaction I've grown to expect. We were upgraded to an ocean view room (as Hilton Honors Gold Members). The view was excellent. The room was subpar and out of date. The only modern looking item in the room itself was the television. The furniture was rather old and dingy looking. The carpeting (both in the room and in the hallway) is ready to be updated. The bathroom was clean enough. Water pressure was great. However the tub and shower head need to be updated in the worst way. All in all, compared to the rooms we've experienced at other Hilton properties, this room was one of the most in need of work. Oh and there is no wi-fi available in the hotel rooms themselves. Apparently it is available in the hotel common areas. But this is 2012 right? No wi-fi? We ordered room service for dessert. It was your standard room service. Decent food. Expensive. Convenient. Now lets talk about the vending machines. I'm sure I'm not the only hotel visitor who's been thirsty in the night and has attempted to visit a vending machine for a beverage. My experience attempting to get a simple bottle of water sealed this visit a definitely below expecations. My room was on the 5th floor. I walk to the vending machine to get 2 bottles of water. Everything Sold Out. No problem. I walked up the stairs to the 6th floor vending machine. Everything Sold Out. Up To the 7th floor. Sold Out. I then took the Elevator up to the 12th floor of the hotel and started with that vending machine. Every single vending machine from the 12th floor down was sold out. I eventually had to go down to the ground floor gift shop to purchase water. The title of this review indicated that the Details were lacking. It is completely unacceptable that every single vending machine from the 12th floor down at the Hilton of all places is empty on a Saturday night! I suppose I could have continued up to the 16th floor to give it a try, but wasn't I staying on the 5th floor? Should I have to hit every floor of the hotel to get a bottle of water? On Sunday morning before leaving we visited Doc Bale's on the lobby level for breakfast. It was very busy and took about 15 minutes to get seated. The buffet itself was good and extensive. While valet was good on the way in, valet out was not so good. After checking out from the room, we called down to the valet to ask for our vehicle. The attendant who answered the phone (Nick) advised me that they were very busy and that it would be about a 30 minute wait to get my car from the South Tower entrance where we initially arrived in. He told me it would be less of a wait if we walked over the the North Tower entrance valet. When we got over to the North Tower entrance, it was chaos. A lot of people were waiting for vehicles and the valet gentlemen were running around like crazy. It was either exceptionally hectic, or the valet was short staffed. It took about 20 minutes before we saw our vehicle. We were glad the visit was over and that we'd only done a one night stay. The Hilton Daytona Beach is located in one of the best spots on the beach. However from my extremely brief experience, I feel that a strong focus is needed on the customer experience. All it takes is one bad experience. This hotel would DEFINITELY not be my first choice if I were to stay in the Daytona Beach area again. I start reviewing a hotel property in my head as soon as I pull into the front. I do this so I can share my positive and negative experiences with others aiming to stay at the property. The Details Matter. This Hilton does not get that. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyantist
Reviews.Content: I was attending a business meeting at another hotel in Daytona. I arrived at 4 PM expecting to gain access to a room I had reserved only to find the hotel unable to give me a room, promising one in 30 minutes. An hour later they still dd not have a room. As I had an engagement at 5:30 I had to change into my suit in the mens room (not what I had planned). I went to my engagement and returned about 8:30. mentioning the inconvenience. They provided me with breakfast voucher and free internet. They also offered me late checkout, which was the excuse they gave for why my room was not ready upon arrival The hotel was reasonably attractive. Having read prior reviews I valet parked and had no issues with this. The area around here was very nice with the pier and attractions, including free live music in the bandshell on the beach. The area seemed very active. There were fireworks from the pier visible from the outside 2nd floor bar of the hotel. The breakfast was mediocre. I had fried eggs that were not cooked adequately. All in all, I might go back due to location, but would plan to eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect from a Hilton property.”
Reviews.Author: eholsey1
Reviews.Content: This property does not appear to be well maintained. It's in desperate need of a remodel. Bathtub had rust and black marks on the bottom. The bathroom had cracks and rust on the floor. If you're looking for a bed with a beach view, then this may work for you. But if you expect a nice clean room with modern amenities, you may want to look elsewhere. This was our 2nd stay in 2 years. We do not plan to return unless they remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Most marginal Hilton I have ever seen! Like paying for Morton's and being served Denny's !”
Reviews.Author: mcglynndon
Reviews.Content: I used to travel for a living and often stayed at Hilton properties in cities across the country. This one looks and feels like you stepped back into 1999. Carpets in halls need updating, wood in elevators needs refinishing, no wifi in rooms "but we have it in the lobby". Front desk was kind enough to give me the ethernet "code" for internet in my room. Just where do i plug that into my ipad?!?! The hotel is not bad, just not worthy of the Hilton name in its current state. Kind of like paying for a Morton's steak while being served Denny's. Don't get me wrong - I like Denny's, I just expect brands to live up to their reputation and this propert misses the mark.. I appreciate that the GM posts here, so of you read this, please share with us some details on what you are doing to bring your hotel back in line with the normal level of quality one expects when booking at Hilton? For me, I won't return until some renovations and "process improvements" take place. (I.e. wifi, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bmkennedy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a 4-night weekend trip to the beach. We booked at this hotel and were delighted! The front desk staff went over and above getting us a great room. We had the most amazing view from our balcony. We were in the South Tower and right next to the amusement park. We had a ball just sitting in our room watching the sidewalk performers and people-watching. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are spacious. Lots to do and several resturants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: PeterSchilter
Reviews.Content: Second time in Daytona Beach, first time at the Hilton. Went with my wife and daughter. We enjoyed the hotel quite a lot. The location is perfect, the rooms very nice. Valet parking is effecient and courtious, but a bit expensive. Otherwise we got a very good value for this long 4th of July stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine until we got ready to check out”
Reviews.Author: Jane H
Reviews.Content: Hotel was crowded but we were there on July 4th so I wasn't surprised. Great location to watch the fireworks. Staff was courteous. The main pool area was packed so we used the 5th floor pool. When we were packing to checkout, I looked under the bed for the kids toys and found a used condom. Needless to say I was shocked. I told the staff when I checked out. They made a note to call housekeeping. Some things I can handle but not this. Won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: WhizKelly
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and my family enjoyed it. We book a city view room but we were upgraded to a cabana ocean view suite. Hotel staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to help you. Everyone who I encounterd show real interest in talking and helping you. The location of the hotel is perfect Ocean Walk Village on one side and the Boardwalk on the other. My 9 year old daughter really loved the hotel. The downside was that the air in the excercise room was broken so it was extra hot. Nice pools, bars, spas, service, restaurants, staff, and I loved all of it.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Par Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mwitte
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for a business conference in June. The hotel front desk staff was "adequate", but certainly NOT up to "Hilton Standards". I had previewed what amenities the hotel offered before packing for this trip. The website said beach towels were available. Upon arrival, I was given the run around (about 35 minutes) to try to find ANY beach towels provided by the hotel. I finally got a hold of the housekeeping supervisor who explained to me that the prior week's group took most of their towel inventory. I asked how that had become OUR group's problem? She had no answers other than "they are on order, just use the room towels." The front desk told me that they would SELL me towels in the hotel gift shop. I ultimately DID purchase a beach towel....from a shop across the street. I have traveled all over the world to beach resorts and have NEVER encountered anything like this. One of the days, I ate lunch at the pool bar. The pool bar attendant tried to actually talk me out?!? of eating lunch there since, "I am the only one here and it would be tough for me to serve you."?!?! I assured her that I had only 1 hour for lunch and to TRY to serve me. She did...with attitude. I was also told on my first night by a front desk employee that the Hyde Park Prime Steakhouse would NOT accept me with my "casual attire" and that it was "fine dining." I was somewhat taken aback by this snippy remark as I am a person who always dresses nicely. Throughout the week I noticed people dressed far more "casually" than I and ventured into the restaurant/bar. Upon arrival I was told that I was VERY well dressed, that there was no real dress code per se AND that Hyde Park was NOT run by the Hilton. They comped me a drink for the insulting remark by your hotel staff. Having worked in the hotel business myself, I would say the ONLY people who really know the idea of "customer service" are your housekeeping staff. They were only too eager to make sure that my stay was not entirely ridiculous, and were richly rewarded both monetarily as well as through evaluations. I would encourage the GM to take a long, hard look at the front desk staff & wait staff at your hotel. Nobody appears to be happy in their jobs and THAT reflects poorly on the overall image of your hotel. Many, many things need to be looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Hair and Blood”
Reviews.Author: Greer S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton this past week for a camp meeting across the street at the convention center, when we first arrived Half of our rooms were not clean.Then when we finally got our rooms I had Hair(Pubic and regular) in our bed ( so they obviously didn't change the seats from the people before us.. It was also in our shower.Then there was trash on the balcony From the other people.One of the other rooms from our Group had BLOOD!!! On theIr Sheets!!!!! Gross right? The Maid Staff Was Extremely Rude and talked down to us all week... The staff at the front desk was also terrible..I personally WOULD NEVER STAY HERE EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!! ITS TERRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but nice resort. Not as family friendly as others.”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoJA
Reviews.Content: We went here for a conference a couple weeks ago. The website made the property look real nice, but in this case perception was not total reality. The lobby and reception area along with the conference facilities were nice and some had been redone/renovated recently. We had a cabana room since we were travelling with little ones and needed the extra space. We got the rooms for the conference special price so it was in line with what we are used to paying for a room but I would not have paid "retail" for it. As for in room amenities, there were none. The TVs were older, no microwave, and the furniture a little dated. We had to pay $10 a night for a mini fridge. In it's heyday this was a jewel on Daytona Beach, and it still had some of its old glory but the shine had faded.. Being oceanfront by the boardwalk and next to the Ocean Walk Village was really cool. Having a place to sit outside in the evenings and chat and watch fireworks and listen to the band in the band-shell was neat too. I've stayed at less pricey hotels on the beach or near the beach (like across the street) that were way nicer for the money, even some with kitchens and true "suite" layouts. This property needs some updating/modernizing to compete and regain its position. Hilton as a brand has a particular reputation and I am sure if Conrad Hilton were around to see this property he would not give it very high marks at all. Would I stay here again? Maybe, for a weekend getaway sans kiddos or if the muchkins are a little older and not in cribs and on formula. I still wouldn't pay full price though...and $20/night to park is CRAZY if you pay "retail" for the room. Check that, it's crazy period. There's more I could say to be critical but I'll stop as I read some other review about conferences and elevators and I hate redundancy.

Reviews.Title: “"Sun, Beach and Sand" Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: AngGonz
Reviews.Content: I was spending the weekend of my birthday with friends and was amazing. Excellent services starting with the valet parking and the bellman services was fast. Front desk; Prettie was so friendly and helpful. The room was nice with a spectacular ocean view. Maria from Room Service so nice took me a birthday amenite, best choc chips cookies and chocolate covered strawberries ever. Anyway it was a memorable weekend. Very nice hotel and excellent service quality.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, but that is the major redeeming quality”
Reviews.Author: Zacharys_m0m
Reviews.Content: So, I was staying here on business, not leisure. Tplease take that in mind when reading this review. First for the positive items: the view of the ocean, the valet parking, the location, the view... (again) The "you need to expect" items: queue lines for the elevators, the LONG walk from the North Tower to the reception (especially if you forgot your key), the cleaning of the room (horrible in the bathroom, as in replace towels only, NOT wiping down the counter, taking out used wash clothes from the shower and giving you new shampoos/conditioners for the next day) very noisy next to the elevator (I should know better, but again, long walk back to reception to ask for another room) If looking for view and location, then make sure you can live with average amenities for the price that you ar epaying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: work2travelflorida
Reviews.Content: We were there for a confrence but pleaslently surprised

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: sriamara
Reviews.Content: There isnt anything you would miss here. The beach is right at the door step as well as the boardwalk. As a diamond member, the breakfast is awesome with 'make to order' omlettes.Its good to be loyal to Hilton. There isnt anything you would miss here. The beach is right at the door step as well as the boardwalk. As a diamond member, the breakfast is awesome with 'make to order' omlettes.Its good to be loyal to Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Hotel right in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: pvflmom
Reviews.Content: First, have to make note that all of the employees we encountered were exceptional, going out of their way to make sure our visit met our expectations. We check in on the 3rd, wanting the perfect location to watch the 4th of July fireworks from the pier. This is the location to be thick in the middle of all of the action. I scoured this forum fretting on the room for the perfect view - north or south, etc. Then the King Terrace Suite came available. Lots of $$, but I wanted that "private" terrace to watch, away from the crowds I anticipated. When we checked in (sorry about the others who are impatient on the check-in process - it's hit or miss - we checked-in at 5:15 and only waited a few minutes) The valet showed us to our room, and like the reviewer below, we were totally underwhelmed. Suite had a bar area with microwave and refrig, sitting area with couch, etc, and separate bedroom. Not great, but adequate. The real problem was with the terrace. Stepped out to loose tiles that wobbled as we walked on it The tiles were sticky from beer/drinks (the night before??) all around disgusting. No beach view, except distant ocean - felt like we were in a dungeon. The worst part was it was shared by all of the other "lucky" terrace rooms, and we assumed anybody else who wanted to venture out on "our" terrace. Kind of scary. Management needs to get rid of these suite/rooms on the 3rd floor South. If there are any others in another part of the hotel, we couldn't locate them from the outside (we looked). But we didn't settle for this. Luckily, we checked in on the July 3rd and there were still some other regular rooms available. Brittney at the front desk listened to my complaints and gave me some options and we agreed to downgrade. Moved to a regular King oceanfront room with a regular rate. Not the suite we wanted, but, we were there for the holiday and are learning to not stress. The Hilton is still a great hotel - all of the amenities that one could want. The outside bars, inside bars, swimming pools, gift shop, restaurants, bike rental, etc. all were being utilized by the crowd. We ate breakfast and dinner on the 4th (Gloria was super nice) at the buffets, too lazy to go elsewhere. Elevators were functional and quick, except on check-out Thursday. Just avoid the 10:30 - 11:00 rush. We ended up watching the fireworks from the boardwalk - we loved the crowd, at least until the show was over. Then we retreated back to our room and watched the rest of the action through our windows. It is a shame there are no balconies, but we moved the couch in front of the window and enjoyed the view just the same, but in the comfortable a/c. All in all, we enjoyed our short trip so much we'll be back next year, but we will remember to avoid that terrace room. -

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen B
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly. Included breakfast is either buffet or off the menu. Food very good at all restaurants in Hotel. Room clean. Price a bit high. Excellant valet service. Only negatives are no fridge in room and the 'balcony' is actually a railing across the sliding glass doors. Not really a balcony at all. The ad is misleading re. that. All rooms face the ocean. Boardwalk is directly in front of Hotel with lots of activity. Easy walk to other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in Process AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Key S
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 6pm forchecking, which is at 4pm. The front staff advised us our room would not be ready until it is inspected, and we would have to sit in their lobby and wait an additional 45mins to an hour before being allowed to check-in. They stated they had one inspector that had to inspect alot of other rooms, as if this was the paying customers problem. They were not apologic not to mention the lobby was filled with others waiting. I have NEVER been to a 4-star hotel that treated their customers this way. We were livid at this hideous process, and will not be returning to this location. Although it is a very nice hotel it is not the standard of most Hiltons, but I must admit if it hadnt been for the poor check-in process I would go back in a heart beat, because you cant beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing from the bell hop to the front desk"”
Reviews.Author: aliciac18
Reviews.Content: "This Resort is a diamond in the ruff" Great Feel, Service, Food, Entertainment!!! We have already made our reservations for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: LetsGo777
Reviews.Content: 2012 Annual Couples GetAway. Hilton is a perfect place to stay. You don't have to leave the property to enjoy fun and relaxation. The beach and great dining is just a step beyond your room door. The staff is friendly and the place is well-suited for business and pleasure. Corporate event, vacation or staycation this Hilton rocks. Gina Hutchinson, Convention Service Manager, embodies quality customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Daytona Beach / Ocean Walk Village”
Reviews.Author: Pnoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our week vacation. Upon arrival, this place layed out the red carpet, but for our family, this is where our troubles began. We checked in and left our auto with the valet, who told us that our auto would be taken care of in the building we reside in. We continued to the desk to check into our oceanfront room, only to be taken to a side view room, with a great view of the pier. We went back down, a the problem was resolved, we had our oceanfront room. Now, if you look at the pictures, and think you are getting a room with a balcony, think again. The rooms have a big window that opens with bars in front of it... No Balcony!! Being it was to late to leave, we cut our loss. The room itself, needs to be closed!! They have old beds, one of ours broke halfway thru the night, old TV sets, which we could not use for some time because they could not get us a controler that worked, but finally fixed some hours later, and the bathrooms are very small with old showers with low water pressure. The musty smell in the room was very strong, and takes some getting use too. Upon check out, we could not call the valets, like we were told to do, in order to get our auto. We go down to leave, and stand outside and wait 20 minutes for our auto. When we ask about it, they tell us that the deck in our building was full, and they had taken our auto somewhere else to park it, and we payed for this service, what a shock!! In closing, I would like to say... Soliders beware!! I was not told, but I will tell you... There are fireworks outside your room at night if you are oceanfront!! I found this out in the middle of a deep sleep!! I went for cover, it was intense until I figured out what was going on!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JanetC6282011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the JROTC Nationals Drill Competition for a second year in a row. The hotel was outstanding at handling the massive amount of students while still treating the other guests not associated with the competition very well. Everyone, from the front desk clerks, restaurant personnel, cleaning staff, etc. made the stay very enjoyable. The rooms are always kept in tip-top shape, the food in the restaurants is outstanding and the location of the hotel, being right on the beach, was outstanding! The pool, work out room and entire place has such a wonderful atmosphere. The bed in the room is probably the most comfortable bed I've slept in away from home. This is my second year in a row staying at this hotel during this event and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, clean, fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people work at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Togabill
Reviews.Content: We got a very special deal on this hotel. Not sure what to expect when we arrived. They could not have been nicer. The check-in reservationist (Ms Peetrie) was extremely helpful. Even though we used the self park option the valets were very helpful with information. The cleaning ladies went out of their way to help us. By far it was the best hotel experience we have had. They seemed to really care we enjoyed our stay. Our thank you to them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Daytona Ocean Walk last week and it was a wonderful experience. The accommodations, views and surrounding beach were all fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: pwebb11
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful. The reason I gave it a 4 was that I was surprised that the bed wasn't that great and I don't think the bedding was what I would expect from a Hilton. Stepping out to the beach was breath taking. I was at a conference and all the accomodations were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very dated place and should not bear the name "Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: mlagomasino
Reviews.Content: I travel every week for business, this time I chose the Hilton Daytona Beach Resort. I went outside my corporate travel agency since they required a deposit for reservation and in addition I was offered an upgrade to oceanview for a minimum price. I got a corner room on the10th floor in the South Tower. I had not been here in along while. The room looked clean and bedding smelled clean but, upon takin a closer look; my balcony opened to the Theme park which was operating to late hours at night. One of the sinks in the bathroom was craked. the rug dirty. The entertainment cabinet has the oldest TV set I have seen in a few years. I called the front desk, and complained about the overall condition of this room. The receptionist said that next time I should ask for a room in the North Tower, since they were remodeled. Since when do I have to ask? If I am part of the Hilton Honors Program!! I expect for you to know me as a loyal customer. She mentioned the deal bargain I got at the web site of $145.00 plus tax per night. I explained that the rate was not a deciding factor for me to choose a hotel. I chose a full service Hilton and I expected to pay that amount and more, but with that name I expected service and quality. She said she will give me a rate of $114.00 plus tax which I got, plus valet parking of $20.00 per night. Really? this place and in this condition is NOT worth even that price! I do not intent to come back to this property. In case you wonder my HH Member No. 369164543. I am glad I have options when traveling! This would not be my option again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: pletzkeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach Resort at Ocean Walk located on Atlantic Avenue. Our room was an ocean front, so we enjoyed our view of the ocean. The hotel staff are very nice and accommodating. The rooms are in need of a room lift, but are nice. Our room was large with a large bathroom and upscale linens. The hotel is in a great location, on the beach, and walking distance to shops and restaurants. I’ve been to Daytona Beach many times for Race Week and the Daytona 500, but this was my first time staying at the Hilton. Since we are Hilton elite status, we had complimentary breakfast and internet. There is a charge for self parking of $12 per day. We chose to valet park for $19 per day.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: gina v
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we stay bi-annually at in Daytona to relax and get away from our crazy work hours. And, we've stayed at this Hilton before and really loved it... but this time.... First off we got there and had to wait almost an hour, so a good 45 minute wait to check in. There was no method for this as there were like 4 areas that led up to the huge check in desk and people just kept popping in from different sides. Aggravating to say the least. Sometimes clerks would just stand next to someone else while everyone was backed up waiting waiting. Sometimes they would call someone at the head of a rogue, newly formed line, argggh. Finally we were told by the desk clerk our room wasn't ready? Hey, check in is at 4:00, we got there after calling with a confirmed reservation at a little before 5 and at 6 something, no room at the inn? No mention of sorry, comping this or that, just give me your cell # and we'll call you when it's ready, sit out in the lobby? No thank you, said to the clerk, umm, let me see your manager. Was then given a room pretty quickly but not the room we had originally reserved altho both were ocean front. Small room. No balcony on any of these we have had or could see btw, just sliding glass doors and a lean over, you get the picture. Hubby works in housing biz, bad caulking, low low pressure on shower at all hours, shower head height for very short people, carpet in room semi-dirty, rip in bedspread? C'mon, we are paying for a premium room here, guys! Will say some staff very nice, spa ladies who gave us massages, room service lady, valet guys, etc. However, what is up with housekeeping? Left at 11 one day, back around almost 3, cart had advanced a few rooms down hall and our room still not done (no, no sign of do not disturb on room door). Nice lady though and we vacated while she cleaned and we went to read downstairs. Here's another thing we were told by someone there as we waited on something else downstairs at one point in our trip ~ there's a staff cafeteria downstairs and at around 11 ish all the housekeepers jam the cafeteria and the rooms sometimes don't get done even during peak times when rooms are in demand. Ok.... We were told this by a person from a downstairs dept, and they were telling us this freely and unsolicited, that they got minimum wage and that they did get one free meal from the hotel, one of their few perks. They complained about housekeeping being so slow. Their words, not ours. Day of check out we called down front and to the bell captain a total of 6 times letting it ring 30 times each time at least. No answer. Finally we shlepped all our luggage downstairs, no cart, no help, and saw an almost empty front desk and staff just talking with each other up front? We went out and were scolded a bit, although a nice person again, but we asked why we didn't call the number on our 19 dollar a night valet parking ticket? It wasn't explained though that way to us, it was just a 4 digit number on our ticket. I had tried to ring the bell captain and front desk repeatedly I explained. So even though this guy WAS working, surprisingly at this hotel, we were put off a bit as he kept harping on how come we didn't call. By this time, we had fumes coming out of our ears. BTW, there was some kind of church camp group there who roamed freely at all hours. The pool (probably not this group) had a couple pretty openly copulating on the steps of the pool one afternoon (they thought they were unnoticed though and glared at anyone trying to use the steps to actually go swim in the pool). Anywho, the church group banged on our connecting door at one point in the afternoon and tried the door, and then howled outside downstairs by the clock tower way after 11 or more that night. Did I mention fun yet? No goodbyes really as the desk staff never acknowledged us on our way out and after charging us quite a pretty penny for quite a few nights. Just the scolding over our expensively housed car and us leaving and not looking back really. So a true good bye wasn't necessary until now. Goodbye, Hilton Ocean Walk Daytona Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RamblinGal11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North tower, on the side facing away from the ocean. Online, it looked like it would be a great place to stay while on vacation. However, the room we stayed in was otherwise; it was narrow and cramped, the bathtub wouldn't properly fill and empty water, and the toilet took some effort to flush-- overall, the main utilities of the room were in very poor-functioning condition. I'll also ad that the hallways were dirty; there were dark stains dotted on the carpet and the place looked dusty and dirty. We also had people in the next room who were extremely loud and disruptive during the nighttime, and it took us a few hours before hotel staff would finally do anything about them.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, Remove your name...”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler2011
Reviews.Content: This property should be dropped like a hot potato by Hilton. The only good thing it has going is the staff. Most of them are amazing. But the property is in major disrepair and needs extreme updating. It is in a prime location, but is also run down and not as clean as it should be. See the pictures...I never attach pictures, but this time it was a must.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: taniguck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a two day conference and I thought that for the most part, the hotel was very good. At check-in, our group was greeted in a friendly manner and the receptionist pretty much bent over backwards trying to get us four rooms located on the same floor. I wish I had the girl's name because she gave our group superior service. The room, located in the south tower, was okay. My one gripe is that the TV cabinet and the television are severely dated. I understand you don't come to this hotel to watch TV in your room but I expected higher quality from Hilton. When the TV is turned on, has white lines running across the screen which may be distracting to some. Access to the beach is excellent and there are also plenty of shops/restaurants nearby. The parking is located about 2 blocks from the hotel but it didn't seem very far. In case you were wondering, it's located at the corner of Auditorium/Grandview streets. We had trouble finding it even after getting directions from the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Bartimus
Reviews.Content: We had 2 adjoining rooms. The couch in one room was filthy and disgusting. Both chairs were well stained. The bathrooms were not cleaned very well. I made the mistake of taking the stairs down to the lobby, instead of the elevator, the bottom landing of the stairwell contained numerous piles of garbage and used towels that looked like they had been there for months.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellen p
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel on June 4 and will be back again. Yes, the hotel might be a little dated but this Hilton is situated in a really fun location right in front of the bandstand on Daytona Beach! The staff were extremely pleasant. The only downside was the self-parking across the street -- the exit gate was not functioning and guests were not able to exit and it is quite a hike to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: klh0376
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend of june 9 and will be back again! We arrived early Saturday and immediately greeted by valet to park our car ( valet was $19 vs $12 self parking across the street -we choose valet for the convenience.... You can call from your room and they will have your car waiting for you in the tower you are staying.....with the ac cranking!! Big plus bc as we all know florida is HOT! A mere few bucks difference was worth every penny. You can come and go as many times as you need per day at the same price The guys we're also very quick any time we needed our car. We arrived really early, around 10 and check out isn't until noon- another big plus since you won't want to leave anyhow- but the bell staff stored our bags and front desk promised to call me and put a rush on our room! Wish I had her name but she was very nice and answered all my questions in details without making me feel rushed even though there was a line behind me. Throughout my stay and prior to my arrival I spoke to a very friendly front desk manager named Brook on several occasions who made sure every aspect of our stay was perfect. Very courteous and professional and truly an asset to this hotel!! We headed to the beach and although we had brought chairs decided to use a local rental company called Oceanwalk Beach Services that had everything we would need to have a great time. They had it all! Bikes, boogie boards, chairs, umbrellas... Spoke with a guy named Derek who was super helpful and also the rest of his staff very friendly. ( message me for contact info). They had our chairs and umbrella set up and reserved both days for us right where we requested them. Great job guys. I would definitely recommend using them to take the hassle put of having to lug your own chairs and stuff back and forth every day..... Well worth the money and affordable!!!! Our room was ready shortly after noon- thanks again for putting that rush on our room!! We booked a cabana suite that was on the ground floor and easy access to the beach. The room had an open porch with chairs right on the deck of the ground level which is what we needed due to frequent trips back n forth to refill my strawberry piña colada! Yum! No having to wait for elevators ! We were on the North tower right next to the ocean walk which had live free entertainment at night in the amphitheater. The room also had a living area with pull out sleeper sofa and bedroom with 2 queens in the bedroom. The only drawback was I wish the French doors to the bedroom had curtains for a little privacy from the kids. The bathroom had a private dressing area with sink and then connected to a full bathroom. Housekeeping was awesome!!! If you're in a cabana suite you have to call for ice and they were on top of any requests we had and everything was brought quickly. We also had a small drip coming from a vent and maintenance was in the room within 10 minutes and had the issue resolved quickly. On departure, Kofi the bellman, was also very pleasant! Gave us a few hints I wish we had known at the beginning but good to know for our next trip!! Super friendly. Overall, this was a great hotel, the room was very clean and had plenty of staff around to ask questions if you needed help. Everyone was courteous and seemed eager to help. Oh and on a side note.... DO NOT EAT OR ORDER FROM GIOVANNI'S PIZZA! This place was a joke. What a waste. Just eat at the hotel or use the Oceanwalk which is right next door! Any questions feel free to message me!!

Reviews.Title: “great location terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: jan p
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel june 2-3. Long wait to check in. When we got to our room there is no balcony as advertised. room was very dated and there was mold in the shower. Pool bar was nice albeit rude help and overpriced food. Doc bales had friendly staff but 60.00 for 2 people for breakfast was a bit pricey. tried numerous times to get service in sports bar but staff was busy with one another and ignoring guests. For the money we payed we will not return to this property if ever in Daytona again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay when visiting Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: sallyjowv
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this hotel from 5/29-5/31. Our room was in the south tower overlooking the beach. Pros: *The hotel was not busy while we were there and we appreciated the fact that the front desk granted us an early check-in and a late check-out. That said, it felt like we were there during the off season. The ice cream shop was closed. The kitchen facilities at the outdoor pool area were closed. The carpet was being replaced in parts of the lobby level. *We liked the swimming pool area which is both an indoor and outdoor pool, although the visual obstruction between those two areas made it difficult to watch our children. That would not be a problem for people with older kids. The bar was very convenient to the pool which is always nice. :) *The valet parking attendants were very helpful with suggestions for places to eat, etc. *This was our first trip to Daytona Beach. My impressions are that the sand was incredibly soft and not too hot to walk on. There was a beach equipment rental service right behind the hotel. We spent $30 to rent 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella for the day and another $20 on two boogie boards for the kids. *The hotel is right next to a shopping center that has restaurants and a movie theater. Our kids loved Bubba Gump's. *The kids also enjoyed the casual dining at the hotel's sports bar. Cons: *We were surprised not to have WiFi in our room. *Our room felt dated. The closet door was missing a piece of hardware and would not open and close properly. The plate around the shower handle was cracked. *From the photos, we thought that we would have a balcony. The room does have sliding doors and a railing but there is no balcony. *The rooms are not equipped with refrigerators although they were available for rental. Our daughter was taking an antibiotic that had to be refrigerated. A complimentary refrigerator should have been included at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: LRHJ
Reviews.Content: I spent Saturday and Sunday night Memorial Day weekend! It was wonderful! Great room - South Tower - loved that our bed faced the walled window/balcony! Great bandshell entertainment just a stroll away - Sat night. Every person had a smile! When the showers came on Sunday - I really appreciate the hard working worker running around the pool deck with fresh dry warm towels - after every Florida rainshower!!!!!!! Very cool! Brunch on Sunday was excellent! Will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A Lot of Buck With NO Bang!”
Reviews.Author: DwaBoink
Reviews.Content: Where to start, where to start. Check in was a disaster. Reservations for one night on HHonors and one night paid. What a fiasco!!! Had to totally separate both reservations which started the whole ball of problems. Was told I would have to rekey my room key the next morning because they could not key my room for the two consecutive nights even though I was staying in the same lousy room. After checking in only one key would work so I had to go back downstairs and key the cards again. Parking was a hassle because you never knew where to pick up your car; Norrth Tower vs South Tower. Even if you called in advance they would never tell you where our car would be coming out. For $19 per night you would think their parking was a little better. Restaurants were way overpriced and food was below average. No wifi in the rooms although they said there was. No frig in the room although they said there was. Very disappointed with this stay and probably will not go back and waste my points on this joint. You guys need to get it together because word may get out that Hilton is a subpar hotel in Daytona. Nice location, terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is not the reason to stay; Price of parking is ridiculous.”
Reviews.Author: AirForceTraveler
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping at hotels in Daytona is terrible. Smoke Free property advertisement is incorrect - just inside the room - if you wish to use the deck or pool you will get lung cancer in a day from all the chain smokers hanging on every crevice. Cig butts in fountains, entry ways , etc - gross. Location is great but you will be charged to death for everything. There is NO balcony just bars at a sliding door- refered to as a balcony by staff

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Ryan K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton the last weekend of April for the State AAU Gymnastics Meet. We should have known it would be a challenging stay from the difficulty that started when I tried to make a reservation. It took four separate phone calls to finally find a reservationist that cared enough to take the time to determine why the AAU Gymnastics code would not work online or even pull up through the reservation line. After about a 30 minute phone call the reservation was finally set. When we arrived about 6 PM there were so many cars waiting to pull into valet that we would line up down N. Atlantic Blvd about a block. If the hotel is sold out, then they should expect a large crowd for valet and provided the necessary staff to handle the arriving guest. Our room was a city view room, which is what we paid for and expected. The furnishings were dated and the room had a very musty smell. Food options are plentiful on site, but unless you want to pay $20+ per person for breakfast or lunch, just walk across the street or down the block for several reasonable opitons. The staff in the coffee shop was rude and even waited on customers while listening to music on ipods (with earphones in). If I am paying $60 for 4 sandwiches at lunch, at least give me your undivided attention! This lack of attention/customer focus played out throughout our stay and was experienced by nearly ever family in our group. As a Platinum Member of two other hotel chains, I will not stay at this resort in the future. I will drive further down the street and pay $10 to park each day at the convention center rather than pay the $17 per day to stay at the Hilton and walk across the street to the convention center. Location is not everything and this hotel needs to learn that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Memorial Day weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie K
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the DB Hilton (we usually stay at the Plaza Resort/Spa). We (3 adults, 2 teenagers) chose a cabana, which is on the beach level. 2 queen beds in one room, a pull-out sofa in the "living room". This is by far my favorite set-up, and we will definitely choose the cabanas from now on; they are so easily accessible from the ocean, and it's great not to have to traipse through a lobby wet & sandy, carrying all your wet towels. There are 3 types of patio areas on the cabanas: uncovered, 1/2 covered, and fully covered.
