There are only 4 fully covered patios (120-124), and had we known that when I called in the reservation (perhaps the reservation agents should mention the choices, because I reserved months in advance), I would have picked one of them. We got an uncovered patio, but since Tropical Storm Beryl decided to visit for the last 1/2 of our vacation, we would have enjoyed a larger covered patio. Pros: I've read previous reviews saying this Hilton was awful...I'll just say I don't know how pretentious those folks were, but I've stayed in many 4-5 star hotels, and this DB Hilton was really very nice. It IS a beach hotel...therefore, the floors are sometimes wet & sandy. The bell hops were fabulous (Chase moved us in & out, he was fast & courteous!), the valet attendants were quick (every time you get your vehicle, they ask if you need directions), and the bartenders at the poolside bar were friendly. In cabana rooms, you have to call housekeeping for ice; they deliver as many bags as you request, free of charge, which is awesome for your coolers...and they are FAST. We had to call housekeeping for extra towels & blankets, and they were fast too. Cons: * The light & ceiling fans in both rooms operate off a wall switch. The light cord is super short, so if you want to turn the light off & leave the ceiling fan run, you have to pull a chair over to stand on, to pull the light cord. * An in-room safe would be great, as well as a mini-fridge/microwave combo, at least in the suites, since they are already set up with the dining area. * This is a beach hotel, and the weather is important when you're planning your day. It would be nice if the tv satellite package included The Weather Channel (probably more sensitive to this because of the TS). * Daily housekeeping is a bit slow. Our room was done late in the afternoon, when we were coming in from the beach, and trying to shower for dinner. The last day, we actually went & found her to ask for clean towels; we told her to skip our room altogether, because it was too late. * I guess it's nice that the DB Hilton allows you to bring pets, but there seemed to be lots of dogs in the cabanas. There is a large grassy area in-between the hotel & the boardwalk, and lots of kids (including our youngest son) wanted to play frisbee, etc., in the area, but that also happens to be where all the hotel guests walk their dogs. It would be nice to have a specific designated "Pet Walk" area for people who choose to vacation with animals. In all, it was a great Memorial Day weekend, and I will be making reservations for a cabana room for the Labor Day weekend as well. Of course things are pricey: it's a tourist destination, and it's a Hilton. Occasionally, the floors are damp or sandy: it's at the beach. Yes, our room had tube televisions instead of flat-screens: they still carried the same channels. Maybe I'm just a glass-half-full kind of person, but our family really enjoyed the DB Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay by the ocean”
Reviews.Author: James F
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hilton. Friendly staff, very fast valet service (although a little pricey), and a beautiful facility. As a Hilton HHonors VIP, we were given the option to upgrade to a pool view for free, or to an ocean view for a hefty price. We took the complimentary upgrade to the pool view, and were pleased to find out that the ocean is just on the other side of the pool! Our standard king room was spacious, clean and comfortable. We will return to this hotel next time we are in Daytona Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your walking shoes.”
Reviews.Author: shoeboxrick
Reviews.Content: This is probably the most poorly laid out hotel I have ever stayed at. The hotel has 2 entries, north and south, I'm guessing about 1/4 mile apart. My room was in the south tower and the vehicle valet is in the north tower. You are walking constantly. There are 4 restaurants in the hotel and it's almost impossible to figure out when they are open or closed. The first time I got my car out of valet it took 24 minutes. No explanation was given. I like Hilton's but I'm staying away from this one. I go to hotels to relax not go hiking.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel that Hides It's Qualities”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: This was an interesting visit, in May 2012 to Daytona Beach. The hotel is a modern facility, significantly more upscale than the Cocoa Beach Hilton from which I had just come. The lobby is bright and glamorous, with valet parking and helpful bellhops. Check-in was fast, the elevators worked well and are surprisingly large (big groups, I guess). Our upgraded room ($179 with ocean view) overlooked the boardwalk and amusement rides, which was interesting, and also faced the Kennedy Space Center where we watched a launch at 3am about 80 miles to the south-east. Very cool. The rooms were a little smaller than I expected, and the bathroom definitely was on the cramped side. But everything was clean, worked well, no mold in the showers, luggage rack in the closet and -- surprise -- windows that opened, onto a tiny balcony. A real treat to listen to the ocean waves all night. The town of Daytona Beach is a bit of a jumble, with souvenir shops and tacky restaurants all mixed in with nicer establishments. The beach is QUITE nice, better than Cocoa Beach in my mind. And there's a scattering of amusement park rides that at a busier time of year probably would have been a lot of fun for people-watching. The most interesting aspect of this hotel is what they don't tell you. For example, there are numerous bars and lounges in the lobby, but you have to go hunting for them. There's a Starbucks in the front of the hotel, at street level, but no signs to point you there. And there's a fabulous steak house at the north end of the hotel where we would have very much enjoyed dining, but didn't learn about it until after our dinner. So they need to do a better job publicizing their amenities -- they're probably are more which I never uncovered before check-out. The hotel is a $15-20 cab ride from the Daytona Beach Airport, and cabs are plentiful. I'd recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TabuJupiter
Reviews.Content: Just checked out yesterday after 2 nights stay. Very disappointing Hilton for service. Yes, as others stated the staff are polite,but when they ask if everything is okay they apparently don't really want any feedback. One of the most frustrating situations is the parking issue. You have a choice from self parking (lot a block away) in a not great location where you may wonder about the safety of your vehicle or valet for $19/day plus tip whenever you want access to your car. the self park had no spots available so we did the valet. you pull up at the south but apparently they move your car to the north valet. when leaving we called for luggage assistance and were told it would be 45 mins. so we schlepped our multiple luggage from where we were in the south tower to the north and then after notifying before leaving room to have car ready had to wait another 30 minutes for the care. yes the rooms are tired and need to be redone. gold member - no upgrade - tv didn't work was replaced, etc.etc.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: I have to admit after reading all the negative reviews here I almost changed my hotel reservations to a different hotel. I'm glad I didn't. My family and I had a wonderful time. Everyone we met was extremely polite and helpful - the valet staff, the front desk, the wait staff at the restaurant, and the cleaning staff. The oceanfront rooms are a must with stunning views of the Ocean. And the hotel is centrally located. As to all the comments about the hotel being a bit "worn" well that's probably true, but you have to realize this is an extremely busy beachfront hotel with high turnover. Spring break, bike weeks, race fans, vacationers, etc., etc. There will be a little wear and tear here and there. The hotel is going through renovations so things should improve. So all in all I would recommend this hotel for vacationers who want prime access to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean and beach views that are breath taking!”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: A recent conference in Daytona Beach took me to this area and the Hilton Daytona Beach. I was excited to be in Florida with warm and beautiful weather during my week stay! A few years ago I was invited to Daytona Beach to explore the possibility of bringing meetings to the area. At the time, the hotel was flagged as an Adam’s Mark. Several years ago it was rebranded to a Hilton. This is a very large hotel, located directly across Atlantic Avenue from the Ocean Center (convention center and arena), and Peabody Auditorium. The hotel itself can accommodate various size meetings. The hotel does not have shuttle service to/from the airport but there are private companies and taxis that offer airport to hotel service for approximately $18. The airport is just minutes to the hotel. I was greeted by very professional and friendly staff at the HiltonHhonors line (no waiting in the other long lines) and was off to my room in the south tower in just a few minutes. I had breakfast coupons and everything I needed for my week in Florida. My room was two double beds as no king bedrooms were available, even with my gold Honors status. There was a large group at the hotel which no doubt used many of the rooms. My guest room was showing a need for a refresh, and a bit cramped with two beds. However, the spectacular and most incredible view of the beach and ocean quickly made up for any room needs. I enjoyed the mornings rising to beautiful sunrises, and the beach. The beds were very comfortable and typical Hilton beds. The bathroom was a bit small and compact but adequate. The one problem I encountered a few days was the terrible water pressure. Later in the week it seemed to improve. I must say the staff at this hotel is superb! They greet you in the public areas and ask if they can help you with anything, or will direct you to where you need to go. One afternoon I arrived back at my room and noticed it had not been cleaned. A quick call to the hotel guest services promptly resolved the issue. I was very impressed with the hotel staff; they are some of the best in the industry. I was very impressed with the front desk/check-in staff and how helpful and friendly they were! Great people!! The breakfast coupons entitle one to the full buffet or you may order from the menu. The buffet was very good and offered the typical morning breakfast fare. Knowing I did not want or need to eat so much for breakfast each morning I opted for the menu selections on several days. The restaurant staff at “Doc Bale’s Grill” were top notch and very attentive! This venue is only open for breakfast from what I could tell. I must say the breakfast buffet seemed a bit on the high-price side at $19.95 per person. However, it does come with beverage choices and all-you-can-eat. Over all my stay was incredibly great! In fact, I had a hard time leaving! The weather, paired with being on the beach is just a bit of paradise! Other related comments about the Daytona Beach area. The Ocean Walk Village is located directly next to the Hilton, and is a complex of two hotels (including the Hilton and Wyndham) and shops. I must say this “shopping” complex is nothing more than a collection of fast-food style restaurants, with a couple retail shops. I was disappointed in what it had to offer. The shops along Atlantic Avenue are your typical beach/surfing shops that cater to the tourists. If you’ve seen one, you’ve seen them all as each offers the same basic line of “tourist trinkets” and clothing. If you are searching for anything in the line of local art/craft/photography, you are not going to find it along the beach area shops. Overall, my experience in Daytona Beach and at the Hilton was great! For a destination to relax and kickback, and enjoy the weather and beach, this is it! If you have a car, Orlando is just an hour away.

Reviews.Title: “"HAIR "”
Reviews.Author: wheats12
Reviews.Content: Great service, awful dirty room.Hair included. Great location,but for a being a HILTON very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are dirty...”
Reviews.Author: Ccioni
Reviews.Content: The lobby, restaurants and pools are really beautiful. The Hyde Park Restaurant was fantastic! The rooms and the housekeeping are a different story. Our first room had a broken closet door and the tub was dirty! We asked to change rooms but did not get anything better. The room was still not very clean and can you believe it- the doors were broken on the closet!! When housekeeping did " clean" the room it consisted of changing sheets and giving us new towels. Bathroom was not cleaned , trash cans were not emptied.. Just terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Amenities, Just stay out of the Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sawinn
Reviews.Content: The Good Hilton Daytona Beach sits right on the Atlantic coast and the views are breath-taking! In addition to the beach the hotel resides on Atlantic Ave. the main strip along Daytona Beach, so there's plenty of shopping and nightlife to partake in. While at the hotel I enjoyed a wonderful filet at Hyde Park Steakhouse and a couple of drinks at Legends Sports Bar. Overall the hotel offers plenty of amenities for a comfortable stay. The Bad Like many "beach front resorts" my room was in rough shape. The room was aged and wasn't up to the standards that i've come to expect from a Hilton property. The walls are thin, so I had to listen to my neighbors TV for most of the night. There was a large crack in the wood above my sliding glass door. The shower head was clogged, and the air-condition didn't keep the room cold. The bed was ok (i've had better, i've had worse), but the new "Square" style pillows were VERY uncomfortable!. The Conclusion If you're headed to Daytona Beach for fun in the sun and don't plan on staying in your room, this could be the perfect hotel for you. If you're a business traveler who has morning to evening sessions and won't be in your room much, this could be the perfect hotel for you. If your the kind of traveler who likes to spend time in your room working or relaxing, you may want to consider a different option.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanview stay-cation!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon S
Reviews.Content: From the moment I contacted the hotel till the day of departure each and every staff member was polite, kind, and willing to go the extra mile to make sure my wife had a spectacular Mothers Day weekend. The Pelican Bar is extremely fun and goes hand in hand with the really trendy inside/outside connecting pool. Two hot tubs were very useful as well.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hilton and Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: PalmTreeNetwork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for 2 nights in April. At check in were treated special and this made us feel welcome. It was our first time to Daytona Beach and we loved it. Driving onto the beach........wow. Lovely beach, boardwalk and piers. There are some cheesy Shops on the strip but that's what makes it interesting. We went shopping to the mall and walked around the beach area. Went the the onsite steak house and loved it. Room was great with a spectacular floor to ceiling ocean view. Bed was great to sleep on and bathroom was lovely. It does so live up to the Hilton Brand. Can't think of anything negative as things went smoothly and the hotel was very clean. Had breakfast and it was very good with a bit of variety including smoked Salmon. Service throughout the hotel including the pool bar was excellent. Valet parking great. The property was large and includes access to a small shopping and dining area including a cinema. Beautiful architecture built into the complex. Would certainly stay here and would recommend to my best friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay great location and views. Friendly staff and fabolus beds

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: GeoAustin2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on April 28-30, 2012. The check-in was easy, but there were loads of cars in the valet parking area and it was kind of chaotic. We checked in on one end of the hotel and then had to drive down to the other end to park. The valets and bell boys were great! The room was on the 11th (top) floor and we had a view of the parking garage. I was disappointed that we weren't on the beach side with the view. There are very tiny balconies in these rooms. The restaurants are really pricey but you are within walking distance to Dunkin Donuts, Burger King, Starlite Diner and the Ocean Walk Village restaurants. They are always full of people! The beach is beautiful- it is wide and the Boardwalk is well maintained. The rooms were nice and clean. They removed one of the chairs in the room to make room for a refrigerator to keep my insulin cool. The refrigerator had seen better days! The beds were comfortable and the shower was nice. There were plenty of elevators moving all the time. All in all it was a nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Typical crappy Hilton but with a view”
Reviews.Author: srqbaby
Reviews.Content: First of all, Daytona Beach is a destination that should be reserved for college spring break or a Harley convention. My 7 year old summed it up perfectly as we drove into town "this place looks like a garbage dump." We had to go for a gymnastics meet and this was our best option. Per usual for a Hilton property, it looks decent from the outside. The staff are friendly, albeit not polished. However the bones of the property might as well be Motel 6. The walls were paper thin and we heard everything throughout the night. Additionally, the fan on the a/c made a noise as loud as a truck coming through the room--all night long. Of course it didn't happen while we were awake and could have addressed it. In fairness, I didn't bring it up to the management because we had to be at the meet at 8:00am and didn't have time. Of course we did have time to "enjoy" the disgusting breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs that tasted and looked like something all together different. My coffee was served by a very friendly man with dirty finger nails and blood dripping down his face--literally. The view from our room was beautiful and the only other saving grace was the Hyde Park Steakhouse on the property. Needless to say, we will not be returning here unless absolutely necessary and I believe this is the nicest property in DB.

Reviews.Title: “nice view”
Reviews.Author: simplyserious01
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. Check-in was easy; we were upgraded to a room with a view. Booked through hotwire while were passing through Daytona. It's a big hotel with a pool, fitness center,business center and restaurant I didn't have a chance to try it all out because we were only there for only one night. The grounds are well kept plus it's right on the beach. I went to sleep with a great view and woke up to a great view. Check out the seafood restaurant a few doors down it was recommend from one of the locals and the food was very good. Clean room, nice plush robes, No balcony but great view of the ocean, Parking is not free (can’t remember the price). Close to a lot of things like restaurants store etc. Traveled with my 16 year old daughter. all in all very pleasant stay, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Beautiful Beach!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to do a long weekend to Florida and decided to stay 3 nights in Daytona Beach! This was my first trip to Daytona and my wife’s 3rd and both of our first times at this Hotel. The hotel is located conveniently close to the convention center and Ocean Walk (an area with restaurants and shops). The beach is beautiful and we had a decent view from our room (recommend an ocean front room). It is a very large hotel with two separate towers, a few restaurants, and a relatively large pool. The fitness room is above average for what I have seen at other properties (it looks like it has been updated within the past couple years). Now the down sides: The hotel is in some major need for renovations. Our room was “ok” however there was a pretty foul odor in the bathroom when we first got there (kind of like a musty basement) and everything in the room was very damp due to the humidity in the air. You have to pay for parking every night of your stay. Which I can understand during “peak” seasons, but we traveled there in February during a non-busy week. The card that they provided us for the parking lot never worked when we wanted to swipe out of the lot. We constantly needed to call the hotel and have them open the gate for us. We received 3 replacement cards while we were there and each of them gave us problems. The swimming pool area needs some updating and the pool was pretty dirty with lots of stuff floating around (there did not seem to be anyone maintaining it properly). The area that the hotel is located in seems to be pretty safe, but a few blocks away from the hotel seems to be a little shady. Overall, we have to say the hotel itself is very average and in need for renovations. The beach itself is beautiful. Given that there are very few “name brand” hotels in the Daytona Beach area, this is probably your best choice, but only because of the selection of other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on the beach”
Reviews.Author: robcoppock
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the beach. This is a very nice hotel on the beach. Nice rooms. There are only two negatives 1 no wifi, 2 no balconys,the door opens to a guardrail.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia K
Reviews.Content: We took our grand kids for a one night stay during Spring Break and just loved the hotel and location. They wanted to stay longer and can't wait to go back again. The hotel staff was so pleasant and accommodating. They allowed us an early check-in and late check-out and honored any request we made quickly and efficiently. The hotel may be a little worn for Hilton standards, but for a hotel directly on the beach it is expected. Absolutely can't beat the location. We parked the car and walked everywhere we needed to go. Already planning a trip back with the grand kids in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Terirphjd
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach and next to the Boardwalk (a small amusement area with carnival type rides). Can't get a better oceanfront view than this Hilton Hotel. The room itself was only above average. It was very clean and it looked like some updates had been done. New granite top sinks and they added an extra sink outside the shower area which was very convenient. Don't expect to watch too much TV from your room. Old style TV with bad reception and very few channels. Also no WiFI in the room. The staff was very nice and the breakfast buffet, while expensive ($19.95) was very good. We received complimentary breakfast coupons and free valet parking because my husband was there for a corporate event. Daytona Beach is not a very upscale area but this hotel tries hard to bring the class up to the area. I would stay here again.,

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for this type of property.”
Reviews.Author: tlhighfield
Reviews.Content: I'll say we were not expecting much after reading the TA reviews, but it was not as bad as we expected. Yes rooms are dated but they are clean, with old tube TVs and carpets are worn and sometimes sandy but you certainly cannot beat the location if you are attending an event at the convention center. Once you park ($12 self in lot across street) you can walk to everything including restaurants/Starbucks etc Front desk checkin was efficient friendly and informative. The pelican bar near the pool (not big for such a large property) served good drinks and had a nice selection of food choices. The beach was clean with rental chairs and umbrellas available. All in all an okay place, but def not worth $189 a night!

Reviews.Title: “What an Amazing Beach Location...you have to check it out!”
Reviews.Author: Vacaqueen042
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and the beach was fantastic. This place is a must see and do when in Daytona Beach. Everything is right there. The beach, restaurants, coffee and ice cream shop. Go sightseeing and don't forget the boardwalk. This is a all-in-one hotel! The staff members were always welcoming and pleasant. Our group/family definitely enjoyed our stay. We will be going back again soon and staying longer! Thanks Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Horror”
Reviews.Author: pinkham39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton on Daytona Beach 4/3-4/7/2012. Checked in late at night in ocean view room, but had pre-picked the opportunity to upgrade to an ocean front room if available. Got to our room and found the biggest ferris wheel ever just outside our window, allong with some other ride that required two very tall, red, lit up steel somethings. We chose to go with the upgrade, but ended up moving just down the hall and had the same view in a little bit of a larger room. Stayed in that room for the night but requested a room change the next morning as we were told we could do that. We were finally moved to the 11th floor, dead center, ocean front which made us very happy. This is a very busy area, near the boardwalk end of DB. Its great for people that like the night life and noise late at night that comes with it. Evidently the fair setting is a new attraction, which happened to be next to the Hilton. Unfortunately it detracts from the hotel itself. The rooms were great, although the second room seemed as though it had fleas according to my partner. They were cleaned daily and all amenities restocked. We had breakfast there the first morning. It was rather unorganized, cold, etc, and very pricey. It was the last meal we ate there. The hotel itself must do a great business. There were people checking in/out constantly at all hours of the day and night. The folks at the front desk were eager to please and very nice. The bell hops and cleaning staff were all very nice. The outside help was ok. We didn't like that they made you unload your car and get it out of the area to a parking lot down and across the street before you could check in. Not necessarily their fault, more like company policy. I thought $12 and $19 per day to park your car at an already overpriced hotel was a bit much, along with another $9/day for wifi in your room. I'm not sure how families can stay there given the high prices of everything there. In their store a small coffee was over $3. I thought it odd they did not have free coffee in the hotel lobby as most hotels do. They do have coffee pots in the rooms, which was ok but not great. Luckily there was a Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks nearby. The view was great, the walks on the beach were wonderful, and listening to the ocean waves at night were priceless. Be prepared for much more out of pocket expense aside from the room if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: trav8169
Reviews.Content: The reason I chose to write this review is to debunk some of the prior criticisms of this hotel. We stayed one night and had absolutely no issues. Room was available at noon, great view oceanfront and great location on Daytona Beach. No cars are allowed to drive on the stretch of beach in front of the hotel. Plenty of elevators, never had to wait. Service was great at bars and restaurants. Room was clean and comfy(south tower) The complaint about wi-fi is true. Hotel gave us free wi-fi access but it did not work in our room. But who doesn't have a media package on their phone/tablet these days. Therefore this not a deal breaker. Lastly of course there is sand here and there, you are on the beach lets not forget, could be a touch cleaner but this hotel gets busy and yet again this is not anything to gripe about.

Reviews.Title: “You Be The Judge”
Reviews.Author: skyhigh1
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for my family before reading some of the reviews. When I read the reviews, I wanted desperately to cancel. I am so glad I didn't! My family had the best of time! Yes cell service was awful, but that can't be blamed on the hotel. The view was amazing and I love the fact you could actually open the door that was facing the ocean. I loved the staff; Susan, Carmen, Rebecca at the front all awesome. I have made plans to return later this month I was so impressed.. I do wish the rooms had refrigerators and microwaves. They are available for a fee upon request. The restaurants were incredible. Never had to venture from the hotel for anything. This will be my place in the sun. The rooms were spacious and clean. I can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: ohiost
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a family vacation last week. We stayed in a cabana suite on the ground level. One of our biggest issues was there was NO cell service in the room. You had to walk outside to make calls. Two out of the three phones in the room didn’t work and the one that did work, the people said they could barely hear us. There was no safe deposit box which is standard in almost all hotels. The ice machines were not close and were either not working or nearly empty. The bathroom didn’t have a vent so the bathroom was always stuffy and hot after taking a shower. Hardly ever had pool towels out. I think the grounds are way too big for the hotel to take care of. There were abandoned store fronts attached to the hotel that haven’t been washed in years. They had inappropriate things written on them. We had a patio outside of our room. We would sit out there every night to relax and enjoy the weather. This area is open to the public that walk past on their way to and from the carnival area. We witnessed an argument and then a guy get sucker punched. He ran away yelling call the cops with several people chasing after him (one included a guy with a baby in a stroller)! Another night we saw a mother yelling at the top of her lungs to her child, then proceeded to smack him in the face two different times (with multiple people and maids within steps from her). I thought I was staying at the Motel 6 not the Hilton! We had a problem with our cc being charged, stopped by the front desk and talked to a manager that said they would take care of it and call us to confirm it had been cleared up. Two days later I still hadn’t heard from her and called again to say she was in a managers meeting and would call when she got out. Never received a call! And the kicker is in the book it says if you have any comments or concerns to hit the menu button on the tv to submit your feedback, it didn’t work on either TV! Never again will I stay here! Also don't waste your money on the carnival thing next door. You can pay $10 for an hour of unlimited stuff, but not all rides work, they didn't have enough people working there so you have to follow the workers from ride to ride or wait until they are done with running one ride and come to another.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton. Really? Thought it was a flop house.”
Reviews.Author: 16weekayeartraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the check in valet, which was a cramped area we did not find the valet folks on post, we had to unload our own luggage, once that was done they showed up, hand out looking for a tip. We were assigned room 904 in the south tower. The hall was narrow with carpet that could easly be tripped over. The room was a filthy mess. I took a hand towel and ran it across the night stand, it was disgusting. I called the front desk asking for a room change, they would not accomidate, so I went there in person. We finally were assigned room 1076 in the north tower. The room was a bit cleaner, at least we felt like we could take our shoes off and set belonging out. The bathroom was disgusting. Mold on the floor and shower grout, stains on the counter and a shower head from 1982 that sprayed the walls more than it did me. The drain was so slow that no matter how fast you showered you were standing ankle deep in dirty water. There was no mini fridge, They wanted to charge $10 per night, I informed them I am a HiltonHonors member, they relented and gave us one. There is no WiFi on the rooms. I cannot believe a Hilton does not have WiFi. Stupid, stupid, stupid. The TV's chanels were half out. We called down three times over two days to get it working. Upon check in I was offered breakfast certtificates or HiltonHonor points. I chose the certificates. Theye were to be slid under the door the first morning. No show. Called Guest Services 'we are so sorry, first I have heard it it' she said. Second morning, same thing. I asked for a manager. The front desk manager called. First she had heard of it too. I asked if they have a log book. Sure she said. I suggested she take a look. hird morning same issue. I will say eveeryone is nice, not attitudes. But it appears these folks have received no training from management. Or if they did a refresher course needs to be given. There are many maintenance issues in this hotel. The revolving door in the north tower valet is broken. Sand and dirt are every where in this hotel. It would help if they had a foot shower coming in from the beach to the north tower, that may help. The carpets in the halls are stained really bad. The tile on the main floor look like they have not be polished in months. One day we came back from tjhe beach to our room at three. It had not been serviced, the do not disturd sign was not on the door. We tiook showers and called the front desk when we left at five. They said someone knocked and we told them not to clean the room or leave fresh towels. On the second day I left a message for the manager, he was not in the building, with the front desk manager. We never heard from him. I will bet he responds to this post. I would suggest you contact me direct, as you have my contact info. Want to see my photos of the room and disgusting house keeping? Let me know. Now, you may ask why did I stay there and not check out and go to the Hampton Inn up the street? I prepaid for the rooms, they would not refund them to me. We booked this hotel thinking they would be better than the Hampton, boy were we wrong. Folks, don't bother staying at this Hilton. We were really disapointed due to having just left the Hilton in Orlando earlier that same week. There is no compairison. If you did not see the names on the hotels, you would never in a million years say they were the same brand of hotel. Corporate, I hope you are reading this and do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Just WOW”
Reviews.Author: bappleton
Reviews.Content: Hilton offered a low price reservation thru a 3rd party source, and I am so glad they did. I may have never been able to experience this luxury resort like I did. Very nice place, Very nice employees from valet check~in through out lunch at Legends and the most remarkable at the end of my stay. Its one thing for workers to be over cheesy when you check in, and somehow lose the enthusiasm when your leaving. But I was treated like I was 4 stars from beginning to end. Thank you Hilton for a great weekend

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel. Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: beachdude654
Reviews.Content: Since we live only an hour and 30 minutes away, we decided to go down to Daytona for 2 nights. We found the Hilton to fit out needs. When we first arrived we were greeted with smiles. We got our stuff from the car and checked in. We had around a 10 minute wait which wasnt so bad because we could watch the waves behind the desk through the windows. We were checked in by a nice man who fulfilled all our requests! We had 2 rooms. One on the 11th floor and one on the 7th floor in the south tower. The south tower is closer to everything except ocean walk village. The south tower has the resturaunts, the check-in desk, and the gift shop. The north tower just had the steakhouse. Now let's go to the basic stuff. ROOM: We had two rooms that were the same. They were both ocean front rooms. The view was absolutely amazing!!! I spent about 30 minutes each day on the balcony. About the balcony, it's a small, one foot from the room balcony. So all you could do was stand on it. The beds were very confortable!!! They had like a cabana like backboard and a palmtree Florida designed comforter. I loved the bathroom design! There is a sink on the outside and a sink on the inside! The bath products were great too! The shower head had adjustable pressure and that was great! But the shower head was really old!!!! Talking about something old, THE TV!!!!!! This is 2012 Hilton! Not 2006!!! Haha but we didn't really use it anyway! But the old tv was kind of an eye sore. Anyway, we were very happy with our rooms!(1122 and 714) SERVICE: One word. OUTSTANDING!!!!!! The staff was so kind! The housekeepers were very polite and would say hi in tr hallways if they saw you. The check-in desk was so kind!!! And the resturaunt waiters were great! The staff was probobly the best I have ever seen! FOOD: We ate at Doc Bales, Hyde Park, and the sports bar. Doc Bales made the best omelet in the morning! For being a silver HH member we got free breakfast each morning! We ate at the sports bar fr lunch one time and it was good! Hyde park I don't think is owned by the hotel but it was AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! Everything there tasted great! I recommend the early bird special! Soup or salad, entree, and a side for only 19.99!!!! My soup and side would have cost that much usually! Get there before 6:30 and your good. Every other meal we had at ocean walk village. (Bubba Gump, Johnny Rockets, Starbucks, Cold Stone, ect.) LOCATION: AMAZING!!!! It's right on the beach!!!!! There is a beach volleyball court, boardwalk, clock tower, and even a Piet with rides close by! This hotel is prime real estate! Location wise at least! It's great!!!! They even have security on th boardwalk! They even asked us if they could see our room keys! That's something I like! Makes me feel much safer!!!!! CLEANLINESS: This is why it's 4 stars. The elevators really need to be cleaned! Thats the only thing!!!!!!! OVERALL: Would I stay again? Yes!!! I loved it! Everything was great!!!! I highly recommend staying here!!!! Hope this helped! If you have any questions just ask!!

Reviews.Title: “Weird hilton”
Reviews.Author: MINOU8977
Reviews.Content: Daytona beach is sort of a weird place to begin with, but I was hoping the hilton would be an oasis of sorts. It really was no better than a hilton garden inn - in fact in some ways worse. Giant building, long lines at checkin, long lines at the elevator, crumbling old hallways, tiny rooms which haven't been updated in years with small uncomfortable beds and no frills. Took ages to get up and down in the elevator and just full of school groups - sort of felt like staying in a public swimming pool. Took half an hour to get our car at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Sign says Hilton but.....”
Reviews.Author: Klprothero
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting a Hilton go somewhere else. Try the Wyndham ocean walk next door. This place is filthy, rooms are tiny, no fridge unless you pay a hidden fee. Free wifi but the signal comes and goes and is usually too weak to use. Try somewhere else. I wouldn't come back. Also the balcony is more of a glorified window ledge. No screen either do of the door is open the bugs are coming in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DennisAtkinson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 10 days at the Hilton Daytona Beach this past May 2011 for a conference. The hotel is somewhat dated, but they have kept it up nicely. The rooms are very clean, and the housekeeping staff is excellent. The restaurants in the hotel are okay, but nothing I would rave about ... other than about three times, I found the service in the restaurants to be quite lacking. This supposedly was a no smoking hotel ... but I had to close our sliding glass balcony door on several occasions because of the smokers throwing their lit cigarette butts our the window, and having them blow into our room landing on the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad..Not too good”
Reviews.Author: KASL1969
Reviews.Content: I knew going here that it wasn't your usual Hilton...but being Daytona I also didn't expect a 5 star anywhere. It was an ok hotel. Every day there were no towels for the pool. When you try to get help the girls at the desk take a break from talking to each other to either explain they have called and can't do anything about it or once they suggested I file a complaint with the front desk. Room was nice..but don't think its a balcony. Its a door you can open and sit inside - we were surprised at this expected a balcony but it was fine we had a good view of the ocean. Front desk not very helpful...mostly just like take a number and wait when you check in. Then heres your key. Not welcoming for the first impression. Stand out service came from Alan D (resort services ambassador) whom actually took the time to stop us as we passed by and ask us each time if we were ok - he works in the front lobby) When I told him about the towels. He again took the time to handle it himself by going down to laundry and getting the towels himself...this is what "Hilton" represents every where else I have ever been so kudos to him as his services is what gets this hotel to a 3 - if they had all been as hospitable...a 4 would be a definite. Only not 5 as the hotel gets its wear from being a beach resort. but 3 it is because without Alan 1.5 for a roof over my head. Oh the location is good. Lots in walk-in distance

Reviews.Title: “Pelican bar at Hilton Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Tapline
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst pina colada Ive had. Tasted like a diet drink. Will head back down toward Orlando and have one from The Rosen Center beach bar. Yummmm

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: I love this Resort! I have been here two times already and we are going back for a third time in May. The location is perfect. It is close to everything! The first time we visited we parked our car and did not get back in it until we were leaving to come home. It's connected to Ocean Walk Village and has one of the best BBQ places I have ever been to across the street. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The resort is beautiful. There are so many windows and decks that overlook the ocean. The rooms are great except they DO NOT have a fridge inside. It is frustrating to have to keep a cooler full of ice at all times but other than that i have nothing bad to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “spledid stay”
Reviews.Author: danday1986
Reviews.Content: Bad: key didnt work four times in a row (on tenth floor it got kinda iritating). Good: staff, location, view, ammenities, food, valet was AWESOME, shops in general arwa are cool, and room service. (Order hot wings!!) Loved this place and would recommend to anyone (i will b going back)

Reviews.Title: “Not willing to work with people”
Reviews.Author: Cardinalsfcaa
Reviews.Content: Called a week in advance to change reservation from two nights to one. Was told since it was a busy weekend, they couldn't do it. Had them cancel reservation that I had already paid one night for. Now waiting for 3 days now for refund. Stupid policy, probably better off that I am not staying there now.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself! Book the Holiday Inn just north of this location.”
Reviews.Author: budpaine
Reviews.Content: Don't do it... Strike 1). Cable tv does not work. Strike 2). If you book with an online service you get 2nd class treatment. Strike 3). Get to listen to an electric scrapper so they can replace the carpet. Strike 4). It's obvious they're running the joint with a Skelton staff- you cannot get help. Strike 5). Booked it with breakfast, but somehow they won't honor it. Strike 6). It's not clean... Again short staff would be my guess. If you want to stay at a nice place- my advise is take you money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room but great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: This being our third stay at this hotel we found the room worn out and very dated with a hint of not being clean, roaches prevalent outside the door. Staying ground level and beach side in a cabana room was a misstake. Neighbors are to close and as each room has a sitting area outside of your door folks tend to drink, smoke and get louder as the day goes on. TV's are old tube type, carpet is thread worn, bathroom was not clean. On the upside staff was great and hustled. Being bike week they had just enough flovor of this event but still kept the resort a resort and not a party place. Upper floors are better and a little more clean. Still the best choice on the beach. WATCH your rates, originally quoted and billed on a non-refundable over $600.00/night, the next day the same room was $350.00. It took many persistent calls to win the battle, use a AAA discount, they never asked for the card at check in. If the beach stay is less importat and you just want to go to the beach during the day stay at the Holiday Inn LPGA, 1/3 the cost and twice the hotel when it comes to being clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: statasciore
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hiltonbe Honors member and this was not ahave good experience. We stayed in the north tower in a corner room with a spectacular view but that's where it ends. The room we stayed in was out dated by 15 years and! filthy. Don't take your shoes off here!!! Everything on the floor we stayed was disgusting. The carpets were stained and loose in the hallways. I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean front is a must”
Reviews.Author: PilgrimTours07
Reviews.Content: For the difference in cost, spend the money for ocean front. The property is very large, parking is $12 a block away or $19 vallet, breakfast buffet is good at around $20 total, rooms and services are not quite up to par, but the location is great. There is something about the lovely view and peaceful sleep you get from the sound of the surf (balcony door open just a bit).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Vacation0714
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The service was good. The property was clean and rooms were nicely appointed. The AC in our room wasn't the best, but given the moderate outside temperature I decided not to complain. We were already moved once. The first room we checked into was swarming with moths. It's certainly not the Ritz, but its better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not your typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Rach271981
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I recently stayed at this Hilton during spring break. I really do not have anything negative to say about this hotel other than not not expect Hilton standards. The lady at the front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view in the south tower (room 835). It was a great view and noise level was low. This hotel does need renovations but it was clean and comfortable. We stayed two nights and our room was cleaned nicely. Even though this hotel has a Hilton name expect Days Inn quality. There are quite a few additional charges (in room wifi, parking etc) so be prepared for these. The valet service was quick and efficient (17.00 a day plus tax). We did not use the pool but the hot tubs were enjoyable. There appear to be several restaurants in the hotel but we also did not use those. If you can get a good deal I would reccomend this hotel but I cannot reccomend it at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good, could be better”
Reviews.Author: anderl
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is awesome, close to all entertainment. Prime area for sure. It is a bit dated, not cleaned as other Hilton's, and consideration for Spring Breakers and Bike week considered, it is fine. Parking $19 - park across the street in the garage for $10.

Reviews.Title: “VG Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarleneU
Reviews.Content: I stayed two evenings at the Hilton Daytona Beach this past week for business.I had an overall VG experience but have sorted everything into the good and the bad with the good first: Good: - Check in was efficient; - As a Hilton Diamnd member I was upgraded to a Junior Suite on the 4th floor; - I had no problems or issues with the suite but did have a problem with a 'neighbor' in an ajoining room or above me who was in a spat with someone - security resolved the issue quickly; - The personnel working at the hotel all were very polite and helpful and tried to go above and beyond to provide good service. I could see a definite change since staying there in the past; - the hotel has several restaurants from which to choose both within the hotel and within walking distance; - Hyde Place Steak House within the hotel serves great food and has an awesome happy hour 4:30-6:30 with $5 small plates and martinis. Bad: - I was on the 4th floor - if you are a single travelor, please be warned that there are no hallway lights as pictured except for the lights above the doorways. While this is not an issue during the daytime, it is an issue at night; - Legends restaurant is not up to Hilton standards. The Cobb salad is served in a basket with pressed chicken, no bacon and no avocado. It is not a 'true' Cobb; - Valet parking is $19. Hilton parking is down the block and across the street for $12 plus tax. If I am in the area again, I would stay at this hotel but would request specifically to not be placed onthe 4th floor. In additno, Hilton encourages eCheck in and when I tried it there was a room available on the 11th floor but the computer would not allow me to check in. This is the first time this has happened to me as generally I check in the day before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & amenities help ease lack of internet”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in January. This is an older property that is pretty well-maintained. I saw nothing that made me uneasy. The rooms are basic and functional. The staff were very friendly. I enjoyed using the sandwich shop... it came in really handy for later-night hunger pangs. My only real beef was the internet. It was slow as molasses for the bulk of my stay, then crapped out altogether on the last night... not just in my room, but across the entire property. Staff said they had someone working on it, and that it should be fixed "soon". From evening to the following morning, "soon" never came. As a business traveller who values being connected, this is a real negative for me. I would not stay here again for business. However, I could see myself staying here for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to date”
Reviews.Author: eatbread
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Daytona 500 weekend. I expected it to be more modern than it is. The lobby and entrance are very nice and impressive, and the back patio is great. The rooms, however, are a different story. The worn and buckling carpet in the hallways was the first clue. Upon entering the room, I found it clean but in terrible need of modernizing. There is no wireless Internet in the room, no minibar, and no safe. Come on, Hilton! Really!! It's time to invest some of your profits back into your properties. The location is great, but I would look for a newer or more modern place to stay if possible.

Reviews.Title: “May not be the BEST Hilton, but, remember, it IS in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: lpaulkelley
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel within a year. Both times were with my family (wife and two boys below age of 5). The first visit in March of 2011 was a well below average experience, so we were debating staying here again. However, I couldn't deny the hotel's location, its vicinity to everything else, and onsite activities. My wife needed to be able to entertain the boys onsite because I had to leave for work with the car for the day. So, we thought we'd give it another try as I believe EVERYONE deserves a second-chance. I'm glad we did. The valet and bell services were fabulous and the staff more than exceptional in their attitude and greetings. The front desk was equally pleasant (much improved upon from our first visit). Check-in was a little delayed, but they had a lot of folks checking in and were fully staffed at the desk. It seemed that they were doing the best they could. Since my first visit, I became a Hilton Honors Gold Member, which may have influenced their attitude towards me, but that would be speculating. Whatever the case, I requested an upgrade and they more than graciously obliged. I received a full king suite (great for the kids and family) on the 14th floor with a private balcony. Housekeeping was very friendly and courteous and helped us ensure a clean stay which can be difficult with two boys at the beach. As part of the Gold Member status, I received complimentary breakfast at Doc Bales. The wait staff was outstanding, even when we had two loud boys in the mix of a lot of business travelers. Believe it or not, our loud boys seemed to be a relief to the business atmosphere for the staff! Regarding the staffing overall, the hotel was superb. I've read a LOT of the reviews by other travelers on here and I do agree with the condition of the hotel. It is certainly "dated." However, you must remember that this is a beach hotel at Daytona Beach. This isn't Palm Beach; this isn't Boca Raton. It probably is NOT in the best condition in Daytona, but it is certainly top 5 or top 3. Just remember how much the salt and sand will degrade ANYTHING. The first time we stayed in March 2011, we were in the North Tower and this time in the South Tower. I concur with others and highly recommend staying in the South tower as it seems it was in better condition than the North. There are certainly little things that I noticed, like in the bathroom that need to be repaired (shower faucet nob fell off) and the door key reader didn't function correctly. The hotel needs to upgrade the TV service. I didn't count, but at most, there were 15 channels (one appropriate for kids). They claim that the pool is heated, but maybe that's a relative term. We were able to get in with the kids, but I wouldn't say it was warm. The pool certainly needed to be cleaned; I would say that the pool is NOT a selling point. As I said earlier, we ate breakfast at Doc Bales each morning and was pleasantly surprised. They had a wonderful spread buffet for breakfast, including a omlet bar. However, for a family, I'm not sure I'd pay over $10 per person for it (I had complimentary passes). In summary, I would return to the hotel again if I was wanting to be on the beach and only in the hotel to sleep/eat. They have to upgrade the tv service before I'd stay for business, as I like to watch tv in my hotel when I'm on business. Not much to watch here. I can't say enough how pleasant all the staff members were and how wonderful the location is. Maybe this is a hit or miss...certainly could use some improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Abrndale
Reviews.Content: I am a Hiliton Diamond guest and stayed at this hotel in August 2011. During my stay in August I experienced several service issues. My closet door kept falling off the track. I requested it be fixed and left several notes on the door that it was not working. After 4 times of requesting it be fixed I finally left a firm note expressing my displeasure and again requested it be fixed. They still did not get it fixed. I finally had to go to the front desk and escalate this to a manager to get it fixed. Then there was the problems with valet delays in getting my car. Then one day of my stay I had a live Palmetto Bug in the room . I killed the bug myself and purposefully left the carcass to see if the housekeeper would remove it. It was never touched. Finally I took a picture of it and emailed it to the general manager, with copies to the assistant manager and front desk manager. Again I expressed my displeasure. I had no response from anyone. On check out I again requested to speak with the manager and expressed my displeasure of the lack of service at the Hilton. I got through to the Front Desk Director who expressed apologies for the stay. As a good faith gesture since I was a Diamond guest and to assure my return business he offered a complimentary return stay. I took the manager up on this offer and the return visit was no better. There were more service issues. On check in the desk clerk advised that the valet parking was covered by the manager as well as the room charges. She asked if I planned to charge anything to the room. I told her "No" and she said OK and did not request a credit card. Well two days into my stay I requested my car from the valet and was informed that they could not give me my car. I asked them why and was loudly told for "non payment of my bill". This was in the presence of other guests. I then went to the front desk and was told that they would not release my car to me until I paid my valet bill and placed a credit card on the account for charges. I told the clerk on check in they advised valet parking was being covered by the manager and that a credit card was not needed. Again, the clerk told me they would not release my car until I paid the valet bill. I asked to speak with the manager and after a period of time the manager that originally approved my stay came out from the back. I advised that it was his desk clerk that said parking was part of the complimentary stay. He said sorry, I was hoping this would not come to this. He never requested a credit card and finally had my car brought to me. Why was my car held hostage for non payment or a credit card when the manager never requested on either? While walking in the hall I noticed clean towels and bed sheets placed on the dirty stained carpet. My question is would the manager like to sleep on linen that had been on a dirty floor or use towels from the floor? Probably not. One day our room was not cleaned. Service in the restaurant for breakfast was poor on three days. Servers were noted complaining about their jobs and how overworked they were rather than serving customers Television reception is not very good in the hotel. Old TV's with limited channels and fuzzy pictures. No blankets on the beds. The only consistently good thing going for this hotel is the location on the beach. I was hoping my return experience would have been better, since the manager assured the issues on the first stay were not normal for this hotel. Well the return visit had many negatives as well as a major health violation.

Reviews.Title: “pia”
Reviews.Author: Arnoldk56
Reviews.Content: Very good location, rooms need upgrade, same for the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want your time, energy and money wasted”
Reviews.Author: underwatercrystals
Reviews.Content: Since our convention was held at the Ocean Center Daytona Beach, my best friend and I decided to stay in Hilton for 14 nights and 15 days, from the end of January towards the beginning of February. Let's start with the good parts of this Hilton first: - check in was easy and smooth We had our room pretty quick. - location is admirable There are many shops and restaurants within half a mile. - pleasing sight of the ocean Our room was on the 9th floor and we had clear view of the beach. We'd leave the sliding door open at night to hear the ocean waves sing us a soothing lullaby. Precious! - the staff is polite and helpful that includes the servers in the restaurants within the hotel, bellhop, housekeeping personnel, but not the front desk and the rest of the management team Now the unpleasant side: - billing troubles Five days into our stay, the hotel gave us an invoice with charges for daily parking when in fact, we only parked our rental car overnight since we drove from MCO to Hilton. We returned the car to Budget at DAB after 24 hours of renting it. Hilton took a few days before they finally cleared us of the unnecessary parking fees. I won't write a lengthy story about all the other holds that they have done in my card and my best friend's card but it's enough for everyone to know that my best friend had to seek the management everyday for three days to lift the hold that they repeatedly put on his card. Even after checking out and paying the full amount, it took another one full week until the hold that they put in the middle of our stay in my credit card has been lifted completely. The business center doesn't seem to be a part of this Hilton either. The hotel directs all packages to the business center and it charges a “little amount” to a package, the fee varies on the weight and size of the box. I had a 1.5-pound pair of shoes shipped from Amazon and the business center charged me $3 when I picked it up from them after an hour of its delivery. Also, my best friend and I informed Hilton that instead of checking out on February 5, we would check out on February 4. We gave them that notice on January 29 and in response, they told us that they would charge us $50 for early check-out. After a few days of negotiation, they finally agreed to waive the $50 on the very day of our check-out. I understand the fees for state tax and county occupancy tax but the Hilton itself adds so many other charges on top of things. It's not like their rooms look very good. - insufferable restaurants within the hotel Restaurants in Daytona Beach are generally not good at all but Hyde Park Prime Steakhouse, Legends Sports Bar, Doc Bales' Grill just make things worse. In life, there's food that looks appetizing but tastes terrible and there's food that has unlikely presentation that tastes delicious. Yet, those three restaurants in the Hilton serve food that neither look appetizing nor taste well. I don't mind paying for food as long as it's very much worth my money. I live in CA and I know what good food really is. The servers in Doc Bales' are a friendly bunch though. - pool for display only If the main pool wouldn't be heated, why not drain it? It's pretty useless. - old gym equipment Our local YMCA does so much better than their gym. - room is substandard No blanket ever, just a thin sheet and very old comforter. Same size pillows, very tiny and uncomfy. Cleaning lady comes to clean but sometimes puts stained towels. Really gross linen. The tub has some sort of stain which looks like rust but cannot be removed. Trash bins are too tiny. No fridge or microwave. Summary I don't mind paying well as long as I receive what my money is worth for. Clearly, this Hilton is a waste of everything, except for its location. I've never stayed in a hotel as terrible as this one and obviously, I have no wish to come back, nor do I recommend this to anybody. Just do your homework and check out other places to stay if you really have to be in Daytona Beach for an important reason. Otherwise, just avoid Daytona Beach all together if you are thinking of vacation. Probably for spring breakers, this Hilton or the Daytona Beach area would pass well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this is a Hilton - not up to Hilton standards...”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler2011
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference that was in this hotel, so I stayed on property, and was rather disappointed. First off, I was getting the conference rate, which was good for it being a Hilton, but if I were paying full price, I'd have been livid. The staff were amazing, but the hotel itself needs to be renovated big time. The carpet in the hallways is a trip hazard, the water faucet in the tub is tricky to say the least, and as everyone else has said - only the nasty comforter is on the bed...no blankets. For my first shower I froze because I did not get any hot water to come out. Then my co-worker told me to play with the controls and it will work...well, the next day I struggled with the control and finally got hot water to come out...but was never able to get it cool again, so I took scalding hot showers. The owners need to invest in some major upgrades to the basics for this hotel, or Hilton needs to take their name off of it. Guests are paying for a Hilton, with old accommodations. I've seen better in a Red Roof Inn. As for the conference rooms, etc - those were all really nice and I have nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Are we sure it is a Hilton?? A real "Meh" stay”
Reviews.Author: AE88
Reviews.Content: I was a bit surprised by this hotel, especially given the price to stay here. I should start by saying that I am a Hhonors Gold member and have stayed at a number of Hiltons in the last few months alone. Check in was great -- very fast. They even brought me up a snack tray and some waters. That was the good parts. I was placed on the ocen side of the hotel on the top floor. The first thing that struck me was that the carpet in the halls was BADLY fadded and wrinked. It looked to have never been stretched and even if they had tried it would have ripped -- it looked that thin and worn. In my room, the doorwall had no screen, so if I wanted t owork and hear the ocean, I had to leave the doors wide open. The curtains had something on them too. It was dark red in color. I tried to convince myself it was Ketchup and not blood. I hope that to be true. There is also no wireless, something unfathomable to me, especially at the price they charge. I didn't spend much time in the room as part of this business trip, save for one night I had to work, so this all didn't bother me. However, if I was traveling on my own dime, and based on the cost of the room, I'd likely have been much more disappointed. Overall, the stay was just "meh".

Reviews.Title: “A non-Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: Malenevh
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous Hiltons across the US and the world, we were decidedly underwhelmed by our experience in this one. So much in fact that we only stayed one night, before we moved to Lotus inn and suites instead. It was run-down and very average, so whilst not a disaster, it was poor value for money and below par for the Hilton brand. Room service was of poor standard for this type of hotel, the room and the communal areas were tired looking and the general cleanliness and tidiness was poor. The staff were lovely though.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: randyrto
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. Good hotel great location. Did not eat in hotel heard others say food was good. Nice looking steakhouse thre will likely give it a try next time

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades needed - It Is 2012!”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: There are a few good things here - Location. Right on the beach and within walking distance to a lot of restaurants. The view from the rooms on the beach side are great. That is where the good stuff ends. 1. Internet is terrible! You will not be able to use this in any productive manner. In the room there was no wi-fi, only an ethernet cable. The speed was SLOWER than dial-up speed from the early 1990's. The last night of my stay - there was no internet. Two calls to the front desk and they acknowledged they had a problem and were sorry for the incovenience. 2. The carpet was old and worn - over due. 3. The tv had about 10 stations - that is it. Not even weather channel - you would think being exposed to hurricanes that would be useful. 4. Closet door was broken 5. The cleaning service was poor - no cleaning in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Choose carefully”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin A
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of reviews of this hotel that are between one and three stars. This is a decent Hilton accomodation in a great location if you've got business at the Ocean Center, which I did. I was there for a large conference and had multiple meetings during my stay. I will say that my room in the south tower was in decent shape, while the north tower rooms -- which I had friend staying in -- were severely dated and aged. If you can, request a room in the south tower. As for parking, I always plan to valet at large hotels/resorts like this. I don't think you should have to, but you do. My employer doesn't reimburse for it, and it was much more than the self-park option, but I didn't have to hike.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok. View is great!”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff is friendly. Rooms are small. They run out of hot water in shower. Pool is not heated. No wifi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Expect way more from a full service Hilton”
Reviews.Author: cakekween
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed this past Saturday night for a little get away...we have a toddler and a newborn at home and were hoping to get some much needed rest and a nice hot, kid free meal. We specifically requested when booking to be AWAY form the elevator and i called 2 times before we arrived to confirm - guess what room they stuck us in - Your guessed it...the VERY FIRST ROOM OUTSIDE OF THE ELEVATOR!!! Not sure which was better, staying home and listening to my baby cry in the middle of the night, or spending $150 to stay there and listen to the elevators all night :( Calle dthe front desk and was told they had nothing else available - so frustrating!! Rooms are VERY outdated...a 19 inch, old school TV with basic cable only...Really???? Lets step it up Hilton, A nice flat screen a little larger then the one in my 3 year olds room would have been nice. The picture was so bad that you couldn't even watch the news. Pathetic. I guess they figure they can get the $$ from people who want to come to "the worlds most famous beach" so no need to update anything. And EWWWWW..... No blankets on the bed - only a sheet - Do they really expect you to pull that nasty, unwashed, hotel bedspread on you to sleep - it was gross. Housekeeping did bring us a blanket after 2 calls to the front desk, but seriously, I shouldn't have even had to ask! It's a shame...it really is in a prime location and could have such great potential, but is in serious need of an update! Oh...WIFI is a joke too - never worked in our room :(

Reviews.Title: “Penny Pinchers”
Reviews.Author: zolth96
Reviews.Content: This location has just about the same ambience pleasures as any other along the Daytona Beach strip, so without discussing how pretty or beautiful everything looked to me I will discuss what this Hotel does to the customer looking for an acceptable to great vacation for their dollar: Parking is either valet or across the street. Across the street requires you use the hotels room card to go in and out of the parking lot (it's pretty simple to use). Valet has you parked in a parking garage filled with pigeons (lots of fecal matter). Valet is $17 a day and across the street $10.55 (tax included) a day. I strongly suggest going across the street as it's not too far away and there are always plenty of parking spaces. Priceline fraudulent listing: they have on their site that this hotel is a 3 and a half star hotel even though the hotel confirms to be a 3 star hotel only. In fact Priceline had this hotel as a 4 star hotel until claims were filed against Priceline because of the false hotel star rating giving on their website for this hotel. I got this room at $50 (after Priceline taxes $61 a night). The Priceline website has this hotel listed at $159.00 and up a night. I was given a room looking over the city, on the top floor. I was able to see the inlet, bridges and the city view from my view. The ocean was not seen or heard from my room. No fridge or microwave in the room. Hotel charges about $10 a night for WI fi use; unless you want to go to lobby area to roam WI fi for free (this area was inundated with people using their laptops and other similar devices all day long. This hotel does allow pets ($50) a night. Neither of the pools was heated even though I was told otherwise. Three hot tubs (one was down/out of service), suggest using the outside one as the indoor one feels way too hot due to no fresh air or breezes blowing on you (Hotel: at least get some fans around the indoor hot tub). Plenty of different places to eat at inside the hotel, however the prices were so overpriced, I didn't bother with any of them; there were plenty of nearby restaurants to choose from outside of the hotel. What is near by: Two comedy clubs, one was really close not sure of the name and the other Bonkers was about two miles away, both on same rd. as hotel. A water park (closed during offseason). Science Museum (was closed when I attempted to go on Sat). Tons of rentals places for motorcycles, bikes, boats, etc. And of course the speedway where they have the Daytona 500 is about 4-5 miles away. More about the hotel; the room was fine, beds were good, nothing special. The TV was huge, about 46 inches. Next to no balcony, in fact I strongly suggest you don't lay a foot outside your room because your feet won't fit beyond the sliding glass door section. I was aware of this hotels cheapskate ways so I wasn't shocked at their 'extras' and what more they cost you, however I will make it my business to find a hotel that cares about the customer and includes what you need with the hotel night bill, even if the bill is more. I did have a minor problem with room service (no towels), on my way out to a function I told front desk and had them send me up new towels while I was away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Tired Property in South Tower”
Reviews.Author: Hobietim
Reviews.Content: excellent staff experience, physical property is tired, carpets need restretched in ha;;ways - wrinkled and trip you up, NO flat screens on 11th floor - thought Hilton promised all flat screens by 2010? room service great, bar good, valet OK though you drop at one end and pickup at other.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovations”
Reviews.Author: FLCouple
Reviews.Content: Outside is nice, lobby and general areas are pretty nice, but it goes downhill after that. Noticed there was a bucket in the lobby one afternoon catching water dripping from either the A/C or from just a general leak. The rooms are pretty outdated. Checked in just in time to watch a football game up in the room but the TV was pretty small and outdated. Should have just found a local sports bar with nice TV's to watch the game at. The room itself did not feel clean. Would have asked to switch rooms but I checked in late and was only staying 2 nights and working all day the next day, so I did not want to go through the hassle. The carpet outside of the bathroom was wet the entire time I was there. Not sure if there was a leak or if something had happened from the guest that stayed in the room prior to me. My entire stay consisted of me stepping over the wet area of the carpet. I ended up not using the coffee maker in my room as it had a lot of buildup on the inside of it and just looked dirty. The hotel also did not have wireless internet in the guest rooms at all which was extremely surprising for a Hilton. I was definitely not impressed with the quality of the rooms in this hotel and glad to check-out and head home!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Daytonalover19
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here when it was Marriott & The Adams Mark. NEVER paid over 98 bucks a night. Hilton want 150+ for a small room with no balcony. Save your money. Stay next door in a condo for less.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: WhizKelly
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. My 8 year old wrote one of her classmates and said "this is the biggest and prettiest hotel, I have ever seen." We only stayed one night so I can not give a complete review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wbailey6
Reviews.Content: I don't know if Daytona's claim as the "Worlds Most Famous Beach" is exactly true, but I must say that Daytona Beach is really one of the worlds most beautiful beaches. White sand, walkable and drivable also which makes it even better and all of this is just steps away from the Daytona Beach Hilton. I've stayed at this hotel numerous times over the years and have seen it change over those years also. The property claims to be a three diamond resort but struggles to meet those requirements. They have several outlet restaurants and bars on the property but they are seasonal and don't all ever seem to be open at the same time (other than the summer time season) Nice pool area for guests with a pool bar that may or may not be open when your there. The rooms are standard and the beds are nice and comfortable. The big draw to this hotel is it's location. Right on the Beach and Boardwalk in the center of the beachside community. You can walk to anything you might want to do. Shopping, movies, arcades and restaurants are all right there. There is a convention center and a water-park right across the street. The amount of money you spend will depend on the time of year you stay. You need to check the Daytona Chamber website for event dates in Daytona. That standard room that they charge $89 for during the slow periods will cost you $350 a night during any of their Bike or Car Racing events. The property is nice but the employees are the drain. Turnover is a big issue with only a few employees staying for more than a year. This puts a drain on the type of service you get. The wait in the outlet restaurants is VERY long and if they are busy you better be prepared for a hour and a half - two hour meal period. Legends (their sports bar) is the nicest spot for a drink and is open everyday. Prices are steep and it's really kind of silly to pay the Hilton prices when there is a Sloppy Joe's, Kerr's Wing House and Bubba Gumps 50 yards away with much cheaper prices. Very average Hilton that may or may not be over priced depending on the time you stay, that is VERY family friendly and located in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Love the View!”
Reviews.Author: rfuchs0917
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an oceanfront room for New Year's. We loved the view! However, there are a couple of things that detracted: 1. The elevators are slow, slow, slow. For a Hilton I was surprised. 2. The room smelled so bad. Luckily we were able to leave the sliding door open most of the time. 3. The bathroom is tiny, tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: John93pop
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days for the New Years celebration's was a very clean room everything done in a professional way at a resonable price for a weekend such as New Years. Can't say enough on the professional service and the enjoyment of this week end stay.

Reviews.Title: “FULL SERVICE??? DEFINE "SERVICE"”
Reviews.Author: PRODIGY27J
Reviews.Content: Sorry if this post gets a little long but I promise it is worth the read to get the real scoop on this place. I rarely post to websites but I will start by saying the negative reviews on this site are completely accurate. Back in November we booked a king size oceanfront with terrace for New Year's Eve. Upon check in the lady informed me they "upgraded" my room to a Junior Suite because they are a "full service" hotel and "they thought it would be better for me". I explained that if I thought it would be better, I would have booked that particular room in the first place. The new "upgraded" room did not have a balcony or terrace, which is my reason for staying oceanfront in the first place.
