After going back and forth she checked with her manager and explained there were no other rooms available...how convenient. After finally accepting that the all-knowing Hilton knows what's best for me, I proceeded to the front area where I parked the car. After loading the bellhop cart, they were nice enough to let me know they had to wait for a bellman to take my bags up. I told them it wasn't necessary that I can unload the bags myself. Another guy explained that they are a "full service" hotel and company policy would not allow me to take my own bags up. Somehow this "full service" seemed like nothing more than a hassle. After 10 minutes I was gracious enough to finally have a bellman take the cart up. (There were 4 carts ahead of me and if I didn't talk the guy into taking my cart next the wait easily would have been 1/2 hour). The parking was just as horrible in this "full service" hotel. If you choose to self-park, prepare to make 2 lefts out of the hotel just to get back onto Atlantic Ave. then drive to an outside, unmanned, unsecure parking lot behind a rib shack. Verrrrrrry classy parking for a Hilton. Oh yeah, prepare to walk over 2 blocks just to get back to the Hilton. Very convenient for a "full service" hotel. By this time we were just exhausted and angry so we decided to order a pizza. How pleasantly surprised we were when the front desk called and told us to come to the lobby to pick up our delivery order. Company policy at this "full service" hotel does not allow delivery drivers to the room. Doesn't seem too convenient to go down 7 flights then walk across the lobby to pick up food in this "full service" hotel. The walls are very thin in this place. I have never been to a "full service" hotel that allows wild packs of black teenagers running the halls at 4 in the morning. It must be a new policy. Checking out was just as bad. The walk back to the car is just a pain after a long weekend and waiting for a bellman again. When he finally did come up I told him to wait for one minute and he left. He never came back so we didn't even ask for another bellhop cart and hauled all of our luggage (with stroller) out of this "full service" hotel. To be fair, they did give us free breakfast and $10 off each day for the inconvenience, but I have had better service and way less hassle at the Days Inn, which is most definitely not billed as a "full service" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Daytona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick L
Reviews.Content: So i will start off saying this is a comparison review, Hilton vs. Holiday Inn.Hilton is a fantastically opulent atmosphere rite from the start, when u pull up into the turnaround to check in they have so many bright lights tastefully done u feel like u should be in a limo for this "Hollywood Premiere" feel it gives you. Absolutely 1st rate. I also stayed at the Holiday Inn LPGA Blvd. This place also exudes class from the beginning with its marble floors and granite counter tops. Now comes the big differences....The Hilton has rooms on the beachfront, so fantastic views. Holiday Inn is "inland", to use the local parlance.This means that you are surrounded by pines,no real views, but close to all the shopping(it's across the street from an automall...im in heaven!!!!! The Hilton is on A1A, but in an area that I imagine would b prone to heavy traffic during the events(races, bike week,spring break).Excellent spot to be at if you don't plan to drive much...I do, so Holiday in would be my choice during peak events.Off season, Hilton for sure!!! tHE Holiday Inn is relatively new im told...not yet 3 yrs. However, you would think such a beautiful place would be on its A game 24/7. While i was in the lobby on the second or third day of my stay, they were actually turning guests away because the manager had been on the check in desk that day and forgot to send the cleaning orders for the empty rooms to housekeeping, so they had 75 uncleaned rooms at 3 pm(official ckeck in time), and they had to turn away 75 would-be patrons. So if you are in the Daytona area, two great places to stay, but do a check to be sure your room will be ready on arrival. That will be a new routine for me. I would stay again, anyway...the rooms there are huge, and equal to the Hilton's in beauty.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey R
Reviews.Content: DEFINTELY NOT GOING TO GET YOUR MONEYS WORTH AT THIS HOTEL!!! I do NOT recommened. Give your money to a smaller hotel that needs it and you will get the value and service you are expecting.No wireless, just a high speed port, that you must pay for. Bathroom chemcials were not fully cleaned so bathroom smelt horrible the entire stay.Shower head was probably 10years old.Rooms are not updated. Bix box TV;s, not a flat screen like there room descriptions say. Inside pool area was disgusting. Chewing gum plastered on the decor rocks, rust on the floor by the handrails, dirty towels in with the clean pool towels. Spa only has one person working there so you can not get a couples massage. Outside apperance is awful. Sign is not fully alluminated, windows were heavily caked with dirt, rust, stained walkways, gum everywhere. Legends sports bar and doc bailes share the same kitchen, save your money and go to legends, same food, slightly cheaper but still outrageous. Billing was a nightmare. Charged me for valet all 6 nights, I did self parking. Got it "fixed" at check out, was checking bill on my way out and it was done inaccurate again! Credit card company called 2 days later, I had 2 charges from Hilton, almost doubling what my invoice said. Called to compain and the account payable staff had left for the day, at 1PM?!?! Totally aggrivating!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: love2travel109
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the 2011 Christmas Holiday 24-28 Dec. Room was nice overlooking the beach. Thanks to Austin at Hyde Park restaurant, Sue at Doc's and the entire front desk staff. The only downside was as a hhonors gold member Internet access was complimentary, but no wireless access in the room. In the new age of tablets....does not allow for wired ethernet connection...had to go to the lobby. Stayed last year during Thanksgiving, but prefer the Christmas time better. Less people in hotel equals better service.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Daytona”
Reviews.Author: steveyes2001
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location. Reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the rate”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Overall my family and I enjoyed our experience at this hotel. We were coming in as part of a band performing at a convention in a nearby hotel. Since we were arriving after work and needed to change clothes, it was pivotal that we be checked in as soon as possible. Even though check in time was at 3pm (and we didn't arrive until after 5pm) our room was not ready when we arrived. To say that I was upset would be an understatement. However after complaining a bit about my dissatisfaction, we were compensated with free breakfast at the hotel's restaraunt; which was so delicious and delightful to us that it more than made up for that inconvenience. The hotel seemed to be a bit understaff and this was in the summer at a beach in Florida.. that seems a bit preposterous.. but, for the rate we paid and the free breakfast that we enjoyed, we aren't that upset. Doesn't get my first recommendation but due to satisfying me as unhappy guest, I can't tell you not to stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Class Hotel Masquerading as Luxury”
Reviews.Author: N0dric
Reviews.Content: A lot of mixed reviews on this hotel as you will see. We chose to stay overnight in this hotel on our way to a conference just to get that late season look at the sea. As a Hilton Diamond I paid for a standard King, and was upgraded on arrival to a Ocean View room. The cost of the room was $99 for the night, but could have been almost $300 if we had paid the full price for the room we received. Neither room is worth the price, but you are paying for location, but location is not always everything despite the saying! You have to remember that this hotel is in Daytona, and is a tourist class resort hotel, and not what you are going to get staying in a Hilton in say Bali. The rooms are way smaller than some hotels on the side of an Interstate, and ours was no exception. Remember also that this hotel is in a typical seaside entertainment complex, complete with a funfair, cinema, and low quality dining. This is were I’d expect to see working class families running wild come the summer months, and is not the place for those of us who expect luxury and top service when on holiday. If you want that level of hotel look elsewhere, and probably don’t even stay in Daytona. The hotel is tired, and in great need of a facelift. The corridors are old, worn, and although generally clean, are off putting. The buildings windows and window frames are filthy and salt marked and heavily weathered as well as corroded in places, and have not been cleaned in an age. Maybe this is out of season and they’ll wash them in time for summer, who knows. For some unknown reason the corridors had their air blasting 24hrs a day and set at 60 deg which made for a chilly walk back to your room. The room we stayed in has a good view, and the large sliding patio door enable us to lay on the bed and watch the waves. We were close to the funfair, and I’d probably want to me much father away in summer once the pumping bass is going, and it’s got a 1000 screaming kids running a mock until midnight! The bathroom was almost too small to move in, and a second sink was located opposite the closet in the main bedroom to give you somewhere extra to wash. The bathroom is of the type you’d expect to find in a 1 star motel. The shower head was ancient, and barely wheezed into action when coaxed to supply water, and was more like standing under the garden hose. No raindrop shower here! I had requested extra towels in advanced, and these were delivered to the room after we arrived after the request was noticed at check in. The biggest problem was where to put them with the bathroom being so small! The TV is an old 4:3 CRT type, and 50% of the advertised TV channels were not working, and we often saw the ‘contact Direct TV’ message as the subscription was not valid. Hmmm... Internet is chargeable and a wired affair, and inline with other reviewers this is way past due for an upgrade. Free wifi is the standard for today, and not 10 bucks a day for a wired connection. Not much use for your iPad etc. You can get free wifi in the lobby. The bed was comfortable, as most Hilton beds are, but the duvet has seen better days. You know when you get big bits of cover without any padding when you try and change your duvet cover, well that’s how old the duvet in the cover was, except it had just lost it’s padding with age. It was unusually cool for Florida so we could have done with the extra. Something I laughed about, but that also shows the tourist class nature of the hotel, was the large boot marks I found on the curtain pelmet. I was leaning out of the window admiring the view, and turned back to look into the room. I glanced upwards, and the board that hid the curtain rail etc had great big boot marks on its unpainted backside surface. Obviously when this was installed it was not painted on the side that faces outwards, and was not even wiped down. I guess they assumed no one would see it. Parking is pay per night, and you can choose $10 park it yourself, or $17 valet. The breakfast is free to a Diamond Honors member, but chargeable to non status members. The breakfast is a buffet affair, and offers a range of hot and cold fayre. The hot selections were not great, suffering as most do from drying out and over cooking in the heat that keeps them warm. They also offer a table service menu at extra cost. I won’t dwell on the food in itself other than to say you’ll get better food eating out and save money into the bargain. I get free breakfast so we decided to eat in. I opted for cereals and toast (another useless bargain basement toaster that takes an eternity to make the bread luke warm!) but my wife chose the ‘pastries and bread route’. She had all but finished a piece of banana cake when she stopped, looked at me in horror, and said look at this! Large green spots of hairy mould were staring at us, on the cake she had almost finished eating. I immediately stood up and in shouted over at the restaurant manager. He was naturally very embarrassed and extremely apologetic. We even heard him as he stormed into the kitchen and threw the remains of the cake at the chef. Needless to say this cut our breakfast short. In fairness to the manager he immediately went to see the hotel manager, and they zero’d the bill for the entire stay, wiping out a $130 charge. I’m sure that this is not typical of Hilton, and I’m sure after this incident staff will improve or be replaced in the kitchen, but it was a very distressing incident. Perhaps being out of season they were trying to stretch the food out! Uneaten food should always be disposed of daily, or better still donated to a homeless shelter, and not constantly recycled for guest consumption to save a few dollars. So overall this is a fair standard tourist class hotel, that caters for holidays for the less demanding traveller, and has much lower class accommodations than a big city Hilton hotel. However the cost of a stay is still in the luxury price range, and way overpriced for what you’ll receive. Stay away from the beach and pay less for a lot more. Location is great for the summer as long as you accept it will be noisy and rowdy throughout your stay. Parking is expensive with few other options, and the dining costs in the hotel are cost prohibitive, especially given the food is far short of gourmet. The price of a glass of coke, and a can of Redbull was $9! So bring your own drinks. No fridge in the room as there’s nowhere to put one, but there is ice nearby.

Reviews.Title: “National Youth Football Championships 2011”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach Hotel on the Oceanwalk over Thanksgiving for the National Youth Football Championships. The hotel is very pleasing to the eye, and has a lot of great offerings. However, during our stay we had several issues, they are as follows; No hot water Lack of towels Unable to get in and out of the parking lot with key card Breakfast buffet was the worse food I ever tasted Those four issues will keep me from every returning to this hotel, for the simple fact that mgmt wouldn't do a thing about it. I was not pleased with the mgmt, however I wills ay those who work in housekeeping, valet, and other areas of the hotel were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Denise5067Plymouth
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to ocean view, worth the $20 extra. Great view of the boardwalk and rides from South tower. Everyone we came in contact with were very polite, helpful and professional. Christina at check in was very pleasant. I do think the comforters/ bedspreads need updating. They appeared worn and did not look clean or inviting. The sheets looked new, clean, and inviting! I do think there are too many "hidden" charges passed on to guests. Parking charge should not be passed on to guests, nor should Internet. Most other hotels offer this free of charge. Overall, enjoyed my stay, and it was the perfect, fun location!

Reviews.Title: “Relatively Good”
Reviews.Author: DemandingGuest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the beach in Daytona, and next to a seaside amusement area with a sort of human slingshot ride. The rooms are average but clean. Avoid the rooms on the south end where the amusement ride is. The lights from them are annoying and will keep you up. The hotel restaurant is fairly average with some bright spots (the New York Strip). There are no restaurants of interest within walking distance of the hotel. NASCAR races are held at Daytona Speedway, which is on the other side of town. You might want to get a room at the Hilton Garden Inn if that is why you are visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to all the extra charges.”
Reviews.Author: Alex6860898
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. Beds were too soft for me, but that's a personal preference. When my wife was looking over our bank statements, she noticed that they had charged $40 for a $3 hairbrush at the gift shop and also added charges for services we did not use. When we talked to them about it, we were ignored. Nice view of the beach though. But when a business like the Hilton tries to "steal" from their customers, they at least deserve the lowest rating, and probably an investigation.

Reviews.Title: “Convention hotel, a few rusty corners, in good shape...”
Reviews.Author: lllClifflll
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for a night as were were passing thru Daytona. I wanted to wake up on the beach and this got it done for double digits. The Hotel suffers from some rusty things (balcony, stairs on the ocean side, doors) and noisy AC but the rooms are well insulated and I slept well. The view is great and location couldn't be better for the area. Paying extra to park in an open lot bothered me a little but came expecting to pay. The valet was a litle pushy and the lady at the desk forgot to return my credit card. Overall no big problems just little things... I would stay again and would consider this stay to be a good one even with some hiccups.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eastwind78
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Daytona Beach for a conference and stayed in the Hilton as it was only 1min walking distance from the Conference Center. Beside the over-friendly staff, I was very disappointed with the appearance of this hotel. From the outside I was expecting a lot. The lobby, gym and pool area are not to bad either. But as soon as you get on your floor you see old walls and carpets which show random bleach marks. The rooms were clean but windows were very dirty. No fridge, no WiFi. I stayed in hotels with less stars which offered more. Next time I wont choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fall beach visit”
Reviews.Author: MJ_Otown
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to Daytona and the accommodations at the Hilton. Be aware that self-parking is available for a fee across the street behind a BBQ restaurant. Rooms have wired access for a fee but no wireless access. Free wireless is available in the lobby and conference area. We attended a conference and one of us had a food allergy. The staff was extremely helpful in providing meals that we could eat. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Get-away”
Reviews.Author: All_Inclusive_Lovers
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a staycation, but wanted the feel of really getting away, so when I found the Hilton Daytona Beach I booked it. The hotel is beautiful, clean and has a friendly staff. Check in was a breeze. Brittney B at the front desk was fabulous. It was my boyfriend's birthday and she made many suggestions to make his night special, including surprising him (and me) with a delicious chocolate cake sent up to his room on a plate with Happy Birthday in chocolate. Really a nice touch. Brittney also suggested the HydePark for an earlier dinner and the drinks and appetizers were awesome. Although the weather wasn't the best, the beach and pool area were very nice. Our room was an ocean front on the 9th floor and had a fantastic view. Only critique I could make is that although there is internet access option for a fee in the room, it's only wired, not wireless. The lobby does have wireless, but if you want to be in bed and on your laptop/ipad, not happening. Wire is on the desk. Maybe the hotel can consider converting to wifi. I wanted to thank again Brittney for making our stay a special one and to management, you have a keeper, Brittney is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginny G
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great beach. The rooms are very nice and most have a beautiful beach view. Check in is usually very slow but once you get checked in it gets better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: LindaR1972
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with a great view. We were on the 15th floor and liked it. Very quiet, clean, and comfortable . The employees were very polite and courteous . We had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beachfront”
Reviews.Author: david c
Reviews.Content: Our stay was exceptional. The staff was very accommodating. They have excellent restaurants and the view was nice. They have shops and additional restaurants less than a minutes walk. We walked the beach and by far this hotel is the best. Tip: sign up for Hilton Honors Reward program to receive free valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Happiness”
Reviews.Author: coolnurse
Reviews.Content: I work with a group that uses this hotel every year. Great staff, great location on the beach. Try the Cabana rooms! Hyde Park Restaurant very good.... good deals good food!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not Hilton's Best”
Reviews.Author: Dejais
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend with my mom for a little beach getway. As a Hilton Gold member, we were upgraded to an oceanfront room. The staff was a bit indifferent and the actual property felt as though it had closed up for the season and everyone had gone home. Bars were not in use, the oceanfront snack restaurant (?) area was closed up, and bellhops were nowhere to be found. The hallways are very dark but I think that is to minimize the threadbare carpet. Our room could have used refurbishing but the beds were typical Hilton comfort. Always a good thing. The ocean view was amazing and the Oceanwalk restaurants and movie theater were a God send in the bad weather. As a Gold member, I receive free internet access but really what good is it if there is no wireless available in the room? All in all, not a bad hotel just not up to Hilton's usual standards. Although I will say, the valet Steven who greeted us on our first day made us feel like VIPs. If only all of the employees had his exhuberance and work ethic!

Reviews.Title: “A major blemish on the Hilton brand...”
Reviews.Author: JMChatelain
Reviews.Content: The only thing of note about this hotel is it's location- by far the best location right on the beach, with plenty to do just outside of the hotel's doors. That's about where the positives end. Rooms are extremely outdated (decor and amenities), service is MISERABLE (I was not asked a single time if I was enjoying my stay, even when correcting a billing issue from valet), and eating on property is wildly expensive. This hotel is really in need of a major facelift, and probably some new management who actually have customer service principles. I would say avoid this hotel if possible, even a cheap rate didn't make it worth it to me...

Reviews.Title: “Group Rate a Little Higher than Online Rate . . .”
Reviews.Author: DNWahoo
Reviews.Content: Attending a recent convention at this Hilton, I found an opportunity to book additional guests to stay at the same property. After checking online, I discovered that the 'special convention reserved rate' wasn't as inexpensive as identical rooms that could be reserved online (nearly $30 difference). Wow! Also, my 'lowly' status as a Hilton Honors 'Blue' member netted me zero - zilch - notta (well, they said I'd get 'free internet' - but, so did everyone else). Valet parking is $17 per day - but well worth it . . . especially if it rains! Also, **if you stay in the South Tower, you will need to go to the North Tower to retrieve your valet parked car - 'inconvenient.. The room was nice - well-appointed, well-mainteined/serviced, and it faced out on the ocean. I have previously stayed here in an oceanfront room. **Ask for a room with a sliding glass door when you book an oceanfront room (some - like mine - do not have one). You'll love the breeze and the sound of the ocean. And, the spectacular view of an oceanfront room is not to be missed! I was extreemly pleased with the Business Center staff - 'going out of their way to assist. The evening Gift Shop employee was cordial and very helpful. The Legends Sports Bar Staff took good care of our group. Their food prices were a little more than expected - but the food was exceptionally good. **Groups should know that the main conference room can actually be very cold - they don't skimp on the a/c . . . sweaters for the ladies are advisable. I would probably book a room here again - 'taking into account and avoiding the issues I've encountered.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit”
Reviews.Author: Becka07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during September with my family. We upgraded to an oceanfront room for an extra $40 per night which was well worth it for the view. The rooms are basic in furnishings but very clean and did provide everything we needed. We stayed on the 16th Floor in a corner room which was nice and quiet. All of the staff are genuinely friendly and make you feel welcome. The security/loss provention/medic (unsure of which dept they were) were of great assistance when I injured myself by tripping on a dangerous sidewalk (near the 7-eleven) treating my cuts and providing extra antiseptic wipes, bandages etc. The hotel front desk were happy to call Taxis' when needed. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was enjoyed and had friendly servers (its a little pricey, but its all you can eat which includes freshly made to order omelettes). The pool area was great but I was slightly concerned with how easy it is for people not staying at the hotel to walk off the beach into the pool area (we noticed this happening alot but nothing can be done i guess as its too open). The hotel is next door to Ocean Walk Shoppes which has some great places to eat and a cocktail bar so its easy to have a stroll back to the hotel next door to save on driving. I did enjoy my stay here and I know my family did also. If we come back to Daytona beach we would choose this hotel for its great location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: 80degreesouth
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying I recommend this resort to anyone coming to the Daytona area. The staff is amazing, from the door greeters to the cleaning personal. I have stayed here three times in the last five years and it has been great. Clean rooms, great coffee, and good times. The only complaint I would have is the self parking is a pain. With my room being in the south tower all the way at the end of the hall, it makes for a lot of walking and some inconvenience. Also the pool was pretty dirty bugs, sand, etc. They tried running this automatic cleaner when i was there it did a horrible job, still dirty after the attempt. I think it may be time they work on different measures of cleaning for the pool. I all i would say the best thing about this resort is the staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Florida Beach Experience”
Reviews.Author: RKW60
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I spent 3 days there, leading into Labour Day. This was our first trip to Florida and it was great. We upgraded to an oceanfront room and the view was fantastic - gorgeous sunrises, pelicans flying by, and the beach! We were able to sit in our room and enjoy the concert in the bandshell and watch the fireworks over the ocean. We loved being able to move from the beach to the pool. Staff were friendly and very helpful. There were fast food and local restaurants nearby. We took advantage of the tour to the Ponce de Leon Lighthouse and Marine Science Centre and had a great time. Would have liked to see Daytona Speedway but no shuttle to it. Would highly recommend this hotel to others .MR Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_in_FL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a cycling event most recently but also stayed for a work-related seminar several months ago. The staff was helpful and cheerful, and my room was very clean - perhaps some of the furniture was showing a little wear but overall the room was perfectly pleasant, and I had a wonderful view out over the ocean. There are a number of meal options within walking distance. I will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: BW2003
Reviews.Content: First off, the staff was 100% what you would expect from a Hilton. Very professional check-in, check-out, etc. The room, however, left a lot to be desired; it kind of reminded me of what you would see at a 2- 2.5 star hotel. The furniture was older and somewhat beat up (i'm sure from spring breakers). The TV was an old 25 inch CRT. The beds were very comfortable, but the linens were somewhat dated too. My room had an AWESOME ocean view, and with the hotel sitting right on the beach, you can't ask for a better location. Good night life within walking direction all around (oyster's pub was a pretty fun place). Parking was $17 to valet, $10 to self park (worth the $17 to valet, trust me). All and all, not too bad, just nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: katencam
Reviews.Content: Great location in Daytona, very nice hotel with expansive lobbies, restaurants, valet parking, etc. Directly accross the street from the convention center. The entire staff couldn't have been nicer. The front desk staff was very busy when I checked in around 10 pm, and they were still very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were fine. Nothing fancy, but clean enough with coffee maker which is very important for me! They were a little run down as others have posted, but not a big deal for me. Everyone has different priorities. I also got a great deal on hotwire for 62.00 per night, but I would have been happy paying 99.00 which is what others in my group paid.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: crimefighter04
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful clean hotel although we did miss the balcony that was not provided. Staff and attendants were extremly nice and polite. WE were always provided with ice cold lemon water in the lobby. When we return to Daytona there will only be one place for us to stay! While there a collage football team, a wrestling (Hulk Hogans team), and a flight team stayed there and we all enjoyed the presence of each other. There was a super air show there that we'll never forget! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! from a "southern" west coast, florida resident”
Reviews.Author: AimieJ
Reviews.Content: with or without kids..by far one of the BEST places I have ever stayed!! ammenities, food, DRINKS yummy, location....staff AMAZING...especially Ms Tricha in housekeeping..I hope the resort reads these..I wish I could remember other names...Ms Tricha very much stands out for over and above the call of duty!!!!!!! :) we will definitly make this our place to stay in daytona and make a point to look for the hilton chain when traveling ....... thank you for our relaxing weekend (our stay was sept 9 - 11, 2011) Aimie

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Flordia Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: egotz2fly
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very family friendly. It also would be a wonderful romantic hotel too. The boardwalk below, the great resturants. We slept with the patio door open and flew asleep to the sounds of the waves. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ghelemeister
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was optimal for walking and exploring Daytona Beach. We found multiple places to eat and have drinks within a very short walking distance. We didn't have as much luck at the actual hotel. Apparently September is their off-peak season, so it didn't seem like many restaurants & bars at the hotel were open. The pools were nice, and it was great to have the beach within walking distance. We enjoyed our complimentary breakfast buffet (included with room charge) and it was worth the money! I'd stay there again, if only for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very noisy hallways”
Reviews.Author: kidsfriendly15
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a great price at the Hilton during Labor day. Our first impression, the valet was not very positive. The driveway is very small with extremely busy traffic. The check in process was very nice, and our room was spacious and clean. The problem was the noise in the hallway. Yelling, laughing, talking all night long. The food at the hotel is very expensive, what is no problem since it is next to the ocean walk with lots of choices. Nearby you also find Starbucks, Panera bread, Olive Garden, etc. The beachfront pool is nice with a bar. I was very concerned for the lack of security. The gate is not locked and anyone at the beach can walk straight in, including the hotel facilities. I was not comfortable with this. The pool restrooms were very dirty. The hot tub area is also questionable with people just walking in and out from the outside area. Be careful with the Valet charges. They tell you the price is per night, but that is not true. Check out is at 11AM and we stayed longer at the pool. When I picked up my car I had to pay an extra $6 since we did not leave by 1PM. Needless to say I was very upset. The other option the self parking is on the other side of the street and requires a lot of walking. Since I was by myself with my 2 kids I decided to valet. Costly choice! I am not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay!”
Reviews.Author: kelley_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 3-4 Hilton Hotels in Florida over the last year and I regret to say that this one was not in the same catagory as the rest. The terrace on the back side over looking the beach is beautiful. The location is great with many different restaurants and the water park right across the street. However the non valet parking is off site and I was not comfortable walking back to my room with my kids at night with some of the characters roaming around. The board walk is right there if you like the carnival like atmosphere. I would stick to the restaurant area near the north tower. We were upgraded to the deluxe room and it was very roomy. We had 3 boys with us and everyone had a place to sleep. They even brought a extra bed for us which was very comfortable. Except they gave us 2 large pool towels for an extra blanket. This hotel is definately showing some age. The bathroom tiles were dirty and cracked. The tub looked dirty due to stains. The furniture and tv looked old and the over all cleaness was not up to par with the other Hiltons I've stayed at. Glass throughout the Hotel looked dirty and generally neglected. The waitress at the breakfast buffet and the front check in desk were very friendly. All in all it's not a bad place to stay. But Honestly I wouldn't pay top dollar to stay here. If you can get a discount rate, then maybe it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Betty T
Reviews.Content: We went to Daytona Beach for a family get away with the kids. We went to the lagoon and the kids loved everything there. We also took in the beach while we were there. The room was very nice and comfortable. The staff was really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Ocean Walk Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LUVMESUMSB
Reviews.Content: What a terrific facility ~ heavy amenities..great staff! Always have a solid experience with this hotel. Within walking distance (short) the strip mall, Bubba Gumps Seafood, many shops, coffee/internet cafes, clubs, and ice cream ~ even a small movie theater. The bungalos on the beachfront/pool side are also very nice but can be noisy from boardwalk on busy weekends.

Reviews.Title: “daytona”
Reviews.Author: iamjesse
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Nice beach. Great area. Large rooms and hotel has restaurant and many amenites.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews and you will know what to expect.”
Reviews.Author: Roger M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Daytona Hilton was Great! I went with my wife for a 3 night getaway. Let me start by saying we booked through priceline, name your own price. $48. a night.(we saw that price on betterbidding.com) Total with tax was $172 for the 3 night stay. What a great deal. We arrived at the hotel on 9/9/11 around 3:30 pm. The valet greeted and welcomed us with a smile and some small talk. Very Nice. The price for valet service at the hotel is 18.11 per night tax included.(not a surprise because we read it in the reviews). Most Hotels on the beach charge to park. You could save a few bucks if you park in their lot across the street for $10. a night.(who wants to walk in the heat to your truck) Upon checkin we were greeted by a greeter and waited about 5 min for checkin. Grace at the front desk checked us in. We asked for a room in the south tower(reviews said that the north tower is not as nice as the south), She said that wouldnt be a problem. We also asked for a oceanfront room after she said no problem to stay in the south tower. She upgraded us to a king oceanfront room on the 8th floor overlooking the beach, ferris wheel, boardwalk, and bungi slingshot. What a Great view and nice room. The room was clean, the linens were clean, and it smelled clean. The only downside was the decor was a little dated as well as the TV. Overall we were very happy with the room. We ate on property at Legends one night. the food and staff were great! We also ate at Hyde Park on Sunday night and had the $19.90 special(Best Deal) and an additional $6. for the filet. Food was great as well as the service. We ate at Bubba Gumps and a few local places. Food everywhere was great. The only thing I didnt like was that they charge $10. a night additional for wired internet. I have a smartphone so we didnt use that service. There is however free wireless in the lobby if you need it. The housekeeping service did a good job except one day when I requested extra towels on a note next to my $5. tip, they didnt leave the extra towels but did take the tip anyway. So on checkout day I only left $2. I dont mind tipping hotel staff for good service. $12. for our stay with housekeeping $22 with Valet, and $4. for the bellhop who helped us when we checked out. We went to a few local places for drinks on and off the boardwalk. Be fair warned to be careful at night on the side streets. We saw quite a few homeless and thugs. We had no problems except for beggers. The police in Daytona are on the ball. They were everywhere, on the beach in trucks, on bikes and on foot on the boardwalk. We also saw a few zip by on segways. They do control the area and the trash does not. We felt secure at all times when near the hotel and beach. Keep up the good work DPD. I wish I could book directly with the hotel at this rate but they said they dont offer rooms at that price. I'm sure we will be back.(through name your price on priceline) We are very happy we stayed at the Daytona Hilton. It was Great! Thank you Hilton! Read the reviews and judge for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, not great.”
Reviews.Author: BlueMoc
Reviews.Content: Family spent three days at the hotel in July. Let me start by saying we had a good time and the staff was fantastic. However, the room lacked a bit for what I'd expect from this class of hotel. Little things, like an old TV in the room and chair with stained fabric. And from where we were in the north tower it was a bit of a hike to the pools and beach. If you like being close to the Daytona boardwalk and want a hotel with a number of amenities like restaurants and bars then this is a great hotel. However, if you are more interested in nicer rooms with easy accessibility to pool and beach then you might look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “No better location on Daytona Beach. Nice place. Everything is close.”
Reviews.Author: BcOneSeven
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times. Depending on the deal you get, you might even call it cheap! I have been going to the Daytona 500 for ten years now and have tried various combinations of hotels and timeshares in both Daytona and Orlando. By FAR, this is the best location. Prices vary greatly, but if you can get in for a reasonable price, look no further. You can take a bus or taxi to the track (I even walked once last year, but it is quite a distance so give yourself time and don'g drag a cooler!). There are several eating and drinking options right in the hotel. They are typically high priced and the beer selection could be better (lots of regular American swill if that is what you like), but there is plenty of good food and drink within easy walking distance. The ocean view rooms are fabulous! If you can afford it or you can get a good deal, STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful-Beautiful-Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: grandma212
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful time and the veiw was amazing, Our room was nice and clean, they had really nice tolieties

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: I just can't understand all the negative reviews on this hotel. I am a Hilton Diamond member, and consider myself as fussy as most. Although the hotel could use some updates, I found its level of cleanliness to be up to par with other Hiltons. In fact, I've stayed at Sheratons that were no better than this Hilton. The location, nice pool, beautiful beach, make this hotel a good choice. Granted, the lack of a safe was somewhat inconvenient. However, we made daily use of the safe deposit box at the front desk. I've come to the conclusion that most of the complainers are not Paris Hilton wannabes, but instead are so unsophisticated that they just have no idea of what is considered acceptable while on vacation. A good example is the complaint about ants/insects in the rooms. Folks, when staying in tropical locations, you're going to have some insects!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the Hilton brand”
Reviews.Author: Ioannavacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year in the south tower and our room was decent. This year we had a room in the north tower and it's a completely different story. Room was small, furniture dated and in shabby condition. The bathroom was disgusting. The bath tub didn't drain, toilet made a loud noise when flushed, and the tiles were cracked surrounded by rust and dirty grout. The carpets were worn and torn in some places. Self park is a pain to access. Pool is cold. People were smoking by the hot tub with young children around. They were out of pool towels and I had to ask twice for assistance to get some. We will not return to daytona beach after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Daytona Beach right at the Pier”
Reviews.Author: RamDynasty
Reviews.Content: These people that complain about this hotel must just love to complain and go way out of their way to look for anything slightly wrong. This place is right at the pier with an excellent pool, pool bar, sand volleyball court, the best steakhouse in daytona on its premises, magic shows outside by the legendary clock tower, connected to the new oceanwalk, and the bandshell. The beach at the Hilton cant be touched by any resort in Daytona. You can sit outside on the property and rent anything you want for the beach. The ferris wheel, the bungee ball, and the octopus ride are next door on the pier. This location cant be beat and the facilities are 1st class. I dont know what some expect but seriously, how can you not love being here?

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Hilton property?”
Reviews.Author: dapapabear
Reviews.Content: This is an older property and it has not aged gracefully. Common areas are clean, but in need of maintenance. The rooms do not have safes! The furniture is old and tired, the closet doors are cheap and constantly fall off their tracks. No fridge, when you flush the toilet wear earplugs, maid service missed our room, and didn't come back even when I complained. Drinks are pricey and very thin. Pools are small, and decks are limited, I can imagine it is horrible around the pool when this hotel is busy. The location of the Pelican bar prep area makes the deck smell bad, you can fix this with a vent, and remove the garbage! A nice smile, and courteous demeanor does replace maintenance and needed upgrades. I hope that the management will spend more time planning and implementing improvements and less time answering(spinning) these opinions. We chose this hotel because it was a Hilton property, We will no longer be lulled by the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't stay in this Hotel-Hot, smelly, worn, poor customer service and ridiculous parking set-up"”
Reviews.Author: HonestReview000
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears nice from the outside, and lobby area. My husband and I checked into the hotel as a couple (no chldren) and were put on the 5th floor which is the kids zone. The walls may as well be made out of paper. It is LOUD. Everything you would expect to be a typical convenience is a pain. No onsight parking, other than valet which is $17 per day, plus tips. Alternate parking is more than a block away from the North tower, so plan on walking. Not to mention, it's costing you $10 per night to park in a fenced lot in an area you'd probably rather not leave the car overnight. The Room: The rooms were not clean. Bathroom tub and sink was rusted, dirty grout, clogged and would not drain. Called the front dext the next morning, by that afternoon they sent up an engineer who drained it but said it still needed to be unclogged. No fridge, no microwave. Old outdated, dirty furniture and carpet. Just not a pleasant room or experience. This hotel has missed the mark completely. Finally, we requested fresh towels and the maid did not understand what we were saying so the desk called up to see what we needed. I told the desk clerk we needed towels and hours later, no towels. We left the room around 3:00 pm and still no room service and no towels. and towels finally changed out, but the tub still had a ring around it from the standing water and the sheets were not changed on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NO_Member_Name
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. We’ve stayed there a number of times and will go back. If you’re looking for a Hilton/Marriott class hotel in Daytona, this is the one to go to. They’ve got Hilton rooms (although they’re due for an update). Check-in has always been smooth. The staff is competent (although Room Service could use some work). And, they’ve got a nice selection of restaurants, bars, and other entertainment in and around the hotel. We last stayed in August for the Saturday night fireworks show (Memorial Day through Labor Day), and to grab some boat drinks by the pool. It made for a very nice weekend. That said, I would say this place is sometimes a little rough around the edges. I don’t disagree with some of the things said in the more negative reviews, I just don’t worry about it as much. It’s Daytona after all, not Palm Beach or Miami. The windows tend to be dirty, but it’s right next to the ocean. Parts of it are a little stuck in the 80s, but they’re still reasonably nice and most of the place looks perfectly modern. And, they main pool does get overly crowded during the peak season, but the beach doesn't. One of the employees told me they really got slammed by the recession and still haven’t recovered, but they seem to be doing a very nice job considering. So, if you want to stay in the center of town where there’s the most to do, this is the place to stay. If you want to stay in an actual 4 star hotel in Daytona, this is also the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Grump1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during my nephew's graduation from Embry Riddle. The graduation was across the street at the Conventin Center and this was a perfect spot. Hotel was very clean, check in was a breeze and very polite young lady at front desk. All the Valets were nice for as busy and hot it was, they always had a smile. They were a little short staffed at the lobby restuarant but the food was good and the waitress busted her tail so no complaints there. Rooms had ocean view which is very nice, they do need screens so you can leave door open at night to get the sea noise and breeze, if not you wake up with birds looking at you in the room. Overall the location, service and cleanliness make this probably one of the best places to stay in Daytona Beach. Would I go back? In an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Run as far away from here as possible.”
Reviews.Author: PinkL0ver
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors diamond member, we were extremenly disappointed in everything about this hotel. First, the rooms suck. They are in need of some major TLC and look like they havent been cleaned in forever. The carpets had so much sand in them and when we arrived at our room the closet door was completly broken. The furniture in this hotel is very outdated and they still have box TVs from the 90s. We had a constant issue with not being given more than like one clean towel a day which defintly doesnt work for a family of 4. Also, we really wish they had an actualy balcony that you could sit on. We were also disappointed that there wasnt a fridge in the room. From our room in this hotel, we had sooo much walking to get anywhere. Having to haul beach toys back and forth was such a hassle. The pools in this hotel were also extremenly bad. Having only 2 pools for such a big hotel shocks me. The 2 pools they do have are very disappointed. They were so dirty and looked like the sand hadnt been cleaned out of them in weeks. We found that the pool on the 5th floor was almost always out of clean towels and we saw dirty towels sit there for days. Also, the hot tub had broken jets and so much sand in it. Overall, these pools are horrible. The resturant inside this hotel is good however extremenly pricey. The food at the resturant was defintly the best thing about this hotel. The parking situation is horrible. Having an unattented lot across the street simply made us way too nervous so we opted for valet parking. However, every time we called to get our car we would show up when they said it would be there and we would have to wait another 5-10 minutes for it to get there. Overall, the Daytona Beach area is extremenly run down. It looks very trashy and has so many boarded up businesses that are such an eye sore. The beach is nice though. I suggest not coming here until there is some very major TLC done to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should have listened to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Corey M
Reviews.Content: A day before our two night mini vacation I read several reviews, I was past the 72 hour window to cancel so we had no choice. I agreed with most of the reviews. The staff was fairly nice. The hotel definately needs some TLC. The carpets in the hallways and lobby need to be relaced badly. The pools we ok but could use alot more cleaning. The pool on the fifth floor was neglected. We noticed in the morning that all the wet dirty towels from the previous day were still out there. The kids club SUCKED. We went in there at 3pm and they said they were open 5-6 for free play. We went back at 5:05 the doors locked and no lights on. Finally at around 6 the manager offered no help and just suggested I call next time. I don't think I would stay there again. It was a real disappointment. Not what I expect from a Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the beach but Daytona Beach isn't what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Mermate
Reviews.Content: We took a short family trip to Florida over the July 4 weekend, visiting areas we stayed when our children were young. Among the areas visited was Daytona Beach where we stayed at the Hilton Oceanwalk. Of all the hotels on Daytona Beach, the Hilton was likely one of the best if not the best, as there is still activity around the boardwalk, which is nearby. A new mall that includes some eating places is also on that end of the beach. It was nice to have some food options as there are few along the Daytona Beach strip. Our stay at the Hilton Oceanwalk was nice. Staff "upgraded" us to the north tower of this HUGE hotel, but I'm not really sure it was an upgrade. Our room, while spacious, was just an ordinary hotel room and quite tired looking at that. Definitely needs a remodel, but it was comfortable. The hotel did a nice job of combining two hotels together but there are still two lobbies, two pools, and a lot of walking. That was not really a downside to us though. We spent our time on the beach instead of at the pool and the beach is as nice as ever. The pools looked very inviting too. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning and it was phenomenal. Well worth the price--lots of fresh fruit! The staff we met were very hospitable and friendly. Overall we were very satisfied at this hotel. By the way, it is close to the convention center too, if you have an event there. I rated the hotel average, but considering how old many Daytona Beach businesses have become, it was probably one of the best places to stay. For the area it was perhaps above average. Daytona Beach overall looked tired and impoverished. While the beach is as beautiful as ever, the whole area needs a big infusion of TLC. It was sad to see how one of our favorite areas had deteriorated. We hope once the economy picks up that it becomes a thriving, lively place once again. We had fun despite the diminished options for things to do. Our aim was beach and dejavu. We were happy.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rwilli29
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on trip advisor often, and have no idea why this hotel has such bad reviews. When we arrived, we were upgraded to an oceanfront. It was 1 am when we got there, but the staff was as friendly as if it were the daytime. I did not encounter any bad customer service throughout my trip. Upon leaving, the valet quickly got our car, helped with our bags, and even asked if we needed directions anywhere. There is no better hotel location on the beach. Right next to the boardwalk, bandshell, waterpark, and ocean walk village. The breakfast was a little high, but if you want something cheaper maybe you shouldn't be staying at a 4 star resort with one of the most famous names in hotels. Although high, the breakfast exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “stay on the beach”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy. A nice place to stay if you will be on the beach all day. Area is kind of sketchy at night. I didnt find any good restaurants around either. Some crazy bar scenes though!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever will I return”
Reviews.Author: Vixengirl71
Reviews.Content: To this so called resort. Very outdated and no refrigerator in rooms. Called ad they said $ 10.00 a night. I thought this was the Hilton?!?!?! No flat screen TV and the alarm clock did not work. Save your self and go to the resort beside them that has all these features.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: dockguy57
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful stay at this hilton. the service was good and the rooms are very nice. enjoyed our stay. the bed are soft but we like a very frim bed

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok Really-Needs more Staff and Better Parking”
Reviews.Author: OLROOsMUM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night following our visit to Orlando. Beach location FAB! Great views from patio areas along front. Room good size although as other reviewers have said a little dated, although clean. The check-in was VERY slow---very understaffed for such a big hotel. Also the parking situation is a REAL Issue---we waited 25 minutes in a queue for parking with no information until we got to the front ---the information being a $10 charge for unsecured parking across the road or $17 for Valet---we chose the latter. It was a good job we werent going to use our car until we were leaving. Didnt have breakfast as I thought $20 per adult was steep for what was available. Also the hotel does have cleanliness issues in some of the public areas,cigarette ends, empty glasses left in public areas-----there was a syringe/needle on one of the outside benches!!! I was mortified having 2 children with me. However giving the hotel/area the benefit of the doubt it could have been dropped by a diabetic by mistake!!! All in all and "average only" hotel with lovely views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: sfloydBristol_CTUSA
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend at this hotel and came away very disappointed. The location was great with lots to do in the immediate area, especially for kids, but the hotel is old and the rooms are in need of renovation. The rooms made you feel like you were in a low budget motel, not a Hilton. We had a room with a direct oceanview, but the glass on the sliders were so filthy you really could not enjoy the view. The room was not well cleaned and the bottom of the tub was very slippery ( I don't know with what and I tried not to think of what it might be) and yes I fell right on my butt as I stepped in the shower... I notified the front desk and a manager came to look at the room. The manager apologized for the condition of the room and said he would make sure housekeeping did a thorough cleaning the next day and offered me breakfast passes for the next two days. Well to my surprise the next day our room was not touched at all by housekeeping. We came in late that evening and were shocked. We called the front desk and told the clerk our rooms had been missed and instead of sending someone to clean the room she offered me free breakfast buffet passes. Yes again! Like that would take care of the problem... I gave up and just asked for clean towels and waited 45 minutes for them to be delivered to the room. I realized I was going to need more soap too and opted to go down to the front desk and pick it up myself to save time (a very long walk) but when I got there the clerk said she did not have any on hand, but would have someone bring it to my room...Ughgg!!!! I had to wait another 30 minutes, before I could take a shower. I'm wondering if the management of this hotel really feels that a free breakfast is a good substitute for poor service. I certainly don't. If you report a problem, they should immediatly fix the problem and then offer a free breakfast or something for your inconvenience. That is how you build brand loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH AMENITIES”
Reviews.Author: ricoricorico
Reviews.Content: STAYED AT THE HILTON AUG 8-11. IT IS A TOP NOTCH HOTEL WITH POSITIVELY NOTHING TO DO THERE. I thought a resort of this caliber was supposed to have activities, entertainment, and night life. This is the most boring trip i have ever taken. I will look for better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like hotel”
Reviews.Author: Preynoldst80
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Hotel did not stand up to its name. The help was great but the rooms where old fashion, the bathroom showers had mildew. The lobby was the best decorated, but noticed that the cameras facing the south tower elevators had so must dust on it, looked like it was growing hair, also the air vent return on the 12th floor next to the elevators where so dirty. When using the Valet service from the south tower, if you wanted your car and it was parked at the north tower, you had to walk to the north tower to get your car. Pool was nice and servers at the pool were very friendly. Had to pay extra for a refrigerator, microwave and an extra bed, which was a blown up mattress on a piece of wood that had wheels on one end to roll up to the room. Stayed at many hotels with refrigerator, microwave and an extra bed did not have to pay any extra. Will not stay there again. Not worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: trish0903
Reviews.Content: Went to Hilton for VFW conference, so the rates weren't too bad. The beach was beautiful. Their pools are way too small for so many people. The place is non-smoking and I would have loved a balcony to smoke on but they only have a step out and it can't be used by anyone unless you are model thin. As for the food and drink, as always over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed, might be our new choice for beach hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl21
Reviews.Content: Daytona is not normally our choice beach but I booked a night here b/c we had to attend a wedding nearby. But this Hilton and it's surrounding Oceanwalk area is so cool I think we'll book more often! It definitely beat any of the other Hiltons in Cocoa or Melbourne and exceeded my expectations. I got a great rate ($109) which included the AWESOME breakfast buffet for two--I thought it was a great deal considering the buffet there is usually $20 per person. I was also really impressed with the hotel staff. I arrived really late on Saturday and they upgraded me to an oceanfront room. As soon as I got up there, the fireworks show from the pier was going on. It was just a great experience overall. And one more thing, the pool area is tucked away and sort of private. Also, part of the pool is inside the spa area so we were able to get out of the sun/heat for part of the day. Great beach hotel and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sonia-ottawa
Reviews.Content: Great vacation with the family. A unique fantastic smell in the huge and amazing lobby. Just by the beach. Just excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good experience”
Reviews.Author: LaniePoof
Reviews.Content: Took my granddaughters on a weekend trip to Daytona. There was a wait checking in but it was a Friday 3PM so no big deal. The hallway and rooms were clean and nice. No balcony to speak of but you could open the large sliding door and look at the ocean and have the lovely breeze blow in. Staff was very nice. We were not hit with any unexpected charges. It was $17 a night to valet park. I booked the hotel through Priceline and called to verify any added charges. I had a City view room and if I wanted a Ocean view it we be an added $20 if I wanted an Ocean front it was an added $40 which is what I chose. Everything was explained to me up front with no hidden charges. Enjoyed it with only one complaint the pool for the Souh Tower was in DIRE need of cleaning it had mold and mildew everywhere. That being an easy fix gave this 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: mikedespo
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay the night while in Daytona Beach visiting some extended family. Check-in was simple and quick. The hotel is located right on the beach which was great. Our room unfortunately faced the other side towards the city and main street which is not really all that great to look at. The area the hotel is in is somewhat "honky tonk" which you can argue is typical for a seashore city that caters to families or to Florida in general; however, I have found far more attractive waterfront cities in Florida than Daytona Beach. Not really the hotels fault that the view is less than spectacular. The room was modest but very big ... bathroom was spacious, too. Sink area outside the bathroom as well (in addition to one being in the bathroom) which is excellent. Room service came promptly and was good. Full selection of hot and cold meals on a 24 hour basis (a plus when checking in late which I did). Had to pay extra to valet the car; however, it was reasonable and came promptly when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: David1827
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the view. Check - in was a nightmare. 7 people working the desk and it still took 1/2 an hour. When we finally reached the check-in desk, our king sized room wasn't ready. (this was after 4 with check in allowed at 3:00PM) We were told we could have 2 queens or wait for the King. We took the queens - not an upgrade! The room was clean with a beautiful view. The furnishings are outdated, tiny table, no fridge, old tv. - nothing special. It was also noisy. We could hear the people next door unzipping their suitcases and muffled conversations. We went to Doc Bales restaurant in the hotel for breakfast. We weren't given any menues, just told where the buffet was. The buffet was substandard, runny eggs, greasy sausage and a cockroach skittering across the floor as my husband entered the buffet room. The common areas outside were littered with fast food containers, cigarette butts and papers. The 5th floor pool was filthy, mats of hair and feathers in a cloudy soup. The staff were very nice and tried to be accomodating, but they are overwhelmed. This property needs to hire more people and upgrade their facilities considerably before we would ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton needs a facelift in certain areas”
Reviews.Author: MartiLittleRock_AR
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hilton for about 12 nights over the last year and overall have enjoyed it. They recently changed how they do their valet parking which I am not fond of. You have to pick your car up in the north tower even if you drop it off in the south tower. It is quite a hike from the south to north tower. The rooms and hallways could use some updating of carpet and decor. It looks very late 80s early 90s. Overall it is clean and the staff are cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Attack of the Moths”
Reviews.Author: kishmir2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrid. Our room was infested with large moths. The manager on duty told us it was due to spring break having allowed them in. However after killing the 10th I decided to change rooms. The attitude of the staff was disgusting. You would think I was complaining about an ant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: fbbarbara
Reviews.Content: We almost booked another hotel on the basis of some of the reviews I read here, but we took a chance are glad we did. The room was clean and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location is great. We walked to the end of the the hotel to the bandstand to listen to a concert, had dinner at Buba Gump's next door and watched fireworks from our balcony. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: freightliner11
Reviews.Content: Loved our 2night stay not the 1000 church kids all over the hotel praying in everycorner then swarmin the pool and not likin the room service tray from our neighbour that sat 3 days never picked up from whomever gross in hotel hallway and yes it was the same tray not different orders we could tell the view is why we stayed hotel room was clean pricwy movie rental 18 for fast and furious on a tube tv needs updating we ate elsewhere c of cost on grounds pool was nice minus the kids location is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Up To Standards”
Reviews.Author: DRussell88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few people following the Daytona 500, and was not unhappy. Check-in time was busy since it was right after the race, but even then everything flowed very nicely and we had very little wait. Employees there were very polite as it has almost always been with my Hilton stays, even though it was as busy as it was. The room itself was nice and spacious, and had a fantastic view of the beach that I wish every hotel in Florida had. It allowed for a great wake-up in the morning with the sun shining in. The only downside of the morning was the breakfast, which was overpriced for what we got. Yes, free tickets were provided for a couple of us, but the price for those who paid was outrageous. This does, however, seem pretty standard. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for a good stay and night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: cigarboo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay. I found the hotel to be acceptable. It's a bit dated, but the hotel seemed to have tried their best at updating and maintaining a nice look. Check in was unusually slow with our room not ready until about 5pm. Seems the kind of hotel where many rooms check out on Sundays as folks finish up a weekend stay. However, these things should probably be anticipated, so I assume they must have been short staffed. Other than that, We had a lovely stay. The location can not be beat. So close to shops, entertainment and restaurants, not to mention that it's ocean front. The room was clean and had what we needed. We didn't get to spend much time in the room because we were short on time and had so many entertainment options. Self park was across the street, but that's fine. Only a few minutes walk Price was reasonable considering that it's a beachfront location with many amenities. I also value the fact that it's on a traffic-free portion of the beach. In general, Daytona seems to be a very reasonably priced vacation destination. I would definitely be back and look forward to staying at the Hilton Oceanwalk. Met my expectation for the price paid, compared to other beach front hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great lobby and atmosphere, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: carlycunn
Reviews.Content: We read several of the reviews prior to going. It wasn't, to me, a bad as some of the reviews and dead on for others. We went there on a family trip - to see the shuttle launch and attend Kennedy space center. The best - the location is great. It's right on the beach and on the boardwalk. Close to a variety of restaurants to choose from all in walking distance. The lobby offers a wide array of food options as well .. it's big, open, clean and bright. The bellboy was quite helpful. Suggestion: We heard the rooms in South Lobby have more up-to-date bathrooms and flat planel tvs. The North Lobby where we stayed doesn't have updated bathrooms and probably was the cause of much of the negative review in terms of the room. We didn't use the pool or spa areas but walked there. Nice .. Too bad, we ran out of time. The rooms is spacious (that's a plus) .. accustomed to larger, flat planel tvs now - it was discouraging to see a 19inch (or something like that) regular tv. For the size of the room, the tv was too small. We had a city view. But, be warned if you pay for oceanview, the balcony area is very small. You can stand but can not sit there. I didn't have problems with loud noise from the boardwalk or anything. In fact, I thought the room/hall noise was very minimal. We slept well. The best part of it is that we booked this room through priceline. So, our expectations were not as high as some who might have paid full price. If you feel leery, try priceline (and maybe you'll get this hotel at a great rate and be satisfied :-)). Parking and WiFI costs extra. We parked across the street for $10 a day versus using valet parking. It wasn't too bad. We dropped off bags at front with bellboy - went across the street and parked. It was a pain not to have WIFI in the rooms w/out having to pay additionally. We had a wireless card & used it instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: BMTSatelliteBeach_Fl
Reviews.Content: This was a Honors stay, in Daytona for the Coke Zero 400. Hilton very clean and very busy. Good nite sleep, only problem was check in was a little slow other than that everything was up to par. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: DrCarlOrlando
Reviews.Content: It is a Hilton. It is clean. The rooms are nice. The view is nice. The pool is nice. Its right in the middle of Daytona beach..... there again nice. But...... the neighborhood gets down right scarey at night. If you have kids I would not let them roam around at night alone. Also, in our room we they had a double door that conected to the next room. I guess to make a suite. The sound proofing was like zero so we got to listen to the couple next door fight and cuss at each other. So much for a romantic get away. Also the valet people move your car to the north valet at night so you have to hike it back and forth to find your car. The room service girl had gold teeth..... guess it fits with the urban theme. Front desk people were nice. For the money try the Hilton in Clearwater Beach. Much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not what to expect from a "Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: Art0614
Reviews.Content: was planning on staying three nights here using points. I am a Diamond member and do not complain a lot but. Thie room we had in the North tower was not what I would espect in a Hilton. Had plastic wastebaskets in the room like you would find at a Comfort Inn. Furniture was worn and older. Asked about a different room and was told the Hotel was full. Wife and I checked out on Monday and moved to teh Hampton Inn in Daytona Beach Shores and got a much nicer room with an actual balcony that you could sit out on. When compared to Hiltons in Rockwall, Tx, Ontario, CA and Oklahoma City, OK, the Hilton Ocean Walk Village should consider itself a cut BELOW the norm for a Hilton property. Will be staying at the Hampton for any future stays in the Daytona Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, plenty entertainment, and the beach for a view”
Reviews.Author: MsJulicious
Reviews.Content: This place is huge. Lots of places to eat.. Lots! Pros: As I said earlier, there are Lots of places to eat. And also, the hotel is located right in front of the beach! You can see all the beach action from the hotel room. Our room itself was pretty clean as well. Cons: Our room was right in front the stage. We were woken up by the noise from the dude with that annoying sound check "Check, check, 1-2-3." So, if you stay here and want a room with a beach view, get one far from the stage. Oh, by the way, they have pretend balconies. The actual balcony platforms extend only 2 inches beyond the room. Lol. It's across the street from Ocean Center, a very quick 5 min walk to the Ocean Walk Shoppes and a block or so away from the Joyland amusement park if you want to venture beyond the hotel. We won a stay here through the radio station, so I have no idea how much it cost.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to Really Slip”
Reviews.Author: lmhTorrance_CA
Reviews.Content: I'vve stayed at this hotel for 4 consecutive June meetings and it's really sliding downward. While the staff is awesome, the facility is aging and starrting to fall apart. Old fashioned TVs with lousy cable reception, anon-working alarm clock, moldy bath tub, bumby/lumpy carpet, sand in the pool, etc. Nice location, but not up to the Hilton standards. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “outdated, but great views”
Reviews.Author: sljtba
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some updating. This is my 4th visit and I cannot see that any updating has been done in those 4 years. The television was very old and the channels offered were very limited -- lots of sports and news stuff. The spa may be small -- but the service is fantastic. The front desk staff is very friendly and very helpful. Doc Bales is just OK -- overpriced. Hyde Park is great. The location on the beach is wonderful, but the area is very sketchy at night. It is near the city bus transfer station -- a plus and a minus. Many homeless people around the area during all times of the day and early evening. I was not about to go walking around after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; property is long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: DAAFY
Reviews.Content: Second time here, on business. The hotel is adequate, but not "wow". In-room amenities at the North Tower are circa 1994: Small, old-fashioned TV, old phone, old everything. The wireless connection does not cover this part of the hotel, and the only internet available (for $10 per day) is a wired connection that is painfully slow. Still, the property is right on the beach, the steak house downstairs is ok, and if you can get this for the right price, stay here. Nothing wrong with it. It's just not good, either.

Reviews.Title: “TV is old, delivery food is not allowed to come to your room...”
Reviews.Author: Htl_screener
Reviews.Content: - The TV is old (no HD, plasma/LCD, new generation stuff) - Internet is wired (no wireless) - Room service is done by 1am, if you order food after that be prepared to come down to the lobby to get your food. * I would recommend because of how close it is to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat this location.”
Reviews.Author: backstagecheryl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night for a little bit of grown-up "alone time". The hotel is gorgeous and the location is perfect. You can park the car and leave it - there are restaurants, shopping, movie theater, bars, and of course the pool and beach right there within a block or two. We self-parked for $10 in a gated lot about a block away but the hotel does have valet parking in an underground lot. We booked through Hotels.com and chose the option of "room assignment on arrival" and we were pleasantly surprised to get a room with an ocean view, right above the pool. You could practically touch the ferris wheel at the Boardwalk outside our room. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. I really don't want to say anything negative about this hotel at all but unfortunately I have to mention a couple of things - when we went down to the pool, the hot tubs were both out of order. Actually, one had no jets and one had no heat. Not the end of the world but a small disappointment. Also - a bit more of a problem for us - the doors have automatic door-closers on them that really slammed the doors behind you if you didn't catch it behind you. Consequently starting at around 7 in the morning you heard doors slamming all over the place. So if you are wanting to sleep in in the morning keep that in mind. Overall though it was a wonderful experience and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the beach if you hit it on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: zjxtinpusher
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice recently with excellent results. The hotel is huge, and when they are not sold out, they'll sell rooms on PL for as little as $50. The quality of the hotel is excellent, including typically excellent Hilton service. Check-in is a breeze, if a little expensive. Self park is $10 a block or so away, and valet is $17 plus tip. We always valet as they car stays in the on-site garage. The valets are mostly local college students and very courteous and professional. We were disappointed to find the little jazz bar closed this time. On our first trip we heard a wonderful singer (Miss Linda) perform jazz standards. We didn't eat in the restaurants either trip, tho room service was very good one time. They have an on site steakhouse that is supposed to be excellent, but our of our budget. The Ocean Walk is right next door with a decent selection of chain joints. Since we bought on PL, we don't expect the best room, but both times we were upgraded to oceanfront rooms. Most rooms don't have a balcony, but they do have a door that opens to allow you a great view and to hear the ocean. This hotel, and Daytona as a whole is clearly struggling to survive. There are many hotels closed up and boarded up in the area, and with this premium property selling rooms under $100, so bargains are everywhere here. On the down side, there are lots of homeless people around, and a lot of "characters" that make night-time walks a little uncomfortable. This section of Daytona has always been the worst for this environment. Fortunately, the Hilton has an excellent selection of services and amenities right on site, so there is little need to wander. On the whole, this will be our first attempt every time we come to Daytona until the price goes up.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is 5 Star”
