Reviews.Author: Bubblmom
Reviews.Content: We opted to upgrade to the first floor oceanfront room. I highly recommend this as you have a covered patio and direct access to the beach. The rooms were spacious and clean and the beds were very comfortable, however, they are doubles (not queens). I was very suprised there was not Wifi in the rooms, a fridge and old style tvs. This should be a priority of the management to bring the hotel up to modern standards. I cannot say enough about the customer service of this hotel. Every staff member was pleasant and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. The front desk took the time to follow up and make sure my ice was delivered. I'll be back for leisure, definately!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: D2gauth
Reviews.Content: Definately not the Hilton experience I am used to. The first thing I noticed was the stained, faded, and dirty hallway carpets and also in the room. The sheets were stained and dirty looking and the shower tub sank in the middle and was very stained. When getting ready to leave the hotel, i found bugs in my luggage. Lighting in the room was poor.The furniture and decor is very dated, faded, and stained. I could have stayed somewhere way cheaper with nicer rooms. Being a Hilton honors member, I often stay at Hilton hotels. This is definitely the most unappealing and biggest let down of them all. For the price, totally not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Bibifruit24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 3 diamond. So with this in mind, I believe it almost deserves this rating. It looks nice outside, but needs very serious interior upgrading. 1. ROOMS: TVs and furniture are old. Bath tub has mold and is cracked in the corners. 2. AMENITIES: Only shampoo and conditioner are provided in the bathroom. No body lotion, shower caps or other. 3. POOLS: The main pool is quite small and dirty. The second pool on the 5th floor in North Tower is also dirty and the whole pool area looked very shabby. 4. SPA: Spa does not have a steam room, sauna or jacuzzi. It only has a couple of treatment rooms, and the Front Desk for the Spa is for some reason separated from the actual treatment rooms. Very small and lacks amenities. 4. RESTAURANTS: I have not eaten in any of them, but they are all overpriced. Some of them look nice though, especially those with patios overlooking the beach. 5. PARKING: Very inconvenient. You either pay $17 for Valet, or you park yourself across the street in an open-spaced parking lot. Self-parking is $10 and is inconvenient - it's about 5-7 minute walk from the hotel. At the same time, on a Saturday night the Hilton garage (used by Valet) had plenty of parking spaces. 6. LOCATION: the hotel is very conveniently located next to OceanWalk Shoppes and Movies, across the street from the Convention Center, right next to the Pier and the Boardwalk. So it's great and the view from the room is also amazing. 7. SERVICE: The service is good, the Front Desk is helpful and friendly, same with Valet. Everyone seemed nice. OVERALL: it's not a bad hotel, however this hotel is not worth paying $200 and over. If you can get a good deal, you will find it reasonable. Had no idea Hilton owns 3 diamond properties.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: patwa13
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed for three days, it was worth the price. could have stayed at a less expencice hotel and the stay would have been better. my sister in law stayed at a cheaper hoteh and it was indeed better. the ac was not cold, the window treatment did not block out the light and there was a ball of hair under the talbe for my etire stay, the size of a base ball. also one of the sinks was clogged had to avoid it all together. the rooms need upgrading a little out of date.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineB140
Reviews.Content: We used our HH points t ostay at this hotel. The staff was very nice and went out of thier way for us. Upgraded us to a ocean view room. The view was incredible. We were in the south tower. I would totally stay there again. We brought ice cream in our room and found many tiny sugar ants in the morning on both sinks in our room. I have never brought ice cream into a hotel room. Lesson was learned here. We are waiting for Hilton to contact us. As I was told on the 800# last Friday night from Dallas they have to keep the hotel cleaner. I will post again so as I hear from someone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Room”
Reviews.Author: richardbett
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a "last minute" basis. Used Hilton Reward Points and was upgraded to Oceanfront room. Room was clean, view was teriffic. It was a short, but very pleasant stay. Nothing really negative to say other than paying $10/day to park more than a block from the hotel in a "shabby" parking lot. Other than that, we were happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Faux Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jacobs04
Reviews.Content: Everything looked like a Hilton when we pulled up to the hotel. The check-in was a nice and easy process. We all noticed when we first pulled up that the Valet check-in was running quite behind. They took about 20 minutes to get our luggage and our car, but since we were already driving for about 12 hours, it was not even a thought in our mind. Once we checked in, we were offered an upgrade for $40 a night for an oceanfront room, we accepted the offer and gladly checked in. Once in the room, we noticed the non-upgraded rooms that still had old tv's, no refrigerators, and not a Hilton type look in the room. I, along with the rest of my travelers, have stayed at multiple Hilton hotels each year and have always had better accommodations than what we were staying in. We honestly didn't have great expectations since it was on the beach, but with a Hilton name, we expected a lot better quality than what we received. We had no washcloths for 3 days in a row. When we called down each day, they asked if we had them to return....the housekeeping took them everyday but never put new ones back in place of the used. Each time we called down for washcloths or any other request, they took over an hour to respond. Along with the housekeeping, the shower had the same areas of mold after asking the housekeeping staff to try to remove it. They never removed in throughout our stay. The valet would tell you that the car would be ready in 10 minutes, but when we walked down over 20 minutes later, they hadn't even retrieved the car after we had called 20 minutes beforehand. If you want a hotel with a name, stay here, but don't expect anything over a Holiday Inn quality. There are a lot more hotels on the strip next to the Ocean Walk area that would offer better service than this hotel. We all hope that the Hilton bought this hotel for its location and not for its service. They have great lengths to grow before they can ever imagine calling themselves a Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Summerbabe1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hilton Daytona for only 1 night but was impressed with the location and the amount of restaurants it has just in the complex. Some parts of the hotel was very sleek and modern, but some old fashioned and very dated! Very confusing. We stayed in the North tower which was dated but still pleasant. Room was large with a view over Daytona. Free access to the gym was good and was well equipped. We also used the outside pool on the 5th floor in the north tower which was good, we were the only ones there. We took the self parking option at $10 which was just across the road, WIFI access was also about $10 a day. We enjoyed a drink in the Hyde Park Steak restaurant, really nice views. A short walk out of the hotel takes you to an cluster of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest rooms in daytona!”
Reviews.Author: maeday1013
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel during the last week. The only thing this hotel has going for it is good customer service. rooms were so small it was hard to even assemble pack n play. rooms had absolutely no balcony. Pool was okay. view was beautiful. customer service was good. Not family friendly though - more for couples or convention goers. Moved to holiday inn (believe it or not) and it was much more spacious & family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential but run down”
Reviews.Author: Casualdiner99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a recent conference. The hotel staff was by far the best thing going here. I imagine that back in the day this was a pretty plush resort, but it's simply seen it's better day. For that matter, the to entire town fits the same description. Run down. The scary thing is, this appeared to be the best looking resort around. It looks like the City is trying to clean things up but there is a long way to go. When they are done I might consider returning but for now will pass on Daytona Beach. If you feel compelled to visit, I would recommend this hotel, just don't get your hopes up.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business travelers. Block your entire night for the steakhouse.”
Reviews.Author: Brauntosaurus
Reviews.Content: Pros I was unexpectedly given an ocean view room and it was a great view. Service by the front desk and valet parkers was great. The hotel is easy to find. Everything around the hotel including the rooms was very clean and updated. Cons The air conditioning in the room made a loud click every time it went on, and it would go on every few minutes for only a short while. Our server at the hotel steakhouse was terrible and there were actually two people as you find in many nice steakhouses. The manager was great with service recovery but upon giving us our sizable check, our server remarked "that's the way it is sometimes". It took 3.5 hours to have dinner that night.

Reviews.Title: “LARGE HOTEL WITH LOW OCCUPANCY; CAN GET GOOD DEALS ON PRICELINE”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: South tower is newer and nicer; however my room still had old CRT TV and not a LCD flat screen. I went on business from my company so paid $109+tax; occupancy was very low when I was there. It is right on beach. Some restaurants, etc. were closed due to low occupancy when I was there but some others were open. For business travelers, be aware: the hotel sometimes books large youth groups [there was a cheerleader’s convention when I was there] and the youths can be rowdy and boisterous. For example, there are only four computers [all with internet access] in business center and there was a large line of youths wanting to use it so others had tough time getting access. Staff was pleasant enough; I am HHONORS silver VIP member so I got free upgrade to ocean view room on seventh floor instead of city view in north tower. Had fabulous view of ocean and amusement park next door; luckily good sound proofing so noise from park did not disturb me; park brightly lit up with lights on Ferris wheel, etc. Restaurant food is expensive as you would imagine. There are many other restaurants nearby. Seven blocks away is Neelam Indian Restaurant [renamed now] at 318 S Atlantic; Daytona Beach tourism business is way down so I was only person at $9+tax lunch all you can eat buffet; later two others came in. Bombay Grill [also $9+tax] all you can eat lunch buffet at 581 Beville Rd is much better but you need car to get there. Parking at hotel is $10 per night; the lot is diagonally across south tower behind bar-b-q restaurant; I did not find it unreasonably inconvenient. This hotel is directly across from convention center. I used treadmill in well equipped fitness center; did not use pool

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: WendyE77
Reviews.Content: I booked our spring break getaway on priceline and got an amazing deal. I spent $60 a night for three weeknights. Our view was terrible, however they did give this option to upgrade for $40 a night... no thanks! The hotel itself was great, everythign was beautiful. The parking was WAY overpriced, but you have no other choice. This was our first visit to Daytona Beach, so we really didn't know what to expect. The area around the hotel is SCARY! We tried to venture out but were harrassed by panhandlers and street thugs. My daughter left her cell phone on the night stand when we left, and someone had purchased a charger and begun using it by 5pm that afternoon. My only guess is that it had to be hotel staff. Overall, the hotel is great, but the area and people are worth looking elsewhere for your vacation, even at the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Below average resort experience. Still a good choice in Daytona due to little competition.”
Reviews.Author: Moondogge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife, seven year old daughter and 9 month old son for my daughter's spring break. The hotel is a Hilton so I new going in what to expect as far as the rooms go. Unfortunately, the service for a hotel that advertises being a resort falls short. We ordered a crib for my son and it took 6 hours for it to be delivered. I had to call again at 9pm as it was his bedtime and it had still not arrived. The pool area is somewhat small for the size of the hotel, although they do have two pools to choose from. The bathrooms by the pool were without toilet paper for 2 days and the trash in the pool area overflowed for 2 days with the same empty pizza box jammed in the opening. The one bright area was the staff. Every member that I came in contact with was courteous and honestly tried to make my stay better. All in all this is still a good choice in the Daytona Beach area due to a lack of national chain options. I purchased it on Hotwire and the rate was excellent. I would not book at the regular rate, but if you can find a good deal it is still a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good!!”
Reviews.Author: Dania2011
Reviews.Content: It is not the worst hotel, but be careful!!! First, you have to pay for everything, what I mean is that there is no free Wi-Fi, if you want internet it will cost you $9.95 per night when you can get free Wi-Fi everywhere you go, but not at Hilton. You have to pay the parking, if it is self parking it cost $10 per night and it is two blocks from the hotel or you can get valet and it is $17 per night. The neighborhood apparently is not so good because at night there is a lot of police, I walk several miles around there wasn’t so many police in other places which let me to that conclusion. The food is not so good, and I don’t know if I had a bad luck that weekend but I got food poisoning from a room service meal I ordered. On the other hand, the rooms are ok, clean and with a lot of space, the beds are comfortable, but the closet is a little small. The lobby and general view is nice. The customer service is excellent; people here are very nice and helpful. Even though the good side, for me it is not worth it to come back again. I hope it helps you on your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay- Wouldn't pack rack rate though”
Reviews.Author: RockChickX51
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went here on a last minute weekend getaway. We live in Tampa and wanted to go to the east coast for a change of scenery. We booked on Priceline for $65/night. Upon arrival I upgraded for $30/night for a oceanview with a balcony. The balcony, is a joke. It's just two sliding glass doors that open to about a half foot of space before the railing. You can't stand out there and close the door behind you. We were in the south tower which is way at the other end of the property by the steakhouse. The room overall was nice, clean, and fit what we were looking for. We slept both nights with the doors open to hear the ocean. Tube TV in a huge console, furniture and carpet a little beat up, but what can you expect? This is a resort town and these hotel rooms are reamed with spring breakers, bike week, summer breakers, etc. Bed was comfy and had tons of pillows. We didn't eat at any of the on-site restaurants or bars. Right next door is the OceanWalk Village with, restaurants, shops, and a movie theatre. There is also a small midway/pier walking distance from the hotel as well. Seabreeze Blvd where the strip clubs and bars are is also a short walking distance from the hotel. Parking is across the street. We didn't check out the pool because it was cold but there are two pools, one small one for the south tower, and a larger indoor/outdoor pool at the larger tower by the check-in desk. I would definitely stay here for the location alone, but I wouldn't pay the asking price. I'd only book it again on Priceline, and wouldn't pay to "upgrade" to a "balcony."

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Schmooles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and has everything you need. It's close to everything. You can walk. The beach is beautiful. Staff is friendly. I'm glad that I booked through priceline bidding because I would have been disappointed if I had paid full price for the room. The rooms do not match the grandness of the hotel. We just stuck around the hotel and ate at the bar and relaxed by the beach. It was a good vacation. Valet parking is almost $20 a night and self parking is $10...which I imagine change with the times.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice before staying here.”
Reviews.Author: StangNorfolk
Reviews.Content: I checked in 2/25/11 and checked out 2/28/11. My forst night there, I looked around the room, it had a 27" old TV set, that was in a combo drawer and tv stand that was in bad need of painting, the handle used to open and close the drapes came of in my hand, and the alarm clock was digital, but did not light up. i went to take a shower and a used wash cloth was still in the shower! When I asked one of the cleaning ladies to correct it , you guessed it, she did not speak English !! And neither did her supervisor. Oh yea, if you like a nice shower you wont get one here. The water pressure was unpredictable, and it would go from hot to cold to hot. Avery Frustrating weekend. I would have check out and gone some where else but in a resort town, that is not easy, and I had business to take care of. Oh yea, if you eat at that steak house, be prepared to really pay allot for not much. Over all, I recommend going to Miami, or Alaska.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed, for a second time, at the Hilton Daytona. I just have to comment that this hotel has a very friendly and accomodating staff. During both our visits we were greeted warmly by everyone whenever we returned to the hotel or went to one of the restaurants. All of the restaurants on site are very good, have great service and are a pleasure to dine at. The rooms are very comfortable even though there are no balconies. This is a very good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: Megatron71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a volleyball tournament - played across the street at the convention center. You couldn't beat the location - right on the beach, restaurants and bars close by. We ate in the sports bar in the hotel and the food was good - just typical bar food, but good for kids and adults alike. There is a Starbucks down the block which I was happy to have. The pool is nice - partially indoors. It was cold when we were there, but the beach and pool would be great in March or April. My daughter and I shared a room with two double beds. It was completely adequate, nothing fancy. We had an oceanfront room and the view was spectacular. Daytona Beach is not really my scene - it's very built up, and I'm sure it gets crazy in season, but this was a nice hotel, centrally located, and I would stay there again. I did not have the same issues others have noted around service and valet parking. The valet was expensive, but it was nice to not have to worry about my car for the weekend. We had a bellhop check us out on Sunday, and he got my car moved to the front of the valet line. I found the service to be solid during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yachtboys
Reviews.Content: We were there for ten days for speedweeks the room was clean and nice. The bars were great but a little high but it speedweek the parking was the only thing I had a problem with the restaurants were good but we will back next year

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel - just what you need”
Reviews.Author: sojourner2011
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, nice ocean view. Very comfortable bed. Concierge was very pleasant and professional. A Hilton standard hotel in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: bleifuss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in December and was not disappointed at all--oceanview, gift shop, great location, beautiful lobby, clean, friendly staff, even Christmas cookies and carolers! The ONLY thing I would change is the parking situation; we opted for the self-parking across the street, which was kind of spooky at night. Well, I guess I would also ask for a smoking room if one had been available but plenty of places outside to go. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Daytona Beach. Thanks, Hilton, for making my stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible valet parking”
Reviews.Author: homeschoolmtnmom
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute for a one night stay. When we arrived at midnight, the desk staff were superb. They even upgraded our room to oceanfront at no charge. The room was fabulous; slept with the patio door open and listened to the waves crash all night. If it were not for the parking situation, this hotel would get a 5 all the way across the board. However, there is the parking.. When we checked in we were told that we would have two parking options: self park across the street for $10 or valet parking for $17. Since it was suppose to rain in the morning, we chose valet. We were told by the valet to call as we left our room and they would have our car for us. So we did just that. When we arrived at valet pickup, there were about 15 people waiting for cars and several valets running around getting cars. Not to worry, we had called, so we waited. And waited, and waited, and waited. Finally after 30 minutes of cars pulling in and out and none of them ours, we went to check on what was going on. Found out that they had not even pulled our keys. Even after that, it still took 15 more minutes to get our car. 45 minutes of waiting for our car: Unacceptable! We were suppose to have breakfast before our meeting at 9, we barely made the meeting. So I would recommend that you take the self parking option, even if it is raining.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: hungarikee
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is so grand & enormous, you're expecting a nicer room, but since you're probably not here for the room, you won't be too disappointed. The service of staff was second to none. The views are wonderful. Rooms could be upgraded - no flat TV, only some rooms have a little fridge & micro. Charges for parking, internet & even for local calls, but it does have 2 computer centers. Several restaurants. Hyde Park has a great steak & service. You're next to the pier & amusement area & Ocean Walk, so admit it - if you're here to be a tourist, this is the perfect place. Fitness room is great, indoor & outdoor hot tubs. I got a lot of use from the indoor one. Part of the main pool is inside, with those freezer door strips keeping the heat in so you can still swim if it's too cold to use the part of it outside. It is heated. I didn't use it, but saw others who were, & they didn't look cold. Big gift shop downstairs, with not your usual junk, but some really nice things. All in all, I will definitely return. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Uninformed management staff, noisy rooms and ugly view of roof and parking garage on west side of hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 200NightTraveller
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at the hotel. Stuck in north tower of hotel for 2 weeks without possibility of upgrade despite status and despite that the last few years we had been offered it. Room in north tower is noisy, has intermittent motor somewhere above room which turns on and off all night. Staff, especially the manager was uninformed and did not know that others in our group were denied rooms even though they had e-mail confirmations the previous night. In addition they blamed our staff for being too busy to book the rooms. Doesn't make sense given the e-mail confirmations. Hotel has a history of the same in previous stays a few years ago but had improved. It is obvious that the week before Daytona 500 this place would be deserted otherwise but the manager I personally talked to and who didn't know what was going on in her property clearly didn't seem to care about and value recurring large groups of guests. There nicer places to stay than this.

Reviews.Title: “Employees were great, despite a difficult situation”
Reviews.Author: mdhinder
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel ready to enjoy the ocean front location. It was evident as soon as I arrived that something was terribly wrong because the booked solid 744 room hotel was filled with unhappy guests. The computer network was down & all guests had to be manually checked in. It took 5 hours for me to get my room which meant I had no place to freshen up after my day started at 3:30 am to fly to Florida. The staff took it in stride & I commend them for working extra hours & trying to accomodate people as quickly as they could. Their management hopefully has a continuency plan in place to help move things along better should this ever happen again. As for the hotel, it offered many conveniences, had great dining & entertainment options, and the location was fabulous. The room I got was wonderful mostly because of the view of the ocean & sliding door so I could hear the surf all night long. I didn't take advantage of any of the facilities or breakfast offerings so I can't speak to that. I would in the future book this hotel but because I was looking for a romantic setting...I would call and ask if there was a cheerleading/dance competition before I book again. It had the feel of a Spring Break with the majority of the guest being middle/high school age girls & their families.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic 3-star Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Louis_Wilen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a result of a Priceline bid, getting the room for about $65 per night including tax and Priceline fees. At that price, it was a great deal. However, I would have been disappointed if we had paid the regular rate of about $139 for an oceanfront room. The rooms are small (but not tiny) and are nothing special, with no extras such as a fridge or microwave. The bathroom is adequate. The parking charge of $10 per night for self-park was certainly not the highest that I've ever paid, but was an annoyance considering that most hotels in the area charge nothing for parking. The front desk clerk was very welcoming and the housekeeping service was excellent. When we asked for some extra towels, they were delivered within about 3 minutes, which was probably the fastest special request service that we've ever received. Unfortunately, two days after checking out, the hotel charged my credit card for the room, even though it had been purchased through Priceline. In all the years that I've used Priceline, I've never had a duplicate charge by a hotel until now. I'm currently working on getting this duplicate charge removed.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: ponomo
Reviews.Content: stayed during a youth football tournement and the hotel was ok, nothing more or less. It was clean with no-frills. great location near the pier. My only complaint is that parking was a little steep for Daytona Beach, Fl. $20 a night valet or self park across the street for $15 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-season rate”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Daytona Beach before, but at other locations. When we had the opportunity to get a fantastic winter rate, we decided to stay at this hotel. The check-in was very formal and polite, a sort of "welcome to an upscale resort" greeting. I have to say that I was very much surprised by the room. I had expected something really special, since the place appears to be that way from the outside. he room looked a lot like many other rooms I've stayed in. The best feature of the room was the bathroom, which was beautiful had large, thick towels. The lobby area is quite stunning, and it was beautifull decorated for Christmas. There was a huge Christmas tree in the lobby. The pool area was quite nice, with two jacuzzis, a pretty pool deck area, and with part of the pool inside of the building. The location is a real plus for this resort. There is a movie complex next door. There are several nice restaurants next door, also. You can find entertainment here, with rides and a couple of game arcades on the walk near the hotel. We were quite satisfied with this hotel, and the only reason we wouldn't give it a stellar rating is because the room is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Cabana Beach side”
Reviews.Author: Hough10210
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were given a night at the Hilton as a wedding present from some family friends. First off the Valet was really nice when we pulled up. He was very helpful and when we got to the desk the lady at the deask was also very nice. She explained to us where we needed to go and everything about the room. When we got to the room I was amazed. I swear that that cabana was bigger than my apartment. The room was really quiet and it was only like 30 yards off the beach. Any questions we had we just called the front desk and they happily helped us. I would definately go back and stay there again. Oh and the beds were simply amazing. I dont think I have ever stayed on a bed that was that soft or one with sheets that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, stay elsewhere....”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: The Hilton might be a good place to stay during the high season, but there are better values to be found during the offseason. I am currently staying at the hotel and, despite the fact that the hotel is over half empty, they insist on the mandatory upgrade charges on their rooms. The vast majority of the oceanview rooms are empty. Wouldn't it make good business sense to put customers in those rooms when they're available so that it increases the likelihood that they would stay at the hotel again in the future? If the hotel was even half way full, I could see the need to hold the good rooms for last minute reservations. But the hotel is dead empty, and the front desk attendant wants to nickel and dime for a room above the third floor. It's unfortunate that they don't take advantage of the opportunity by spoiling the customers they're lucky enough to have. Also, one other pet peeve of my stay so far, we valeted our car overnight. We dropped the car off at the south tower and are staying in the south tower but have to walk a city block to the north tower to pick up the car when we need it. Once again, if the hotel was busy, I could see the need to force the flow of traffic in that direction, but there is nobody here. The hotel and location are good for daytona beach, but the lack of customer service etiquette is ruining this hotel's chances of thriving. Trust me, look around for other hotels. Instead of getting nickel and dimed like crazy, you can stay in any other of the oceanfront properties here and probably have a balcony overlooking the ocean for less. Feel free to message me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “A totally awesome and amazing hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: DianaW1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our trip this summer. We drove a total of 4,000 miles and this hotel was one of the highlights of our stay. Our 2 daughters ages 6 and 8 were in love with all of the sights and sounds, it felt like we were at a family friendly party,music,fireworks,firedancers,ferris wheels and rides, not to mention the great beach. We plan to make this hotel our destination during our next trip. We enjoyed it so much the first night we stayed an extra day..

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the hotel needs energizing and stay away from the 3rd floor.”
Reviews.Author: MarJan6861
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and we are Hilton Diamond. We had reserved an ocean front room. At check-in we asked for upgrade. The clerk consulted with a desk manager for several minutes and our porter then took us to the 3rd floor junior suite. It was early evening and we were tired. The third floor ocean front rooms overlook a flat ugly roof with ocean beyond it. The window facing the ocean did not open. The next morning I went back to the front desk and this time a gentleman front desk manager arranged for us to be moved to the 5th floor junior suite. Now we had a much better view, a window that opened and allowed us to really enjoy the sounds of the ocean. And that is why we came here--the ocean. Some areas that need improvement: softer pillows, no room safe, and the shower head will smack the head of anyone over 6 ft. We enjoyed our junior suite with microwave and small refrigerator. Breakfast was delicious and there is an outside eating area. The guest laundry fee is $2.50 for wash and the same for dryer. It was a good thing we had our detergent as that dispenser machine was not working. The only really safe parking is their valet parking at $15.96 daily but there is uncovered parking about a block away that (I think) would cost $10 daily. Bring your walking shoes because when you want to pick up your car, you walk a good distance to another entrance to retrieve the car.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: valeriets
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Daytona beach after several days at Disney World. I bid for this hotel on priceline and got it for 60.00 each night for two nights. The biggest issue with this hotel is the parking, there is a charge to self park of 10.00 per night and 17 dollars per night for valet parking. On arrival we were early and checked in with the Hilton Honors agent at the desk . At first I thought the agent was a little bit reserved and kinda stand offish, but she warmed up and tried her best to accommodate my requests. I asked for a king bed with an ocean view. I was told that I could upgrade to ocean front for 40.00 more each night, but I decided not to do that and took a king room with a street view. The view from my room was fine, I could see the ocean very well, and actually it was pretty much what we had in mind. The room was very nice. The housekeeping staff and the valet staff were excellent. There were no problems with anything. Plenty of pillows, towels, comfy bed, clean, etc. Have no reservation about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Relaxing- not what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Maverick182
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at another Hilton before so we went for this one. We booked a regular room through priceline.com. We knew it would be a regular room, so we contacted the hotel front desk 15 days before cehck in date to request an upgrade to ocean view room. The lady at the front desk who answered the phone told us emphatically that pur request would be accepted and there would be no upgrade fee. We called again before leaving for Daytona to check if our request has been accepted, only to be told by another lady that we would have to talk to the front desk staff on check in. When we checked in, we were charged upgrade fee when we were told there would be no charge. Now, the front desk person told us we should have requested an upgrade through priceline for a better deal. Never expected such gross misinformation. Then the lady gave us the key and directions to our room. We were very tired and just wanted to relax in the room by then. We were told our room was in the north tower all the way down the hall from the front desk. So we walked all the way and lugged our belongings to the room only to find she gave us the wrong directions and our room was in the tower right in front of the front desk. Phew! That lady gave us the directions to the parkign lot as well. We walked all the way there only to find she didnt give us the room key that would be the parking pass. We went back to the front desk, got the key replaced, walked back to the lot and the key didnt work, walked back again, got the key replaced again and finally were able to park. So much for relaxation. And then they charged us twice for parking as the parking card didnt work earlier. They eventually took off the charges though. Finally, when we reached our room and try to catch some sleep, we were constantly woken up by knocking, doors closing, people walking down the hallways. this continued through the night. The floor was full and the walls were thin, so everytime a neighbour opened their door, we felt someone is knocking at ours. Upsides-The room amenities were comfortable. The hotel was clean. The view was and location were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shaquelle_la_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in Daytona Ceach from Sunday to Tueasday early October - when we arrived the air show was ongoing - so to get to the hotel was a little bit of a chaos. Because of the weekend the room was not ready at an earlier stage, but we could store our lagguage with the bell boy and watch the air show - great stuff. As a HH Diamond I did get a Junior Suite upgrade - nice room with a view - also for every day a full breakfast buffet for 2 plus free internet - no question, with all these goddies and a great price during the week this hotel was agreat choise. Parking is available even via valet for 17US or selfparking for 10US - max 5 mn to walk to the reception. We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley stay right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Harleystar96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Ocean walk Daytona from 11/10/10-21/10/10 as a single female. I found all the staff very helpfull and polite from the front of house to the valet. The Bellboys were extra helpfull (thanks Seth) as were the Valet boys/girls....My bed was very comfy and my room was kept immaculate as was all areas of the hotel.....I had a side view room which I think is one of the best, as you get a sea, pool and mainstreet view....The Sports bar is very nice with a good selection of beers and thair hotwings are fab!....Breakfast is very good ,a tad exspensive, but of a good quality.I just wish the inhouse coffee shop was open a little longer .........Outside areas are kept very clean and the pool area has plenty of sun beds and only a short stride to the broardwalk.......In all I enjoyed my stay very much .I felt safe and secure and would like to stay again when in Daytona............The only down side of the hotel was the parking. Self parking ($10pn) over the road is no problem so long as you can find a space and your room card works ! . ...valet parking for me was very good ($17pn) no problems gettting my car when needed....BUT do keep a check on when and were you park as I was well overcharged on my final bill for parking. But it was put right quickly at the front desk .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dekostop
Reviews.Content: We had a late arrival. While checking in we were told that we had an oceanfront room on the 3rd floor. I was very happy to hear that since we paid less than the "rack" room rate through priceline. However when we entered the room there were no windows to open and those windows were very dirty from the outside (oceanspray) and covered in finger and handprints from the inside. I resigned to the fact that i would not get a better room due to the rate we paid. We went for a snack and a short walk on the beach when i noticed that all rooms above the 3rd floor had a "foot" balcony (very narrow...just a foot or less wide) but a large sliding glass door. After returning i went back to the frontdesk and spoke to Rhonda (very nice during check-in), She gladly changed our room. We ended up on the 10th floor with a great view over the beach and ocean, Overall we had a nice and quiet stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice”
Reviews.Author: jnevr480
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night on October 10. First, the valet parking guy was absolutely the best. He was very courteous and helpful. My husband ran in to see if we could get an earlier checkin since we had driven 10 hours and arrived a little early (2 hours). I had previously requested a room in the south tower (I was told it was newer and located closer to everything). So when my husband went in to check us in, he confirmed the room was in the south tower (the newer one)...they agreed. He came out, we hauled all our stuff out. And so began the walk. We ended up in the north tower......the old tower.....away from everything. Whatever, I had just driven 10 hours and was tired...hungry.....ready to relax. Also, there was an air show going on and removing my 5 year old from the doorway was not going to happen. (it was awesome by the way) There was a pool on the 5th floor that I guess noone else knew about because it was very empty. The walk to the beach was kinda ackward because you have to walk through events that are going on and across the walkway area. The bed was comfortable, the towels were soft, etc. There were only 2 towels in the room when we checked in....which we didn't realize until the 3rd person (me) was getting out of the shower. Overall, it was a great stay. The view was absolutely gorgeouse!!!!! Oh, but don't forget your cork screw.....if they have to open a bottle of wine....that will be $4.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean459
Reviews.Content: Found a room at this hotel for the cost of a cheaper hotel normally. Beautiful inside and out.. Vallet parking, helpful staff, imaculate lobby, nice rooms, walk out to the beach and boardwalk.. close to everything in downtown Daytona. I felt sfae and secure in the hotel.. just like home away from home...

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: This is not a typical Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: tmyr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend for a romantic getaway. The hotel looked fabulous from outside and the staff was very courteous. When we checked in our room, the view was spectacular! The room was average quality with outdated furniture and everything. The TV was probably older than I am and cut the edges of the picture on both sides. Nothing about the room was "Hilton" quality although everything was neat and clean. I have stayed in 2 star hotels with better rooms.The rooms are interconnected through a common door and you could hear absolutely everything next door. At night, I could not sleep because of neighbors conversations and called the front desk to request ear plugs but they did not have any. Absolutely not worth the money, unless you get a really good deal. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is good but nothing about it makes you feel like staying at Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Clearwater Beach Hilton was so much nicer”
Reviews.Author: rshively2
Reviews.Content: After staying 3 nights at the beautiful Hilton on Clearwater Beach, we expected the same from this Hilton. Unfortunately, that was not the case. No flat screen TV, no refrigerator, the furniture was outdated and scratched, the lighting, bathroom and bedding were all old and outdated, the windows were so dirty, we could barely see out of them, no balcony with chairs & table like Clearwater Beach. There was absolutely no comparison to the modern Hilton on Clearwater Beach. The parking was a hassle, even with valet parking. Upon arrival, our bathroom had 2 blown lightbulbs and no hair dryer. Although the very pleasant maintenance man was there within the hour, for the price, I wasn't expecting dead lightbulbs in outdated fixtures. We are very easy to please as far as hotels go, as long as they are relatively updated & clean. However, the ring of carpet dust around the perimeter of the room was really the last straw. We will not be returning to this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - rooms could use some tlc”
Reviews.Author: BG26_2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for a conference. The lobby and meeting rooms were well maintained, clean and professional looking. The food and service for the conference was also high quality. The location is right on the beach with easy access. The views were superb. The rooms were nice, but could use some updating especially the bathrooms. Overall it was a great stay. Definitely visit in the offseason for better prices and a quieter experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: myplaytime2
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the beach. We stayed in a suite and could walk right out to the beach. Staff was friendly and our room was kept clean. I especially liked the patio/sitting area outside of the room. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not sure what to expect yet”
Reviews.Author: Stella68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at a few Hilton's and were impressed. However, this will be the first time in Daytona Beach. We are checking in this Friday the 24th. I was reading the other reviews and saw how one couple received a complimentary upgrade because it was their wedding Anniversary. Funny, because we called back 2x about our reservation and did mention it was our 11th wedding Anniversary and asked do they do anything special. I was advised no. I asked for ocean view with a king bed as well. I was told no guarantees. I guess that couple was lucky. I will be sharing my review after my stay to let everyone know if we got that lucky too. After all, love the kids, but very rare to get away and enjoy alone time in a nice Hotel with your partner. I had to chose ratings to submit so I based them on the Hilton in Tampa Florida where we stayed

Reviews.Title: “Way below the standard of your average Hilton”
Reviews.Author: elvismonkee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and my experience wasn't great. As is usual with a lot of hotels, the public areas were nicer than the rooms, which in my view were not up to the usual Hilton standard. I checked in at around 12 midday, 4 hours early. I was told that they didnt have any regular rooms available until 4pm but that I could upgrade to an oceanfront room for $40. I guess they make sure they get these rooms ready first exactly so they can pull the upgrade stunt. Anyhow I was too tired to hang around until 4pm so took the offer. The view was nice, but I suppose being an oceanfront room the windows are difficult to keep clean and clear. They were dirty. The room was just ok, like other reviewers I found that not everything worked as it should - I just about had to punch the tv remote to get it to work - a couple of lamps didnt work, no hairdryer (though they did bring me one when I asked) etc. The tv started buzzing very loudly after 30 mins or so, but I let all this ride as I was only there for one night, slept for much of the day and then was out in the evening. The only saving grace for me (and the reason I chose the hotel) is it's proximity to the Bandshell - the outdoor concert venue that I was in town for, to see Blake Shelton who was great by the way! Overall I thought the hotel was overpriced for the standard, and I wont be going back

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: monkeybutt88
Reviews.Content: We're on a trip for our wedding anniversary, and when we mentioned this to the staff, she immediately offered us complimentary upgrades to a oceanfront room! Also when we forgot our room key the staff quickly replaced it. They were also very efficient to bring us housekeeping items that we requested. All in all, couldn't be more satisfied with the customer service! The room is clean and comfortable with all things needed. Unfortunately there is no cooler or fridge to put our beer in, nor a safe for us to use. We also received two coupons for the continental breakfast buffet. The food is excellent. During this trip I rarely get chance to eat a nice, fresh breakfast, so this was totally refreshing. By the way, since we went in the beginning of September, it's off-season, so if you go in the winter months or (omg) during the racing games in February, things could change.

Reviews.Title: “great location but needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: cmmgrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night over Labor Day weekend. The location is great. Right on the beach and our room had a beautiful view of the ocean, which pretty much was the only thing we really liked about the hotel. The hotel itself is outdated and I was really suprised about this because of the price we paid ($180 for an ocean view room). The swimming pool on the lobby level was nothing speical and REALLY overcrowded, so we didn't even bother to go there. Instead we decided to go down to the beach and rent chairs there, which was great. We arrived early and weren't able to check in until after 4pm which was a bummer. The staff was friendly and helfpul in general though. The tvs in the room are small and outdated as is the furniture. The parking situation is a total hassle. One block away and $10 a day. Overall though, we loved the view and the bed was really comfortable. I would probably stay again if the room was cheaper. Then it would be worth it just for the view.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice, but there are issues you need to know about”
Reviews.Author: C000159
Reviews.Content: First the good. The room was clean and the bed was VERY comfortable. I also had an ocean view, which was nice. The hotel is right on the beach, another plus. The pool was clean and refreshing. High speed internet is available in the room for a fee, but they do have computers in the business center which are free. I would recommend taking your own computer into the business center and connect via WIFI as their computers are really slow. Now for the bad. When i started to check in, the rep left me to get my keycards for the room. She was gone at least 15 minutes (no joke). When she returned, she said their coding machine was not working, so she gave me a master key and said to check back in about an hour to get my regular keys. To make a long story short, it took 4 sets of keycards before I got some ones that worked, which is ridiculous. Security had to end up re-programming the lock on the door. The remote wasn't working the TV so it had to be replaced. But even after that, the menu button wouldn't work, so I couldn't access any programming, just the regular cable TV. The lamp on desk didn't work either, but by this time, I was done. So I lived with the troublesome remote and lamp. Self parking is a block away and costs $10/day. They do have valet parking, but it's $17 a day. The room I was in had 2 queen beds, and the room was very small. Can't imagine 2 people staying there for any length of time. No microwave or fridge. I would not recommend this hotel. If you're wanting to stay on the beach in Daytona, I would highly recommend Wyndham Ocean Walk. I've been there multiple times and have always been pleased. Parking is on site and is also free.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tripplannerMs
Reviews.Content: Just arrived yesterday and it is going great. After reading the reviews I was reluctant to make a reservation but the location was ideal. Check in was a little slow but one of the workers moved me to another line where the clerk was super nice. She was able to find a lower floor room with a view. The room is nicer than expected, clean, great pillows and quiet. I would stay here again if in the area! *The only thing that would make our trip any better is a pass to the Meet and Greet for the Jonas Brothers concert tomorrow night! That would make my teen's year!!

Reviews.Title: “Four-stars with a view for $50.00.”
Reviews.Author: rmcl26
Reviews.Content: I got this Hilton on the beach for $50 a night bidding through Priceline. Then negative reviews read here made me cautious. However, I have no complaints, only praise. The front desk upgraded us from a city view room to one overlooking the beach. The room was standard; clean, comfortable, and nice. Maybe not four stars, but the hotel as a whole, with all it's amenities, was definitely four stars. I would gladly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Really? 4 star?”
Reviews.Author: mrwilliams07
Reviews.Content: $ 17 day valet very dated small room over priced food and drink Have to walk a mile to get anywhere in the hotel Carpet wet and smelling in room Sinks and tub drain not working No flat screen tv

Reviews.Title: “Beds aren't the greatest”
Reviews.Author: KCtimeless1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay with the exception of the beds. They could stand to replace the mattresses and maybe wash the comforter. But beside that, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: underdogrides
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton on daytona Beach for two nights the week before Biketoberfest. The hotel's location is excellent. It is right on the beach, near main street and many attractions you come for in Daytona Beach. However, my overall experience with this hotel was not a good one. First, there are two towers, the "newer" and "older" tower. You have no idea where you check in. I stood in line to check in for what seemed like an eternity. There was only one person behind the desk while there were a couple of othjer employees just milling around behind the desk. Finally after a while, one relictantly took the next person in line. If you have the misfortune of staying in the other tower, you must get back ionto your car and drive up half a block in order to gop to your room. The room was clean and had some of the amenities you would expect from a Hilton. The bed was comfy abd them place was clean. I do have a big issue with this hotel. For what they charge a night, all you get is a room and the ability tio say you stayed at a fancy place. Quite frankly, I though that they gouger you for everything else. If you drive to the hotel, your choice of parking is to either park at an unsecure public lot across a very busy street for about $9 a day or valet your car wuith the hotel for $19!! a day. If you think that by valeting you will have quick access to your car, you can forget it. the wait was pretty bad. the other thing that I think they gouge you on is that you have to pay for Internet. Most hotels these days offer free high speed Internet, not this one when I stayed. For the price they charge you to stay a night, you would think that something as basic as Internet woul;d be included. Both the parking situation and the Internet situation really turned me off to this place. The staff seemed indifferent, the place was pretty empty the weekend I stayed there and it sometimes felt like I was walking through a ghosttown becazeu the palce is so large. Overall the place is okay, buit fior what you pay, you can get a better deal elsewhere. If you like to travel and stay at places where the most important thing is status, then I guess this place is oh, but if you want some value for your money, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hilton Hotel right?”
Reviews.Author: Eaglepack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Front Hilton in Daytona Beach over the first weekend in August and we were disappointed with a number of issues we had during our stay. First off when we arrived we were early but we expected to drop our bags and walk around the area and have some lunch. The front desk, and valets couldn't handle the volume of people checking in. Cars were parked in the street just waiting to get to the valets, and the bell hops stacked everyone's luggage into a corner of the lobby which didn't seem too safe to us. We were told the front desk would call us when our room was ready, but after eating lunch and walking around for hours with no call from the Hilton we decided to check with them, and were told our room was ready for some time. We then got stuck in an evelator, and later we noticed a different elevator was broken. Later that evening at midnight there was a fight on the boardwalk below, which happened to be 10 floors below, but it sounded like it was right outside our window. We were so uncomfortable that we checked out early the next morning even though we had prepaid for the entire weekend. On a positive note the hotel has a number of different dining options, and an attached area with a half dozen other restaurants, shopping, amusement parks, and a movie theater.The pools were beautiful, but too small to handle the amount of guests that can stay at the hotel. If you're looking for a quiet relaxing get away this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyTampa
Reviews.Content: 8/12/10 My husband & I are in the hotel tonight on a short two day escape from Tampa. A four-star experience with bellmen, valet parking, in-hotel spa, and attached ballrooms and other convention center spaces. The rooms were average sized and reasonably clean. Towels were provided at both pools, eliminating the need to bring our own, including full length beach towel size, if you got there early enough. Location is one of the main advantages to the Hilton. It is adjacent on one side to the Main Street pier and on the other to the Ocean Walk Shoppes, including the historic band shell. Some of the North Tower rooms are great seats for the band shell concerts. Across the street is the auditorium, and most of the beach rentals of bicycles, pedal carts, wave boards, and chairs are done right in front of the hotel. There were several restaurants in the hotel and a spa. It is an all non-smoking hotel but animals are allowed, so you may want to check if you have allergies. Our Priceline ($50 per night...thanks biddingfortravel.com) room is on the 3rd floor & is ocean front, overlooking the pool. No complaints. The room is average size & the walls are thin. We heard the alarm next door go off at 6:00 am & the tv next door...just turned ours up louder. Valet parking is $17 per day while Hilton self parking across the street behind the bar-b-que restaurant is $10. There really is no where else to park. The public parking garage across the street does not allow over night parking & while there is metered street parking, it is 25 cents for 15 minutes from 9 am to 11 pm. There is no other parking option. The restaurant (Hyde Park) here has a great happy hour (4:30-6:30PM) deal with 15+ drink/martini choices for $4 & appetizers for $5. There is also a dinner for $19.99 which includes soup or salad, entree, side which was a great deal. We plan on going back tonight & trying the cucumber martini. The folks we talked to at the bar last night had eaten there two nights in a row. We had the crab cakes & steak & they were great! The beach is beautiful but it is hot during the day this time of the year. Next to the property there is a ferris wheel & one of those bungie cord contraptions slinging squealing folks into the air. We walked there yesterday & there's a guy with giant lizards & snakes who will take your picture, print it for $8. We'll wait until it cools down to take an early evening walk.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good.”
Reviews.Author: ct92
Reviews.Content: Overall, our experience at The Hilton Daytona Beach Resort was good. The prices for parking were too expensive, in my opinion. It is $10 for the self parking and $17 for the valet parking. We called down to the valet services many times to get our car, and only once it was ready when we got down there. Usually we had to wait an additional 5 minutes. Check in did take a bit longer than expected, but it wasn't anything to complain about. The rooms and look was overall very nice. It would probably be nicer if it was a different city, but the location makes up for that. We didn't really do anything in Daytona Beach, other than actually going to the beach. The rooms were very nice and clean. We enjoyed the 2 sinks (one was outside of the bathroom). Whenever we needed something, they would get it for us but they always expected a tip. I kind of expected this, but they did seem like they wouldn't like you very much if you didn't give them a tip. I think the $10 internet rate is also pretty expensive, but we used it for one day. The food court was just okay and was kind of expensive, but it was really convenient. There was some convention thing going on and there were a bunch of teenagers there. Most of them were loud, obnoxious, and annoying, but a few of them were nicer and tried not to be bothersome. Being so close to be beach is very convenient. The South Tower Pool was very nice as well. The hotel can't really do anything about it though. I do like that the hotel management responds to reviews. It show that they care about customer's opinions and try to further their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: racanfan3
Reviews.Content: I chose this property because of its convenience to the center of Daytona. When I arrived at 4:00 PM there was a line of traffic to get into the hotel. After spending 20 min’s in line I finally arrived at the main doors. The bellman who was very pleasant asked if I was going to valet park ($17.00 per day) or Self Park ($10.00 per day) located across the street. I chose the option to Self Park since I would be using my car quite frequently. I believe either choice has its pros and cons. The valet parking I was told you need to call down ½ before you needed your car. The self parking my key never worked in to get in and out. The check in was slow, but they were busy at the time. The person at the front desk handled my reservation in an adequate manner, however there were problems. I booked my reservation on line via Hilton rewards. I was quoted a price $159.00 per night. When I arrived I was told $174.00 per night. I disputed this, asked to speak to a manager and was told a manager would call my room to discuss this issue. I still have not heard from management. I was also told my room wasn’t ready yet and would receive a phone call when it was ready and that it would probably be less than a half hour. I did receive a call two and a half hours later. The room was in need of updating however it was very clean and adequate; I had a great view of the ocean. The check out was another night mare. Out of four elevators only seemed like one was working. I stood on my floor for 20 mins before I entered an elevator going up. This was the only way I could get down. My overall stay was ok. I personally wouldn’t stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in is hassel but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: flaglyn
Reviews.Content: I love this place but wish their check in's could be a bit easier. We stayed twice in July 2010. The first time we got right in and that was before their 4:00pm check in time. The second time we came, we checked in after 4:00pm and had to wait an 1 1/2 hr for our room. I did notice people hanging out all over the lobby area for the same reason at both visits. They have nice restaurants and a entertainment by the pool area which was nice. Noticed a lot of families there. The location, location, location is everything and their service was fantastic with the exception of long check in waits.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, location was great!”
Reviews.Author: tikibarowner
Reviews.Content: This is not a typical Hilton, the rooms were on the small side. Everything was clean and neat and we were able to check-in early. The location was great, lots to do and see. The fireworks Saturday were great. If you have teens, this is a great place to stay because of the activities both onsite and around the hotel The onsite sportsbar was below average for service, but the food was good. Cost was average for onsite dining. The breakfast buffet was pricey but the food and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “great staff & hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtripsl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel right across the street from the Convention Center! Check in was a breeze, staff at the front desk was great and very present throughout the hotel & during the week. Lots of teenagers were staying at the hotel and the staff helped monitor the elevators and the teenagers were very respectful. Staff was very helpful to get me in touch with a colleague when ATT had trouble with their cell service. Restaurants have lots of options & good food. I had a leak in my room the first night and hotel was very apologetic (hey, it happens!) and quickly got us moved to a new room & offered to help get our luggage to the new room. Our room faced the ocean & it was a beautiful view! Sand Volleyball below & lots of activity! My only dislike was being able to still hear a little of the noise through the glass (15th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: GizmoFlorida
Reviews.Content: We live in central Florida and go to Daytona a lot, frequently spending the night. This is the best hotel we have stayed at in Daytona. It was clean (remember this is a beach hotel that gets a lot of use). The location is perfect , right in Ocean Walk. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great rates, especially earlier in the week. No resort fee. Lots of activities, decent pool and hot tub, plenty of bars and restaurants. Pay the $ 17 for valet parking. It is worth it and we never had a problem getting our vehicle. Some people have a negative view of Daytona Beach. We love the vibe and its laid back atmosphere. We bring our own gazebo and chairs and park on the beach. If you want something fancier, go to Hilton Head, Miami, Amelia Island, etc. Just expect to pay a lot more. We have already booked a room in August ($ 69 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Just okay..”
Reviews.Author: angel0822
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Daytona from July 18-23 for a family vacation. Me, wife, 11 year old daughter and 9 year old son and two dogs. Checking in on Sunday afternoon at 5 PM, the room was not ready. Staff tried to accomodagte us with giving access to hotel amenities unitl the room was ready. Problem was they could not handle the dogs being present, so we sat around until the room was ready. It took about 30 minutes before the room was ready. We were told that we would get a complimentary breakfast the next morning, but when I checked the bill during the stay we were charged for the breakfast. I asked the staff and they said I should have been given a coupon at check-in, but we did not receive one. Room is just okay, rather small. We had the issue most of the week with housekeeping only leaving 3 towels each day for the 4 guests in the room. We did pay for internet access in the rooom. Valet parking onsite was $17 a day. A bit steep, but well worth it. Valet staff was very helpful in providing directions. There was a teen church camp at the auditorium across the street, so there were hundreds of kids around the hotel. At certain times of the day, there was a 5-10 minute wait for the elevators. Overall the kids were well behaved. Hotel touts itself as totally non-smoking, but we found several of the guests in nearby room smoking off the balconies. We were down wind of the smoke and smell. Our balcony had cigarette butts on it from prior guests There was also smoking area outside of the entrance/valet area. We find it disgusting to have to walk through this area. Beach area was nice. Renting 2 chairs and an umbrella was $30 for the day. There is only one place to rinse your feet off when coming back to the hotel from the beach. A few times it was not working at all. There is a volleyball area, which had people playing often. Pool area is just okay, as you can tell the pool is older and has been painted several times. With all the teens staying at the hotel, the pool was often over crowded. There is a food court area on the lower level and a bar area by the pool. We did visit the food court one day. It was a bit expensive. Hotel is located within easy walking distance to several places. Daytona Lagoon, Ocean Shoppes, etc. Pizza, doughnuts and ice cream shops are right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Teens were everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: singin_praise
Reviews.Content: Daytona Beach is definitely known for being a spring break destination and this hotel showed some of that. It definitely wasn't my idea of a "typical" Hilton. This could be a GREAT place or a HORRIBLE destination depending on what you're looking for. A cheerleading conference/competition was being held nearby and lots of squads were in the hotel. Lots of OTHER teens were in the hotel too...having a great time. They were literally running amok in the hotel. One boy ran through a restaurant area, put his hands on the rails and jumped over just to beat some of his friends who where also running to get to the elevator. Nobody said anything to them. Is this the fault of the parents? the hotel staff? or the kids? You decide. Bellmen were on the spot when it came to helping us unload our vehicle and were prompt in bringing our things to us. However, he seemed rather haphazard about it trying to squeeze through the opening in the room with a corner of a bag hanging off and scuffing the wall in the process. We booked our room through Hilton Honors and requested an oceanview, but we didn't get it. We used points to pay for the room which, in my opinion, is the reason "none are presently available". :o( I liked having an additional sink/vanity/mirror/outlet area outside the bathroom. We didn't try any restaurants. Parking overnight valet was $14 Front desk girl didn't know what to do for jellyfish stings. (I figured a "local" would know and would have guessed that at some point in her career that someone would have asked the same thing. Instead I was referred to the gift shop "where they would likely have something for it". Found another hotel employee and were escorted to another area to wait while he went to get a disposable cup with about 1/2 c vinegar in it.) Were sort of scolded the next morning when waiting for valet to return vehicle. Hubby went to lobby to secure a cart for all our things, found one unattended, brought it up, loaded us, and back down we went. A valet saw it sitting near us on the sidewalk and asked whose it was. Apparently each valet is assigned a cart and someone left theirs when they shouldn't have. Beach was wonderful! Loved having some surf (there is none in the Keys) and an ocean breeze along with powdery sand. No wifi in the room, son went to the lobby to snarf it up. While he was there he saw elevator after elevator full of kids going outside for some volleyball and other outside activities at 10-11pm I think they were just pick up games, not actual activities planned by the hotel. He came up to change and went back out, not coming in until 2am. He met a lot of cool people from all over the place and had fun just hanging out with kids his age. Hubby went down to play volleyball for a while too (and to assess the situation). He enjoyed it as well. Had a special request at checkout...needed the block to be released from credit card due to a large business expense hitting about the same time. Front desk man heard me, understood me, called my credit card company and things went off without a hitch! If you want an upper crustier Hilton experience, go elsewhere. If you want to go and cut loose and are a kid friendly type of person, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN DAYTONA BEACH”
Reviews.Author: kimlawson50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Oceanfront from June 26 2010 thru July 6th 2010. This was the best hotel i ever stayed at in Daytona Beach. We always dreamed of staying here and my dream was finally fulfilled when i got a great rate. I will be back next year for 12 days again if i can get another great rate. Everything was perfect at this hotel from location to housekeeping. I got a better than expected room even though i booked a room selected at check in room. I had pool and ocean view and was so pleased with this. The whole staff was great and friendly especially the manager who stood in the lobby and was always asking people if they needed anything. He was the best. Rooms were very clean and housekeeping was right on it everyday. Never needed anything. I will be back next year and every year. For those of you who dont like the Hilton go stay at the Desert Inn and you will be back. Hats off to the Hilton staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average and Inconsistent Service, Below Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: monty_williams
Reviews.Content: My wife and children (7 and 3) recently stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach. My wife and I are Diamond Level Hilton Honors members. We have stayed at Hilton properties all across the U.S. as well as internationally - Barbados, Paris, Barcelona, New York, Atlanta, Orlando, etc in the last 6 months alone and the Daytona Hilton was disappointing overall. I grew up in Daytona and actually worked at this hotel back in the early 90's as a valet during the summer between my freshman and sophomore year of college when it was a Marriott and before the addition of the North Tower and the Ocean Walk. My father and his family still live in the area, Port Orange, and was looking forward to coming "home" to visit and revisit my old stomping grounds. We stayed in a Cabana Suite in the North Tower which I recommend. The rooms were clean and adequate on the ground level, allowing you to walk out your door and literally be 100 feet from the beach. Unfortunately, the cabana rooms seem to be largely ignored. During our 4 day stay in the room, our room was only cleaned once and we had to go to the front desk to request it. As far as the service, it is largely inconsistent. The front desk was basically incompetent. When we checked in we were told they didn't have a reservation for us even though we had a reservation number, confirmation, and print out from Hilton.com. We were then informed that this Hilton is owned by a "Pyramid LLC" and not Hilton, which gave us the impression that they didn't feel obligated to provide the usual Hilton level of service, which proved to be accurate. As part of our package, we were provided with 3 free breakfast buffet coupns every morning, and out 3 year old was free. Some mornings they accepted the coupons, other monrings we had to go to the front deck to have the charges removed, some mornings they charged for the 3 year old, some mornings they didn't. One morning they charged my wife the full $20 breakfast buffet even though she only had a single cup of coffee and didn't eat anything. The breakfast buffet food quality was nice, with fresh fruit, omelete/egg station, and the usual assortment of breakfast meats, pastries, waffles/pancakes, cereals, cheeses, smoked salmon, etc. The service (friendly and attentive) and food quality was great, it was just the inconsistency with the bill every morning. We decided to stay an extra day as we were all really enjoying the beach, but again, dealing with the front desk to lengthen our stay was an exercise in futility. Basically, we had to go back to our room, make a reservation online, then go back to the front desk and re-register. Unfortunately, it was Friday and there were several large groups checking in so no cabana's were available for that night and we had to move to a deluxe room. No problem, we understood, but when we went to check out, they charged us the cababa room rate for the last night when we stayed in a deluxe room which was less than half the price. On checkout, we ended up with over $400 of erroneous charges that had to be backed out due to being overcharged for the room and for the breakfasts which we were supposed to get for free. A couple of other points: the valet deck hardly ever answers the phone if you want to call for you car ahead, so you're stuck with going down there and waiting 15 minutes for them to bring it out. Also, there are 2 valet stands, one in the South Tower, one in the North Tower, since we were staying in the North Tower we used that valet, yet half the time we had to go to the South Tower to get our car even though we dropped it off at the North Tower. Watch at for the security nazi's at the pool. My family and I were at the pool one day and I was practically berated by some pseudocop security guard who questioned me if I was a guest the hotel. He asked my for my name and room number, even after I showed him my room key card and wanted to call it in on his walkie-talkie. Sorry, but I'm not giving my room number out to a stranger because for all I know he's calling his buddies to ransack my room since he knows I'm at the pool. They don't have any problem letting you charge food and drink at the pool to your room but they give you the Guantanamo treatment to verify if you're a guest? After it was all said and done, no apology, just attitude. After that, we avoided the pool and stuck to the beach. Also, the drinks at the pool bar are ridculously overpriced and weak/watered down. A beer, a Hurricane, and 2 kiddie cocktails (7-UP with cherries and cherry juice) cost us $38, and the Hurricane was watered down. My wife asked for a rum floater to give it some flavor, an additional $6.35 for 1 ounce of rum. Speaking of the beach, that's the best thing about the Hilton. There are no cars on the beach around the Pier and Ocena Walk area (except the beach patrol) so it's a nice wide beach with pleanty of room for the kids to run around without worries of traffic. Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't really support your beach activities. The towels they provide for the pool/beach are worn out, over-sized handcloths, and if you want chairs and an umbrella, it's $25-$30 a day from the beach vendor parked out front. After we left Daytona, we spent a couple of days in Orlando at the Hilton Seaworld Grand Vacations and had a 1 bedroom, full kitchen, king size bed, full-size jacuzzi tub with seperate shower, screened in porch, pull out couach, 2 flat screen TV's, etc for $149 a night on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach location -- not much else”
Reviews.Author: sljtba
Reviews.Content: This is a great location on the beach. Saturday night fireworks are easy to see.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 Across the Board”
Reviews.Author: barbnjohn
Reviews.Content: To paraphrase a previous reviewer, "If you're the type to walk around like there's something up your butt, you might want to look at another beach." It's Daytona Beach, people. If you're a foodie/wine snob/resort and restaurant-as-destination person, this isn't the beach for you. That said, this hotel is perfectly acceptable in the $130/night (or less) category. That's based on location alone. Great beach, great pool, walking distance to the stomping ground of my college years, The Ocean Deck. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are quite standard, but clean. Lots of touristy things to do within walking distance. All the chain restaurants are represented. I would suggest you pack your own beach towels. They do have towel service by the pool, but they are bath sized and pretty darn flimsy. Also, many of the shops and resort dining options are only open on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE Manager. I visited this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nattabrooke
