Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE Manager. I visited this hotel for the Daytona 500 last year and the manager as well as the staff of the hotel were awful. This manager was a dark haired hispanic guy. He sent a security guard into the gym and they escorted me out saying that I was not a guest. When I pulled out my guest card and showed them, they took me into an interrogation room still accusing me of not being a guest. They verified my drivers licence and that I really was a guest and the guy didn't even apologise. When it was time to go to sleep I pulled the shower curtain to find black hair all over the bath tub. It's just gross for the price you pay not to mention the the breakfast is 20 dollars a person.... Head my warning. This place looks like a million bucks, but don't be fooled by appearances.... This place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: thatgirl142
Reviews.Content: Won a bid on Priceline for 2 rooms for 3 nights. Given river view rooms in the north tower at check in and offered to upgrade to ocean views for $20 per night per room (ocean view rooms were standard for our trip last year). Ended up with a view of the roof and couldn't see the river. The bathroom floor was dirty and the room was small. My 4 year old was playing on the floor and found a Tylenol PM tablet that the maid service had missed. The room and hallways looked run down compared to the south tower rooms from last year. (The bellhop said the ocean view makes the rooms look better.) The bed was very comfortable. Valet service was quick and they were very friendly. Used both pool areas, the sunset pool didn't have clean towels one day while we were there for almost 2 hours. The location is the best on the beach! No drive beach area and right next to the pier and the Ocean Walk shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: vballer7
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with great beach access. We were only there for one night, but wish we could have stayed longer. Yes, the rooms are small and there is no fridge. Our room was clean and we were able to log onto the internet without a problem for no charge. I cannot imagine a better location for beach lovers. There was a lot going on around the property in the evening including live music, a magician, and a group of kids playing volleyball on a lit sand court.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pro2r315
Reviews.Content: This is the best location any hotel has to offer in Daytona Beach Fl. However you have to get past the snotty staff, the bell hop that is 80 and is nasty to you if you pick up a heavy bag because you don't want him to get hurt, you have to be okay with an air conditioner that has a mind of its own, a bed that will leave you with a sore back, wallpaper coming off the wall in the bathroom, house keeping standing outside your room 1.5 hours before checkout waiting to clean your room, how about the concert directly out of our room that was so loud it made the lamp rattle, and did I mention that they have pulled off the sleaziest don't open this envelope until after you have eaten your dinner to see if you get a discount on your meal at the hotel. I call it the dinner lottery. In short we have stayed at many Hilton properties and I would rate this the worst Hilton property ever. If this was a days inn I would have never said a word but this is not the Hilton standard that their clients have come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS ARE CLEAN BUT SMALL AND NOT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: prusky62
Reviews.Content: Thought this would be a nice place to stay. Not what I expected. Balcony is so small you can only stand on it and its a bit scary! View was pretty though! Rooms were clean, but small. I felt like they didnt want me to spend much time in my room, but downstairs where its spacious and lots of places to spend money. Lobby was very pretty, and staff very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, especially if you get it at the right price”
Reviews.Author: quesoreina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got a great deal on our three-night stay through Priceline's name your own price program. The person at the front desk put us in a great oceanfront room, which we had hoped for but did not expect! The room itself was pretty nice. Unlike some reviewers, we liked the in-room coffeemaker. We also liked the fact that there were two sinks, one situated outside the bathroom. The beds were really comfortable too. The room could use a minor cosmetic refresh and a flat-screen TV to make it look more modern. A microwave and mini refrigerator would have been nice to have. Other than those minor issues, we liked the room a lot. Housekeeping did a really good job keeping things clean throughout our stay. However, we were at the very end of the hall and they always ran out of coffee cups and shampoo/conditioner before they got to us. This wasn't a huge problem. I just called for more and they brought them quickly and cheerfully. I don't think guests should have to call and beg for stuff that is supposed to be included though. The hotel is located right in the middle of the action. It is adjacent to the Ocean Walk Shoppes, as well as the boardwalk. Some reviewers mentioned that the area is trashy/seedy. The area isn't seedy, but I guess you could say it's a little bit rough around the edges. I kind of enjoy that myself, but to each their own. If you tend to walk around with something up your butt, you may want to consider vacationing at a different beach. While the location and room were great, the parking situation was not. Choices were self-parking for $10 a day or valet parking for $17 a day. We used the self-parking, which was located across the street. It was a real pain to get our luggage and cooler to the room. To make matters worse, as were checking in, a huge high school graduation was going on in the convention center across the street. This turned a short, simple drive from the hotel entrance to the parking lot into a nightmare situation, as lots of the streets were blocked off for the graduates. Without the graduation going on, parking and unloading our stuff would have been a lot easier. On a positive note, once we unpacked our luggage, we didn't mind the walk. We only had to get into the car once. Like I said, there's plenty to do right around the hotel. Also, I felt like my car was safe in their parking lot. There were a few generic looking restaurants in the hotel. We didn't try any of them. The only one that looked intriguing was Hyde Park, but we never got around to going there. The hotel food court was cheesy/outdated and completely empty. Nearby restaurants we enjoyed included Bubba Gump and Tailgater's. On past trips, I have also enjoyed the Mai Tai bar, which is also adjacent to the Ocean Walk movie theater next door. All in all, we were very happy with the Hilton Ocean Walk Village. If we had paid the published rate, my review may have been more critical. Even with the few annoyances, we had a great trip and would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinion”
Reviews.Author: JRO
Reviews.Content: Ocean Walk is something of a quasi-resort and seems to be family friendly. It is centrally located, and within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. The lobby area is a large open space with a nice resort feel. The network of decks and patios on the beach side is convenient and attractive. However, the majority of the property is a bit dated, and the karaoke bar that resonates through the lobby lends an unfortunate cheesy factor. Breakfast is not included. The in room internet is not complimentary. There is no airport shuttle. The in room coffee is of poor quality. There are no dedicated beach towels. The oceanfront rooms do have beautiful views, but they also look over the scruffy rooftops of lower structures and spotty landscaping. Whether these rooms are worth $200+ a night is a personal decision. This property does offer city view rooms for less. We did not use the workout facility or the spa. I agree with others that this is not a premier Hilton resort. The association of the Hilton name with luxury accommodations is sometimes a misnomer. While not one of their premium hotels, Ocean Walk is an adequate place to stay. Except for the sandy tub from the previous guest, our room seemed clean enough. Because this property exists in a constant saline environment, wear and tear happens very quickly. Management should keep on top of maintenance. Today, it is commonplace in the Hospitality Industry to extend a good cup of coffee, complimentary internet, and/or a small breakfast. At this accommodation level, the lack of such inexpensive amenities has become a deal breaker for me. I would recommend this hotel, but with clarity of what you receive for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay but I was fully impressed.”
Reviews.Author: sullivandavis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference for four nights and the location is nice overlooking the Atlantic but I thought the hotel was overrated and overpriced. There was a variety of places to eat within walking distances but this is nothing against the hotel property but this area of Daytona isn't the best location. I've not spent much time in Daytona but I have no intentions to return unless its work related.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: cobidowski
Reviews.Content: Hotel was accomodating and very clean. The view is amazing, right between the boardwalk and the shopping center/movie complex. Best location in Daytona Beach. Be prepared to rent lounge chairs and umbrella in front of hotel on the beach for the perfect day on the beach. Highly reccomed this hotel, I can't wait to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “THEY HAVE A TERRIBLE HOUSEKEEPING”
Reviews.Author: gisi10
Reviews.Content: It is too much money for the service that the housekeeping gave us ..My first day staying at this hotel i put a dot of ice cream in my sheets to see if the lady was going to change it the next day,"she doesn`t change it" the only thing that she do was to strech them and thats it.im really disappointed beacause now i dont know if i was using sheets that was using it before.. """"ROOM SERVICE IS SOOOOOOO BAD""""

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall - some inept service”
Reviews.Author: khuser
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience was good, although the area is a bit seedy. Service was friendly from most employees. Oddities: (a) upon arrival, they misplaced my bag while I self-parked. (b) returning to my room after a day of conference on day 1 I found my lights on and the toilet running (someone used it and didn't shake the handle); on day 2, the lights were on again and the speaker phone was on and beeping loudly (someone used my phone and didn't hang it up properly). Both days I found my sliding glass door unlocked. (c) they charged me the premium valet parking charge so I had to clear that up during check-out; I didn't check closely enough, however, as they only applied the correct self-park rate to two of the three days. (d) $10/day for Internet connectivity (who does that anymore?). Others with whom I spoke had similar experience - overall pretty decent but just odd things, as if the employees were trained more in "service with a smile" and much less in procedure. Best feature, ocean view room, nice beach for running, swimming. No decent dining or entertainment away from the hotel, however, there is a great Hyde Park restaurant on site. I had no reason to leave the hotel during my three-day stay. I would barely recommend this hotel - just keep your eyes open and check your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: proftravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend and got the room via Priceline and saved a lot. For the price, it was definitely worth it. I didn't like the parking set up-this hotel has two towers, North and South and both have a lot of valet runners, but I don't like valet because I like to be able to get to my car quickly, so I had to park across the street. The reason this is a hassle is the check in was in the other tower than my room, so I had to go check in, go park, then go back to my tower to my room. Room was comfortable, there is some hallway noise and I could hear the kids in the room next door through the walls, but on the wall where the bed was I didn't hear anything. I did not have an oceanfront room and did not expect one. I liked the hotel pool, it was on the same floor as my room. There is a Bubba Gump's right next door and it was pretty good. I did order room service breakfast --they were late on the time they said it would be delivered-due to the fact the order take misplaced my order,, but food was decent and server was nice. I went to the Sports Bar to watch a baseball game but we ordered desserts as we weren't hungry. Mom says don't get the banana split. I would stay again if I had a good rate, but it's in a crowded area, and I like things a little quieter. I would recommend if you can get a good rate, I would not pay rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Big & lonely”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Daytona is enormous. I have no idea how many towers it has, but there were at least three. There were multiple meetings while I was there, but it still felt empty, which is eerie when the spaces are so big, particularly with all the empty conference registration spaces. Plus, maintaining that much hotel during a recession must be challenging, and it shows a little. Nothing in the hotel is particularly nice, but nothing we bad either. The hotel does NOT disappoint on location. The hotel is right on a lively part of Daytona Beach, and all the rooms have a beach view.

Reviews.Title: “The Devil is in the Details”
Reviews.Author: gargamel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton to celebrate my stepdaughter's 16th birthday. She decided she wanted to have a sleepover with 2 of her best friends, so I got two oceanfront rooms (connecting). We arrived around 2:30PM, which is earlier than the 4PM checkin. Despite that, I zipped through the HHonors line and we were checked in quickly. The bell captain helped us with our luggage and we were soon walking the long walk to the North tower (near Hydes). Upon arriving on our floor in the north tower (quite a walk), we noticed that we had only been given one key for one of the rooms, despite me asking for 2 room keys for each room. Fine - I marched back down to the front desk, and after being interrogated, I proved that I had just been down minutes earlier and was missing a room key. No big deal - security is important, but this could have been prevented had the front desk attendant been paying attention versus chatting with his coworkers. As I came to find out during my entire stay, the little details will get you at the Hilton Daytona. Getting back to the room, the first thing I noticed was that I did not have the in-room mini fridge I ordered via phone when I made the reservation. I called the front desk and was told there was a $10/night equipment rental fee. Fine, but this should have been disclosed up front when I asked for it...not to mention that nearly every other hotel I have stayed in offers this for free. I also noted that there was no mini-bar int he room, not that I would have used it, but the small touches you take for granted at other hotel chains are missing at Hilton - Daytona. The hotel itself was OK but seemed somewhat dated based on other hotels I have stayed at recently. The artwork was fantastic, but the overall look and feel was 1980's. The bed seemed comfortable, but the linens were dated - one bed had a heavy comforter on it and a sheet while the other one had a lightweight duvet cover and a sheet. The bathroom was somewhat dirty (floor) and the toilet in one of our rooms was difficult/impossible to flush. There was no hair dryer in one of the rooms. The room itself was small for the price point, but the view was spectacular. The room was also very quiet - I did not hear the other guests coming or going and the ocean noise was blocked unless you open the sliding glass door (with no balcony). The hotel doesn’t really have any grounds. The hotel is situated right on the street, and then you have the beach, separated by a venue area. Externally, the hotel is not attractive compared to some of the others along the shore. The pool, situated about 1 floor up from the beach, was clean and of a sufficient size. There is a pool-bar nearby and accessible restrooms nearby as well. There is an indoor spa / whirlpool and the area is tastefully decorated, though like most of the hotel, the appearance is about 20 years dated. We did not use the spa, but it did look fairly decent. As I said before, the little details really add up. For example, there is no (working) foot wash, so when you make the long trek from the beach to the hotel, your feet will have to remain sandy. The hotel seems to be focused more on business travelers than being a beach resort. There are no (free) lounge chairs or any chairs outside the hotel for that matter, except for some City of Daytona style cement benches. Umbrellas and chairs will need to be rented at a fee. The pool is difficult to access, at least from the north tower - and the beach itself is rather inconvenient to access without a lot of twisting and turning to walk down various walkways. Accessing the pool area during lunch or dinner service hours is awkward as you sometimes find yourself walking amongst diners to reach the pool gate, unless you are approaching from inside the hotel...at which point you will have to wind past guests checking in. Could they make this place any less friendly for beach-goers? Room service is lacking at the Daytona Hilton. First, as an aside, there are many good dining options within walking distance, so room service should not be necessary in most cases. But in my case, I called the front desk to ask if they offered a birthday cake (and some milk) for the birthday girl and her friends in the adjacent room. I was told no at first, even though I had seen one being delivered to another guest earlier. Several hours later, I got a call back saying that it had been taken care of (a nice, surprising touch). However, the cake arrived 1.5 hours later than the time I specified...it's the small details that get to you. We had actually given up on getting the cake after calling room service to verify it a couple of times. One big minus was that there was no wireless internet access in the hotel. In addition, the wires internet access did not work for us in either of the rooms. As for other hotel services, I found the concierge lacking - we called down to get restaurant advice on the concierge line and were told "I don't know..." After asking if there was anyone who did know, we were transferred back to the front desk, where we were given some absolutely wrong advice about Rossellini's Italian. Valet parking is very expensive and very, very slow. It took them 20 minutes to retrieve my car, making us late for a dinner reservation once, and this was after I had called down 10 minutes before to get the car. So in total, it took them 30 minutes to get our car one time and about 20 minutes each subsequent time. Self parking is highly recommended, though parking anywhere in this area will cost you in both distance and money. One good thing about our stay was the Hilton Breakfast Buffet. I wisely opted for the Bed & Breakfast plan, which includes breakfast; otherwise, the bountiful breakfast spread would have been $20 each. However, the breakfast was quite good. Quite honestly, after staying at some West coast beach resorts, Daytona is sorely lacking in both amenities and service. There are some things to do with the kids at this hotel, such as a water park / arcade nearby, but the whole place seemed to be populated by business travelers dressed in business formal attire. I actually felt out of place wearing my beach attire on several occasions. It most certainly did not feel like a beach resort, despite the waves crashing within eyesight distance. It almost seems like Hilton has gone out of their way to discourage beach access! My advice is to choose another location. Perhaps the hotel chain next door is more suitable...it certainly looked nicer. But given the choice, I will not even go to Daytona again. I'm sure Daytona is excellent for Bike Week, Spring Break and NASCAR events, but I would not tag it as a vacation destination unless you expect to participate in the three things I just mentioned. Florida west coast beaches (or Amelia Island on the East Coast) and resorts are far superior if you are looking for that beach resort look and feel, as well as a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Just Super!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOhiosk
Reviews.Content: We moved over to the Hilton after one night at a run down hotel on the strip - And, let me tell you, it was the best move - we got a room at 9:30 a.m. (didn't have to wait until 4:00 p.m. normal check in time) The staff was wonderful - the valet, check-in, porter,the gift store, the beach towel guy - you name it, they where all super nice. Not to mention the confortable room - with the feather bedding - very nice. Great views - wonderful beach - and, would recommend this location to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cabana Suite was fantastic - absolutely worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: laud
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cabana suite in Feb. 2010 and in 2009 and loved it. I differ quite emphatically with a previous reviewer's negative comments. I often lurk on this website but review rarely and feel compelled to give my very opposite impression of the cabana suite at Hilton Ocean Walk village. I agree with one item only from the previous reviewer. In the cabana suite, you must walk through the sleeping area to the toilet/shower room. So possibly three adults would be uncomfortable. But the bath and toilet room is entirely separated by a solid door. (The sink/vanity area is not separated by a door and is in a far alcove adjacent to the beds.) The pull-out couch in our suite was also in a separate room and divided by curtained french doors allowing for privacy. I differ strongly in all other aspects. The staff was utterly helpful to us at this hotel. From everybody's attitude, I would not hesitate to ask for a refrigerator had it been needed. Furthermore, I am confident it would have been provided gratis. Who cares if the ice machine is on the 3rd floor? I had staff tripping over themselves providing us ice in our bucket and taking our picnic cooler to be filled. Did I mention the service was wonderful? The car valets and concierge could not have been more helpful in locating nearby destinations. A previous reviewer cited a 1/4 mile hike to the lobby from the cabana suites. An impossible exaggeration, shame on that fib! There is a short walk up the stairs to the lobby or immediate access through the gift shop to the elevator or the next doorway south of the gift shop. We stayed in the cabana suite in 2009 also and it rained heavily for two days. There is maybe a 25 to 50-feet section of uncovered area to traverse and we simply used an umbrella. That very slight inconvenience was more than worth it considering other charms. The suite includes a covered porch where we enjoyed the rain and watching the drama of heavy seas during inclement weather. This brings me to the most delightful aspect of a cabana suite. Enjoying a glass of wine at your own private porch and table with friends at your ring-side seat to the ocean and a bandstand is incomparable. Pity the previous reviewer who doesn't know how to enjoy such a unique and wonderful hotel and cabana!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the sound of waves through the night , a slight breeze and spectacular ocean views”
Reviews.Author: PAngel143
Reviews.Content: April 6th weekend 2009, my partner and I went to Daytona Beach and stayed at the Hilton Ocean Walk Village for my birthday getaway. It was a great location because it was at the center of everything for dining, entertainment, shops and beach front. April tends to still be a little chilly and cold but I'm a sucker for the beach so it didn't matter to me. We got a room with an ocean view right in front of the clock tower. The water was like sparkling jewels this weekend and the sky was absolutely clear and beautiful. I recommend leaving your sliding glass door open through out the night because the breeze and the sound of waves made it almost like heaven. Very relaxing!! One night we ordered in wings from a restaurant from the Ocean Walk and watched a great movie. Other nights you could dine at Bubba Gump which we've already done in past visits or enjoy nearby seafood restaurants or barbecue! Sometimes they have live bands outside in the courtyard where the clock tower locates. The only downside is that you do have to pay for parking...it is across the street and you have to walk across to the hotel. I believe it was like 10 dollars a day. The pool was great but we only enjoyed the jacuzzi because of the cool weather. The rooms itself was somewhat average, but very neat and clean with comfortable white sheets, fluffy pillows, and a tropical themed comforter..great classy bathroom! overall I enjoyed it very much!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Cabana Suites are a JOKE!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayan62
Reviews.Content: I should have taken in all the little things people said about this hotel, as they all were true. The Cabana suite was nothing more than a room with a double bed and a pullout couch. I was under the impression that there were seperate sleeping quarters from the bathroom. You had to walk thru the area with the double beds to get to the bathroom. Absolutely no privacy for three adults. The price was $505 per night, we stayed 2 nights and the total was almost $1,200.00 with the additional fees. I shouldn't have assumed that the highest price would offer us the best. The room was outside the hotel, below all the rooms in the hotel and no access into the hotel except to walk a 1/4 of a mile into the main lobby. Had we had rain, we would have been soaked going anywhere out of the room. Upon arrival, seeing the room and smelling the room, I immediately asked to get a regular room. This was a non smoking room and smelled like a dirty ashtray. I was told they were full for the night and asked to be changed for the next night and pay for a regular room. I was told absolutely no refunds would be given to my c/c. The customer service was completely unacceptable. The room also had a continuous noise the entire stay. Similar to a boiler room and impossible to sleep. To get ice you had to deal with the walk to the main entrance and go to the 3rd floor. The vending machines on the 1st and 2nd were broken also. The in room coffee maker didn't work, the room offers no safe and we also expected a small fridge but they didn't provide that either! After 2 nights of this, we couldn't wait to check out! Don't go, it's not worth the money!!! I told the front desk I would be posting this if they didn't work with me on the 2nd night and they couldn't have cared less, so there it is.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: kimmarlin
Reviews.Content: We have to agree with the last two posts. First and foremost the hotel staff was great. Very polite. But..The rooms were in dire need of an update. The bed was not your typical Hilton Bed . We have stayed at other Hilton's and the beds seemed extra "cushy". But we did not hear much noice from the other rooms. Granted we were on one of the top floors at the end of the hallway. So not much activity near that area. The bathroom was not the cleanest. Needless to say I placed towels on the floor. The coffee pot is a joke. And foam cups!? When you are on the beach and paying over $60 a night, please a real coffee pot and a real mug. That is not located in the bathroom. We really dislike the "bathroom" coffee pots. The tv was outdated. The food was okay. I had a steak salad. The steak was tough. My husband had a pasta dish. It was a bit better. The staff in the Tower lounge was awesome. Our wish was that Marriott had a beach front hotel. We would have stayed there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to Hilton standards yet”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights during Bike Week. The location is excellent: the beach at one side and Main Street with all its bike activities only a short walk away. We had a lovely large suite overlooking the ocean. The full moon on the water was wonderful. The bed and linens were very comfortable and we did not have any problems with water pressure or temperature in the shower.The Hyde Park Prime Steakhouse was offering a deal on Sundays that we couldn't refuse - soup or salad, specific entrees and a side dish for $20. The food and the service were first class. In fact we found staff bent over backwards to be of assistance. I had some issues at breakfast with being seated too far from the buffet table (walk with a cane) and my on-going battle to get Hilton to put decent toasters on their breakfast buffet. By our third breakfast the manager had saved a table for us next to the buffet and staff produced toast for me from the kitchen. There are some things that the hotel could improve. We would like a refrigerator in the room. We object to paying for WIFI, especially when it doesn't work all that well. Skype transmission was intermittent and we couldn't send e-mails out. The spa is only open for limited hours: 12 to 4 Tuesday to Friday and 11 to 5 on Saturday. I wanted a pedicure first thing in the morning so I could spend the rest of the day being a tourist, but it was not to be. Finally, nothing the hotel can do about it, but be warned, it is a long walk from one end to the other. This was our second year at Daytona for Bike Week. Last year we stayed at the Hampton Inn in south Daytona. Nice hotel but this one is closer to the action. Bike Week is worth the trip and we will probably stay at this Hilton again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Large, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: klpsmom
Reviews.Content: I've actually stayed here twice. Once in 2006 for a HS reunion, and the other for a b-day surprise because of the close proximity to a comedy show we were seeing. The rooms could use some freshening up. The tile in the bathroom needed replacing and updating. It's a large, solid hotel with lots of potential. They offer a great military rate, so we feel we are paying fair price, but I would not pay top dollar to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: RedheadVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with several members of my family to celebrate my cousin Jackie's wedding. We had a fantastic room to invite some of them back to visit, and enjoyed our evening after the reception in a few of the restaurants & lounges in the hotel. Breakfast was fantastic, busy but the servers worked hard & the waffle maker was the bomb! I'm still looking for one to buy for home use :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KatieH6
Reviews.Content: Room Service was superb! Walk to the beach in the morning, with the boardwalk within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Tietjen01
Reviews.Content: I came down to Daytona Beach for a reception and we had a large block of rooms on the 3rd floor of the South Tower. Overall, I'd rate the stay as a 3 (on a scale of 5 with 5 being "Perfect" and 1 being "Never Again"). The Room - I found the room somewhat small but acceptable considering the price (the group received a discounted rate of $69 per room/day. The shower never seemed to have any hot water before 8am. I spoke to the front desk about this but I still had to take a cold shower the morning I checked out. Showers in the evening and afternoon were fine. I believe that they must use timers on their hot water heaters and anything before 8 a.m. must not be considered an acceptable time for guests to shower. The room did not have any windows that opened. So, if you wanted to enjoy the smell of the ocean and a gentle breeze, you couldn’t do so from your room. The Amenities – I found the amenities to be a little expensive for what you received. For example, if you wanted to have Internet access in your room it was $9 a day extra while most other places I've stayed offer internet access for free. The Valet Parking is $17 a day. The alternative is to park about 1.5 blocks away and then you can do so at $9 a day. I went ahead and used the Valet Parking but because it was so expensive, the tips were much smaller and less frequent than they would have been had the price been more reasonable. If you decide to eat breakfast during your stay, I’d suggest the IHOP which is about a quarter of a mile down the street. Also, there is a nice smaller restaurant across the street from the hotel that is decent. I just couldn’t get myself to pay the $18 per breakfast that the hotel’s restaurant was offering. The Service - On the 1st full day there, the housekeepers never showed up to clean the room. The engineer didn't fix the hot water (or lack of) issue in the shower. Other than those two items, the service was decent. The staff was friendly, and helpful. Overall, I found my stay acceptable. The location is great and had it been a little bit warmer, we would have taken advantage of the beach. I would stay there again but not at their normal prices. There are other places in the area where your dollar will buy you more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great employees, great views but not so fast....”
Reviews.Author: markcolumbusOH
Reviews.Content: Doc Bales restaurant is just bad overpriced hotel food. I usually steer clear of buffets (almost never nearly as good as you think they will be) I decided to try the Friday night Prime rib and Seafood buffet for $35.00. Dried out crab cakes and clam strips, rock hard hush puppies,seafood bisque that reminded me of cheese wiz from my childhood days and the most mediocre selection of salads and desserts. Cocktail shrimp were great but $ 35.00 for 8 cocktail shrimp and a cup of decaf was as hard to swallow as the fishy fish of the day on the buffet. What made the experience completely unbearable were the families surrounding my table hauling piled plate after plate of Alaskan crab legs as if the were storing them for the winter and joyfully exclaiming how good the food was. I guess it was just me. The rooms would be fine if you are there when the weather is great and you never want to be inside. They are just tired so they may not really be dirty - just in need of renovation. The Adams Mark tackiness has not been eliminated yet and they are sorely lacking in updated amenities.( 20 inch tube tvs, the usual worthless $3.00 iron and hideous in room coffee pellets.Cool little Cuisinart machine that deserves to pour somethng that you wont spit into the sink) There was a weight scale in the bathroom. I laughed and wondered " Who thought purchasing a few hundred of those would be a popular amenity?" Certainly not the eating machines in the restaurant. Public areas and furnishings are quite nice for the beating they likely get. Again - kudos to such pleasant employees. Im guessing they were thankful for a break from the nasty crowds of humans that will descend in the spring. It is what it is, a big monster convention center of a place that works just fine if youre out enjoying the city most of the time. Oh and Hilton - Honestly , stop bragging about how close you are to the incredibly unexciting Ocean Walk Shoppes. Really pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near 3.5 Stars -- Housekeeping stole my kid's toys!!!”
Reviews.Author: mespy
Reviews.Content: I am not the pickiest traveler, but my stay here couldn’t have been worse. First, the hotel is nowhere near a 3.5 stars. The lobby is okay, but the rooms are dated and old. The beds, pillows, and bedspread should have been retired years ago. The towels were old and scratchy. The 20” tube television was terrible. There was no WiFi access whatsoever – free or otherwise. The crib they provided for my toddler looked like it was 30+ years old. I could have looked past all that had I all the other stuff not happened…. First, the parking there is a joke. You will have your choice between paying $17 a night for valet parking or paying $9 a night to park nearly across A1A at a lot nearly 1.5 block away from the hotel. Since the lot wasn’t guarded and we have luggage, I opted for the valet. In others words, with a tip, I was paying more than $20 a night to park my car in Daytona Beach. Are you kidding me? Next, the weekend we stayed the hotel was hosting some sort of middle-school football tournament. As a result there were hundreds of unsupervised 13 to 14 years running amuck throughout the hotel. It was like Spring Break for the prepubescent. I can understand that the hotels need to make their revenue and were going to turn away the heard of unruly kids. However, what irks me and all the other guests is the hotel apparently made no efforts to control the kids (and neither did their chaperones). My kids were repeatedly awoken by teenagers yelling in the halls and slamming doors. My calls to the front desk did nothing to lessen the noise. When I was checking out, there were at half a dozen guest complaining about the young football players. Clearly, we were the only ones unhappy with the situation. It was a nightmare for anyone not affiliated with the football tournament. But, it gets worse. Someone (presumably housing keeping) stole my kids toy trains. My collects Thomas diecast toy trains. These trains retail for between $6.99 and $7.99. Unfortunately, while we were gone during the day, six of the seven trains we brought with us disappeared. I complained to the front desk who seemed completely disinterested in the theft. I actually had to threaten to report the theft to police (I asked the front desk to dial police) before they would even notify hotel security. While the front desk crews seem disinterested, at least the hotel security manager seemed to take the theft seriously. Still, I was offered no reimbursement whatsoever. So, my advice is to stay far away from this hotel. Disregard the star rating – it’s nowhere near a 3.5 star. If you absolutely have to stay in this hotel, then safeguard your kids’ toys (and obviously any valuables).

Reviews.Title: “Could of been better”
Reviews.Author: harleygirl10
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this Hilton last year with no problems. This year was not up to par in my opinion. I had booked online ( as a hilton honors member). I had requested King size bed, on a higher up floor with extra towels and early check in. ( did this in June, for an October trip) Got there after 2:30pm. Room wasnt ready, they tried to give me a room with 2 double beds or a room with only a non opening window. Told to wait for a phone call when room was ready : Never got one. Finally after 4pm room was ready. Was NEVER told that it was in the far NORTH Tower after we dragged all our luggage up to the SOUTH tower. No extra towels, room took forever to be cleaned each day , not done til after 4 pm. ( This was a 5 day stay) Had to ask housekeeping for clean towels and shampoos as they never left us any, and when I did ask I was questioned as to how many shampoo's did I really need ! Well 1 tiny bottle a day for 2 people if that was ok !! The location was perfect for our purpose there so we delt with it but I received better service at a Holiday inn on the other coast of florida the next week !! ( and for a lot LESS money. Oh yeah and 9 dollars a day to park behind HOG HEAVEN a block and a half away was fun too. They cant provide free parking ? Only expensive valet and the porky alternative ? Come on Hilton, do you want repeat customers or what ???

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Ilios76
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for a conference. You just have to look out your window to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service and experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: cooper1000
Reviews.Content: We travelled a lot but this was the worse service we ever experienced. They treated us like criminals. We had a room on the 8th floor and just around midnight - we were just falling in sleep - we heard a strang sound near the window . My son was sleeping near the window. I looked and saw that the whole window was crashed. We called the reception and they were shocked about what they saw. They told us it were hurricane proof windows. We were moved over to another room on the same floor in some minutes. The next day we went to the reception and nothing was know about this. After breakfast we got a voicemail of the reception that they will charge us $700 on the bill for breaking the window. At the reception they explained it was policy of the Hotel. There was no report of the damage - no detail of the $700 charge. I was very angry because I don't want to be charged for something we didn't do. Embarrassing was also that there was no manager available only the assistant housekeeper. He was not able to make decisions. We keep on telling him to take the $700 of the bill and credit card. He told us that they will contact the police. We don't care - so let's call the police and involve them. This was not the answer he expected. After some phone calls he told us that they will take it of the bill but still the on credit card. He asked me to contact the Manager the next day. I contacted the manager the next day twice - dropped him voice mails - never got any reaction. Luckly we had a great embassador at the Hilton Key Largo Resort to help us out in our next stay. She got also poor reaction of the Manager of Daytona Hilton - that he could not understand what I told him on the voice mail -strange she told us a we were not speaking chinese. We never received any excuse of the Hilton Daytona Manager. I would never recommand the hotel to somebody

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: davel33
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first weekend in October. This is a very nice hotel we booked last minute through priceline for $64. Upon check-in I asked if we could see the ocean from the room we were assigned and the very pleasant desk person said no but she could switch it for me. She made it for the north tower and gave us a king room with oceanfront on the 10th floor. It was very clean and had a sliding door that opened so we could look out over the boardwalk and ocean. If you are lucky enough to stay when there is a show at the bandshell this room has a perfect view of it. DO NOT CONFUSE THIS HOTEL WITH OCEANWALK!!!!! This place being elegant and all is not Oceanwalk Timeshare with bedrooms,bathrooms, and balconies. I have stayed there in the past and it is right next door and wayyyy more EXPENSIVE! There are 2 beautiful pools and hot tubs located here. The one in the North tower is on the roof w/no view except of the city and the one in the South tower is facing the beach and has a very awesome hot tub area that is stoned in and tropical. All in all this is a great place to stay w/excellent service and very friendly staff in the middle of everything. The bech in front is not accessable to cars so it is also a safe placed for kids. The ramp to drive on is right next door and easy to get to if you want to drive on the beach. If you are on foot the ocean walk shops and restaurants are connected and the hotel has a nightclub and excellent restaurants on site.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: cmmccla
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for $65 a night so I think the hotel was WELL worth it and I had a WONDERFUL time. I read all of the reviews of the hotel and was a bit worried but hoped the 4 star rating would save the day. The hotel is not a 4 star in my opinion unless you want to rate it on size. I would rate it a 3.5. It was a very nice hotel but not luxurious in any sense - EXCEPT FOR THE DELICIOUS restaurant Hyde Park within the north tower. Checked in was easy and it was very busy due to the long Labor Day weekend. I hoped I could get a free oceanview upgrade but unfortunately, the 3rd question out of the front desks' mouth was, "Would you like to upgrade to oceanview for $20 a night?". I said yes, instead of trying to cop a free upgrade. Anyway, all the reviews did say that parking is far and a hassle. Yes it is a hassle. AND we were assigned to the north tower which is not on the same side as the check-in, parking lot. So we walked all the way around to the north tower (before we figured out there was a corridor that would take us to the other side THROUGH the hotel. We had already parked our car across the street. So we dragged our 2 suitcases and cooler up the steep valet parking hill to the front of the north tower. Sigh - I'm tired thinking about it. Anyway, we had room 996. The lobby was very nice. We walked down the hall to our room and did notice stains on the carpet but I think most hotels will eventually have stains, regular people have stains in their homes (not me... tee hee hee). Anyway, it didn't bother me. It was a clean hotel. We went into the room and it was an average room - the pictures are accurate. The bathroom was clean. The room was dated but not grossly old. It was just an older room/hotel. Average. Not a 4 star though. The balcony view was AWESOME. We were right near the band shell and could hear/see the bands perform all weekend. Had superb views of the fireworks off the pier. Could hear the band play near the Hilton's Pelican bar. It was definitely all about location here. And they get 5 stars for that. The beds were comfy, the water was hot. There were 2 sinks. The bathroom sink and also a wetbar sink (that was stopped up). The Hyde Park restaurant downstairs was top notch. Ambience was great. We both had the petit filet mignons and jumbo shrimp with sides of garlic mashed potatoes and spinach w/mushrooms and it was delicious. For dessert we left and came back to the apple pie dessert *thumbs up*. The staff was friendly, the hotel pool was decent - couldn't see the ocean but it was ok. Only 5ft deep at deepest end. Kinda small but it was fine. Overall, nice hotel and I would stay there again. My complaints are limited to parking which required a short, hot walk across the street. A real balcony would be nice. I think that's it. The staff were super friendly from the valet, front desk, and concierge to the parking lot guard. All were happy and friendly. I love that. Great hotel. If you're looking for a Westin or Intercontinental, move on. If you want a nice clean, trying hard to be a 4 star hotel (lol), then this is it for you. I would go back again - especially for $65 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: keywestchris
Reviews.Content: We had a terrace room that could not see the beach. We asked for lounge chairs and they never came. The terrace is just a roof with pavers on it. And to top it all off they reneged on a deal to comp us thr room for Friday night. The room was old and not that nice. We will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time”
Reviews.Author: orlandodiva
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from staying at hilton 8/21/09 to 8/21/09 very nice you can pay for valet parking and be parked at hotel for $15 or for about $8 you can be across rd it all depends what you want, had a ocean view room everything was clean not problems have a great kids club fri and sat night you can have them look after your children from 6.30 till 9.30 and feed them for $40 steak house hyde park is very good do great steaks and cocktails pools fine enough beds so no need to get up early breakfast buffet is very good staff very helpful we had a great time cant wait to go back so if your constantly pennie pinching dont come here as you pay a little more for service but nothing is too much trouble all in all had relazing time enjoyed fireworks sat night from balcony

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Daytona”
Reviews.Author: santinaelizabeth
Reviews.Content: The Hilton would be considered 4 star for Daytona Beach. I definitely would not consider it 4 star for normal standards. We had a standard room facing the ocean which was nice. It looks like the rooms have not been renovated for some time, eg. old carpet, bathroom fixtures, tv etc. We only had hot water for a shower (no option for cold), no mini fridge, no fan in the bathroom, and no free wireless internet. We did have free wireless in the lobby but if we wanted to access it from our room it was 9.95/day! Outrageous, this is not 1995. Parking was across the street which posed for a bit of a problem at the front doors of the hotel in the pickup/drop off area. People would just leave their car at the front doors which made it difficult for checking in and checking out. Overall, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the pool was nice, and the view was spectacular. One of the nicest hotels in Daytona with the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: the3mcbees
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that we got a room at the Hilton cheaper than the Holiday Inn. The rooms were nice. I love that the ac has a thermastat and not just high, medium, or low. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. It's the best sleep I have had in a long time. We were in walking distance from all the shops. My only complaint would be having to pay $9 to park a block away. Parking was limited. We got the last space when we came back at night and visitors are also allowed to park in the limited space. You can pay $17 for valet parking but then you also have to tip them. All in all it was a wonderful time and I can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE customer service, waited 4 hours for checkin”
Reviews.Author: workingmom97
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that this is a four-star hotel--I've had better service from two-star places. This was our one night each year that my husband and I get away just the two of us, and we all we wanted was a place to rest and relax. We got there at 2 hoping to check in early, but we understood that we might have to wait until 4 p.m. for regular check-in. WRONG. They wouldn't check us in until 6 p.m., and even then it was because we told them that our cell phone was out of power so we could no longer wait for them to call us. They gave us a street room instead of the oceanview we paid for, the sheets smelled like sweat, only two people were working front desk during check-in with a sold-out hotel (the line went out the door). The pool was way too small for the number of guests and the size of the hotel. On top of it all, the staff was rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: blondiekat45
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline - last minute so for what we paid it was well worth it!!!! It is a great location - right off the pier - lots to do and very busy! Live entertainment all times of day and a constant flow of people coming and going. Pool and Beach Bars - decent specials but expensive otherwise. Beware - Parking is a expensive 17$ valet or 9$ self parking - a hot walk in the summer heat but not too far! You can rent a fridge for your room but cooler is fine. We had a great view of the sling shot but also the fireworks Sat night. We always make at least one trip to the OceanDeck - true beach atmosphere and delicious crab legs!

Reviews.Title: “A few problems,Good stay”
Reviews.Author: gdavis05
Reviews.Content: I had to wait almost 4 hours to check in even through they stated we could check in at 4:00pm, or room was not ready until 7:00pm that evening. I was promised a call when our room was ready, i had to calll them about the room thats when i learned that the room was available. Did not know we had to pay to park $9 for parking behind a Bar-B-Q joint or $17 for them to park it for me, but i found out that most of the hotels there has a parking fee. When i got in my room i reserved a Queen size ocean veiw, but i got a 2 full size street view and heres the kicker that room was register under someone else name. I find out they had not assign me a room. But once everything was ironed out i had the option to take the room that i had asked for, or stay in the one i was already in. All in all i had a great stay my room was clean and comfortable great location, the staff was very friendly and they apologize for the inconvience. For the price of my stay it was a good one i would stay there again and i would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific time on Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: StPete_FLMark
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. Got a fantastic price through Hotwire. Check-in was fast and staff was friendly. We received an ocean front room. Location of hotel was perfect. Room was clean. You have to pay to park. $9 per day for self parking or $17 per day for valet parking. Several restaurants, plenty of food options. Fireworks in back of the hotel every Saturday night during the summer. Would absolutely stay here again. Looking forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot remember a worse experience at a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cbutler67
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday and Saturday night, July 24 and July 25 and I cannot remember a worse experience at a hotel. First was their parking deception......they do not have any free parking. They have valet parking for $17 a night or parking across the street and behind a BBQ restaurant, for $9 a night. Don't think you can find parking for free because it's not possible unless you want to possibly have your car towed. Checking into the hotel took about 2 hours friday afternoon. The parking attendants (kids) who parked the cars were all a bunch of wise guys. My wife checked in and I waited in the car and I had about four or five different attendants ask me for Valet parking and when I said no they all had some wise guy answer back to me. I wanted to carry my own luggage but could not get a luggage carry even though I asked one of the parking attendants for one....he said no I could not use it even though he was just standing there and not using it at the time. Second, the room was way too small and did not have either a microwave($10/night extra) or a refrigerator($10/night extra) unless you paid the extra charge for it. You also have to pay extra if you want to use the internet in the room.($10/night). Third, we were put on the 11th floor of the North tower so we were just that much further away from the parking and from the main pool which was at the end of the south lobby. My advice to anybody with a family on a budget who stays in Daytona more than one night is to go to an extended stay hotel such as The Residence Inn Daytona Beach or a similar hotel not on the beach. These hotels come with fully equipped kitchens including refrigerator and microwave and you're only a couple minutes away from the beach. If you must stay right on the beach, beware you will pay up to 50% more on lodging, food and parking than staying a couple of miles down Speedway Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: kmg592
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Clean, neat, smelled great and staff were awesome. Everywhere u turned there was a staff member asking if u needed anything. They were very polite, when passing everyone I encountered would say good morning or hello. We ended up here because the hotel I originally booked (Plaza Ocean Club Hotel) was smelly, rude, things did not work in room, barking dogs. We left there after being checked in for only an hour. They would not refund our money either. That's another story. But highly recommend the Hilton and that's where we will be staying in Daytona from now on. See negative review for the Plaza Ocean Club Hotel I posted.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but lacks in Parking and Food”
Reviews.Author: LUV2TRVL3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property recently and found out that I agree with most of the other reviews when it comes to parking. Self-parking is far and not enough. Front of the hotel is very crowded and hard to get in and out with kids during check-in times. Food at the restaurant is not kid friendly. I was hoping for better selection in food for kids and adults. It seemed like same food was being served at 2 or 3 casual restaurants. Our room was good, needed some deep cleaning on carpets and sliding doors. Also, I felt like our room had some unneeded furniture. We had 2 queen bed oceanview room. Besides the bed and TV armoire, the room had a desk, two end tables, 2 chairs, and one sofa chair. I think it was too much....... I would like to say this, my kids loved the view from our hotel room. It was facing the beach, south tower pool, and pier. In summer, daytona beach has fireworks from the pier....since our room faced the pier, we were able to see the fireworks from our room. At that moment, our kids faces made me forget all the negative aspects of the hotel. I would stay here again but will be better prepared with food. Hope my review helps others!!!

Reviews.Title: “best on beach”
Reviews.Author: maryjay07
Reviews.Content: living in florida 20 years and traveling to daytona (the closest beach to ocala) stayed at alot of cheesy hotels . after staying here i will never stay anywhere else( me my husband 6year old daughter and 15 year old son loved it!!!)clean ,great restuarants, no driving on beach !!!!coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “No parking!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie A
Reviews.Content: We went to two valet stands to just check in and the line of cars was down the street. The valet told me it was always like that. I have a handicapped son so he told me to park in the handicapped parking down the street! Three blocks away! I couldnt even find a place to park my car by the door to check in. When we went to park that evening the parking lot was full and people were circling around waiting for a spot to open up. Nevermind if you have a handicap person with you. No available spots at all. And I had to pay 7.00 for that. 18.00 if you want valet and wait a half an hour for them to bring you your car. When I got to the room it was comfortable. Just remember this hotel is in the middle of all the party zones. Its crowded with teens,tweens and kids. If you like that you will be great after you find a place to park. There are toooo many nicer hotels for the price with a little more quiet and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel--Rooms Need Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: ATLTRVLGUY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights for work. Rooms were OK, but the rooms and bathrooms need to be upgraded. The workout room and pool were great. I'm sad to see that Hilton doesn't leave mouthwash anymore. I have stayed at several and it seems to have been discontinued. Also, had to pay for DSL internet :( If the rooms/bathrooms were upgraded this hotel would be ++

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Carnadem
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here for three nights of our holiday to Florida, we arrived on a saturday afternoon and, to be honest it took us ages to park and get checked in, i have never seen an hotel so busy! Once in our ocean view room, we loved the place, ok, the room could have done with a coat of paint, but it was very clean and very comfortable and the view was spectacular, especially the morning sunrise. We ate a meal in the steak house restaurant and had a couple of breakfast and an evening meal in Doc Brailles restaurant, which we enjoyed very much. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Being a beach hotel, there was no shortage of umbrellas and beds on the beach, and, the sea and sand were just lovely. Our stay was made even more special, dare i say, romantic (after 32 years of marriage), because we saw dolphins swimming just off the shore whilst eating our evening meal and our wonderful early morning walk along the beach, and, also my husband was very happy that he got to drive on the beach. Wonderful memories!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cagedbird09
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the HIlton Daytona Beach for one night while on a road trip. The hotel lobby is very nice and overlooks the beach. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful and got us to our room quickly. We were very pleased and suprised with our room, the decor was lovely and the linens and bed were soft and very comfortable. We had an oceanfront room on the 9th floor with a beautiful view of the beach. The room was extremely clean and the plush towels were a nice bonus. This hotel made us new Hilton fans.

Reviews.Title: “Experience depends on where you are”
Reviews.Author: tcoolhand
Reviews.Content: I come to the Daytona Hilton every summer for a business trip. I have had vastly different experiences depending on whether I am in the North or South tower rooms. Other recent reviews detail the pool situation so I will not revisit that. North Tower - in my opinion the quieter of the 2 towers. The room I was in did not have an adjoining door to the next room and was much quieter. The rooms are average, but I have never experienced major problems. South tower - If you are in the extreme south end, the part that angles AWAY from the beach, be aware, there is an adventure area and night club that gets loud screams (a slingshot ball that sends you up 200 feet) and lots of music until after midnight. I am not a light sleeper and usually put in earplugs and add a pillow over my head, the noise actually reverberated through the mattress! I asked for, and got, a room still in the south tower but much further north. Room was fine but the adjoining room door is NOT good at keeping out conversations on the other side. Luckily the people were in the room infrequently. Restaurants are okay, the Ocean Walk shops have been decimated by the economic problems and multiple store fronts are empty. Lots of good little places a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. The staff can tell you what is decent or not. A walgreens is about 10 minute walk north for any thing you forgot but the hotel shop is open late as well. Overall I like the hotel, like the staff, free business center access and printing is nice for checking into your airline and printing boarding passes, and enjoy coming here each summer. Parking is $9 a day caddy corner from the hotel across A1A. $17 for valet a day. Internet in the room is 10, wifi is free in the hotel lobby areas. I actually was able to get free-wi fi from my room on the 5th floor. **Summer Bonus - Every Friday and Saturday night there is entertainment at the clam shell (historic icon of Daytona Beach) until about 9:45. On Saturday nights there are fireworks off the Daytona Beach Pier - I have seen this 3 years in a row now and it is a pretty good show for a tourist town. Show is about 10-12 minutes long.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: drgod1213
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we needed a central location to stay in while looking for a place for my daughter to live as she had taken a job in Daytona. We needed to be able to access a lot of the residential areas easily, but also wanted to have a little bit of beach. We arrived about 10:00 pm to our room on Friday night. The rooms are ocean front, but they don't have a balcony. You basically open the sliding door and you are outside while standing inside your room. We were right above the "Band Shell" where a band was playing. The next night, same thing except fireworks off the pier. Hotel is average, does have a 2nd sink outside where the coffee maker is which is nice when two people are trying to get ready. And the parking is a serious hassle unless you value for $17 per night. Otherwise you are treaking down the block across the street to park. It is definitely centrally located.......... if you want to be right down near main street and all the hoopla!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JRBOhio
Reviews.Content: Great location on the beach. Great view from ocean front. Very nice and helpful staff. Very clean for a beach front hotel. We parked across the street which seemed easier and cheaper than valet. There is a lot of activities in the area, musical and street performers as well as a good fireworks display on Saturday night. Very fast elevator, no more than a 10 second wait. I would rather have a larger balcony and even though the rooms are decorated well and clean they are a little small. Our next trip to Daytona we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right near the action!”
Reviews.Author: poliprof
Reviews.Content: Although I feel the bathroom could have been a bit cleaner (see others' comments here about the same), overall I enjoyed the oceanfront view with the king size bed. The staff was always friendly and I plan to come here next year with my teenagers!

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet the Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: maplehuggers
Reviews.Content: We booked our summer vacations and stayed a week.Great location and panorama from the ocean view rooms. Beautiful lobbies and ballrooms. Comfortable beds and pillows. Sheets were always clean. Unfortunately this is the end of what I believe to be the good aspects of this property. Upon arrival we were assigned a room on the 11 th floor. It was an handicapped accessible room that we had not requested. It had a small sink and no bathtub. It was dirty beyond measure. The photos I attached speak for themselves. The external glass door didn't lock. We have two children and we were extremely concerned for their safety.We requested to move to another room, the standard room we had booked. After an initial resistance by the reception staff we were offered a new room the folowing morning.The new room was slightly better as far as cleanliness goes but the furnitures were worn. The sliding door of the closet didn't slide anymore. To open the closet we had to move it manually. The drain of the bathtub didn't work properly. The water drained very slowly. We addressed the issues but the problems were never fixed. One day we didn't even had the housekeeping service. We did not leave the do not disturb sign on the door so we did not understand how it could have happened. The hotel has a kids club called D- Dog. It is a large room on the pool floor. Our older daughter attended the daily camp and I was surprised to find out that all the activities were done indoors. All she did was watching movies, playing w/ table games and made a small craft. The caregiver didn't even give her the ice-cream she was supposed to have at the end of the day and that she has been looking forward to the whole day. I tought that some of the activities organized for the kids took place in the pool floor since there is a kids pool with toys. The hotel has several pools. One in the grounds of south tower ,a portion of which is outdoors and the other indoors. It is a beautiful pool but it was always extremely crowded. At times it was impossible to find any deck chairs available. There were no rules as far as safety goes. People were drinking beers at the edge of the pool and left the bottles there. I never seen a cleaning crew taking care of the place. On the ground of the south tower there is at least a jacuzzi and a kids pool too. A food kiosk and a bar are located by the pool. The other pools are located on the fifth floor at the north tower. The pool grounds here are quite shabby but there is plenty of room to move around and it is much quiter than the other at the south tower. A kids pool and a jacuzzi are also available. The beach is right in front of the hotel. You can rent chairs and umbrella. We never had problems to find one available. Restaurants at the hotel are ok. Having kids we found especially convenient to stop at the caffe to buy salads and sandwiches to take away for the day at the beach. The food was always fresh and reasonably priced. Guest have two parking oprtions. A self parking a quarter mile from the hotel for a small daily amount and a valet service. We tried both options. The valet service was very slow and he area in front of the hotel was always as crowded as the one of an airport. The self parking was in a lot that did't make us feel safe after dark. The reception staff was very casual. Really not the kind of environment that you might expect if you are used to the Hilton' standards. We didn't even have our loyalty points credited because we didn't book through Hilton directly although we paid through the nose for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: scuba999
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Rooms are comfortable and quiet. Nice location Con's - Parking a block away, Hotel had roof leaks in many locations, Dirty public bathrooms near meeting rooms. No balcony in rooms just a guard rail. Hotel restaurants expensive for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel, parking stinks, no balcony”
Reviews.Author: spar0035
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Daytona Beach oceanfront Hilton the last week in May, 2009 and got an ocean front room. The room was very clean and had a great view. For being in a spring break town it was in great condition, as I selected it due to the only hotel in the area getting good reviews previously. The elevators are speedy, though they have some issues reading the room key. There is not a lot of nightlife within the hotel, even on Saturday night. There are several bars, but everything seems to button up around 11:00pm. Could just be the time of year and Daytona trying to position itself as a family town. Great view of the beach from the room, and swimming down towards the peer is smooth and shell-free. I have an issue with parking, self-parking for $9.00/night is in a parking lot across busy A1A about two blocks away. It got annoying walking back and fourth. Valet is $17.00/night, but there are long lines to get your car. The valet lot is on site. They should've reserved that lot for self parking, since distance doesn't really matter for valet. Also, sliding doors in the room open up, but there is no balcony, you basically are standing in your room as you enjoy the view. The barrier is one foot away from the wall. However, if you're going to Daytona, I recommend this place. It looks like the only nice place around.

Reviews.Title: “Safety Issue - Sharp edges on damaged bathroom scale found in room”
Reviews.Author: JonathanTCK
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay in Hilton Dayton Beach very upset even though it was only a 1-night stay at the hotel. My family of four checked into the hotel in the evening and immediately went out for our dinner returning only late in the night. When I was drying myself after my shower in the night, I noticed that the bath scale which was placed just below the basin next to the toilet bowl had a broken cover. On closer examination, I found to my horror that the broken plastic cover for the scale was very sharp. I was staying with my two young daughters and wife, and was at that point feeling very fortunate that neither of them have gone close to the scale and got injured. I quickly called the front desk and complained to the supervisor on duty of my findings. He asked me to place the broken scale outside my door and promised me that he will get someone to remove it immediately. I did as instructed, highlighting that he has to get someone to remove it as it is very dangerous for people walking pass my door, especially children. I was appalled and very angry the next morning, when I found the broken scale still laying outside my door when I was checking out. In fact, I almost trip on the scale as I was walking out of my room with my luggage!! Fortunately, I did not have my children running out of the room as we were getting out to check-out from our room!! I found this entire incident unacceptable, especially with the trust that I always have with Hilton's services and high standards.....First, to have a damaged bath scale with sharp cover left in the bathroom by homekeeping. Next, having an irresponsible staff who simply patronized the customer and did not follow up with the matter even though advised that it could pose a danger to other hotel guests.....sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: heatherbeeee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February and the hotel seemed quite busy, when I booked the room it was called an "ocean view" but when we got to our room it was facing the road. I called downstairs and told the front desk and the woman at the front changed our room right away! It was great customer service! One thing to be aware of, if you're looking for a room with a balcony you can walk out on and close the door, they do not have those here. Other than that, it was a great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake to Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: britbrat87
Reviews.Content: We checked in to The Daytona Hilton with expectations of high class resort-BIG MISTAKE. When you check in here the lobby is beautiful, unlike the treatment you recieve by the hotel desk clerk. We had a horrible check in, even though we had print outs of our reservations and I had personally called a week before to make sure the confirmations were correct. It took us half the day to straighten out our rooms. They charged credit cards incorrectly and seperated us all on different floors where we could not even get to each other because you are only authorized to use your floor. When you have senior citizen parents with heart conditions and cancer, You can not reach them in an emergency. The rooms are about on the level of a 2 star hotel so don't expect too much when you see your room. The so called air conditioning would cool to about 80. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Breathtaking View”
Reviews.Author: arabella31
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room overlooking the Atlantic Ocean - the view was breathtaking! The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The hotel has two towers and we mistakenly checked in at the wrong tower. The valet moved our car to the more convenient tower so we wouldn't have to walk back to the other tower when we were going out for the evening, even though it was inconvenient for him! They also have a very nice breakfast buffet, a little pricey but worth it. The hotel is also close to other restaurants. We plan to go there again in 2009 and try to stay there a little longer!

Reviews.Title: “Bike Week Location - Only reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Budaside
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for Bike Week. Location was perfect for Downtown activities. Rooms reminded me of an old hotel with a face lift. Cleaning the sliding glass doors would be a start. Front desk not organized - didn't have the special request for dogs prepared - then made excuses why they couldn't have special request ready. My only reply to Hilton is that is you advertise all these "Special Request" to make your stay "Special" - then you should be able to deliver. After 4 attempts and two visits to the front desk we were given the pillows, mats and bowl for the dogs. Never did get the sign to hang on the door to say Dogs alone from the day shift. It took 3 trips to get the other dog stuff. And the fridge! Yea, you don't get a mini bar or a fridge or 400.00 a night!!! Again, there were plenty of reasons why. Lucked up on the Night Shift - who were super busy - however - for what ever reason - they were organized and methodical in their approach - they found the door sign we had requested and gave directions with phone numbers to some local establishments, answered the phone when we called, had room service on time and with good food! So, Arrive at night if you are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “I'd hate to see what a blacklight reveals...”
Reviews.Author: lbh1990
Reviews.Content: During Spring Break, my mother and I were taking a trip down the coast of Florida in order to visit a college I had been accepted into, Stetson University. We had booked a Holiday Inn Express near the university (which is a bit inland) for the weekend in case we could not find a suitable hotel along the coast. We decided midway through our drive that we wanted to spend a night on a beachside hotel, so we called the Hilton 1-800 number and booked two nights in this hotel. We agreed that although we had not seen the hotel, we knew we could depend upon the Hilton name and quality. We could not have been more wrong. When we arrived at the hotel, the entrance to the hotel was crammed with cars and people. It took about 3 minutes to be noticed by the valet because there were so many people trying to leave the tightly packed driveway. When we were able to speak to someone from the valet, they informed us that we were at the wrong tower to check in and that we had to travel further down the road to the other tower. An understandable request, although the entrance was hardly noticeable when traveling down the busy road that was filled with cars and pedestrians that would jaywalk whenever they pleased. After finally getting to the correct tower, we went to the check-in counter and were given our keys and told that we had to go back to the other tower. When we asked about parking, we were told that we could either park across the highway or we could use their valet for a fee. We decided that valet was the safer choice, even though the valet driveways were a confusing disaster. When we reached our room, my mother and I were disgusted, to say the least. The room looked dirty and very worn. The bathroom looked dirty, the windows were covered with fingerprints, and our blankets had gum all over them. When you opened the door to the "balcony" (which is really just a concrete step with railing), there were cigarette ashes covering the rails. The room looked as though it had not been truly cleaned in a decade. My mother and I decided that we were not going to feel clean sleeping in the rooms, so we called the lobby and complained that the room was just not up to par with Hilton's standards. The lady who answered asked us if our view was bad, and we replied that the view was fine (Oceanfront, 11th floor). She told us that she would move us to another room on 7th floor. When we asked her if the room was better than the one we were in, she replied that the hallways were better. She said she would send someone up to trade keys for our new room. When the lady arrived with our new keys she said with a laugh "Here are your keys for your new room. I guess the room's view is more...southerly." We were not sure what she meant, but the sarcasm in her voice was very noticeable and we gave her a nervous laugh and traded our keys. When we got to the new room, it was almost exactly the same. The only difference was that there were no ashes on the balcony, no gum on the bed, and hairs littered throughout the bathroom. The hairs (which were definitely not from anyone's head) were stuck on the toilet and in the soap holder, and my mother and I decided that we would not be taking our shoes off when walking in the hotel. In the middle of our inspection of the new room, a maid, without knocking, entered the room and quickly apologized that she didn't think anyone was in there. We explained that we had just been switched here, so it was no problem. She asked if there was anything that we needed and we explained that we didn't have a room service menu. She said that she would be back with one right away. While my mother and I waited, we decided we would stay in the hotel for the night, but cancel the next day's stay there. We called the front desk and cancelled, and also requested that someone bring up a room service menu.
