The person who answered did not seem to believe that we had not been supplied a menu and kept asking if we were SURE there was not one there. We had searched the entire room by this point, and had discovered previous guests' trash in the drawers, but had found no menu. The lady said she would ask the Room Service Department to send someone up right away. After 40 minutes from when we had asked the maid to bring a menu, and about 30 minutes from when we had called the front desk, we decided to directly call Room Service for a menu. Perhaps the best service of the entire hotel, we got the menu in 10 minutes. We decided that we would not risk the room service, as it was obvious that the hotel was not exactly clean and the choices were not what we had wanted. We decided that we would try the hotel's restaurant, Hyde Park. This was the worst dining experience I have ever had. Usually I am a very good tipper and I do not require very much attention when I dine out. But NEVER I have been completely ignored before. Our waiter would only talk to my mother. He would never look at me, nor did he ever talk to me unless I asked him something directly. For example, when my mother ordered a glass of wine, I had to stop him from leaving in order to order my drink. Not only was the service terrible, but also my food was not edible. One of my favorite things to eat is seafood, so I ordered a dish that had scallops and shrimp served in a lemon sauce. When I received my food, the scallops were so overcooked that they were rubbery and inedible. The shrimp were also overcooked, but the sauce saved them and I ate them. The mashed potatoes that I ordered as a side were delicious and the only thing that I would recommend to anyone. All in all, my experiences at the Hilton at Daytona Beach and the Hyde Park restaurant were HORRIBLE. I would recommend the Hilton to Spring Breakers had the prices not been so insanely high. This hotel is dirty and the service is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: Hansen5
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with all the amentities needed. I was perfectly comfortable and absolutely loved the view. From what I could tell every room has an ocean view. The valet is great and had my car ready quickly every morning. They get an A+ for everything. I really could not have been happier. Do not bother staying at any other location when you are in the area. Check out the Ocean Deck down the road or enjoy the Hyde Park restaurant on site. Crusin Cafe also worth a stop. Many choices for food and entertainment nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- but not Hilton service”
Reviews.Author: peggysue930
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the beach. Every room has a sliding glass door that's not quite a balcony, but which lets you listen open your room to the outside. I fell asleep listening to pounding waves. That is the good. The bad was that the parking really was a joke. I waited a long time for a valet and people were helped ahead of me who had arrived after me. On top of that, I was delayed from leaving by a half hour because the valet LOST MY CAR. And then the young man tried to blame it on me. How in the world could I be at fault for the valet losing my car? Reception was efficient, but also imperonal and unfriendly. They could not have cared less that I was a Diamond member- very shoddy service. The room itself was well worn and felt a little dirty. I probably wouldn't stay here again just because it is a Hilton- I'd probably take my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Couple of Minor Issues, but EXCELLENT Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MierGen
Reviews.Content: I travel to Daytona usually 2 - 3 times per year. I usually stay in less expensive hotels that are just as nice as this one, but a little farther from all the action. In the future I might consider staying in this hotel again not only because of the location but because of the wonderful customer service I received from Hilton. I had some issues with the hotel booking itself, which were promptly taken care of by one of the hotel managers. She was very profession and customer-focused. After my stay, I had noted in the email survey they send out that I was disappointed that self-park was full and we were given the option of either using valet parking or parking elsewhere and coming back to self-parking, which meant paying twice for parking. The next day, the valet manager called me at home to apologize. The room itself is nice. Not great, but nice. The "balcony" is really just a sliding glass door with a railing behind it. The view is great, the room was quiet, and the beds were comfortable. The shower drained a little slowly and the toilet didn't always flush very well, but other than that the room was clean and we had no complaints. With this Hilton you are defintely paying for location, not posh amenities, but location is king so I might stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: MItravels
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a quick stop in Daytona on our way to Orlando, so I Pricelined a 3.5 star hotel and this was what we got. We could not have been happier! We were supposed to have a room without a view, but my husband asked if the hotel was full (it was Jan. 17--off-season) and when they said no, he asked if it would be a problem to have an ocean view. We ended up with a beautiful room on the 16th floor and the view was spectacular. The entire staff was friendly and helpful from the moment we pulled in through the time we departed, and the location and grounds are beautiful. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is the best”
Reviews.Author: Lynn100
Reviews.Content: This has to the best hotel in Daytona Beach. The location is close to everything sure parking can be a pain but let's face it, this is a big hotel in busy area. If you want free parking go down the street to a smaller hotel. The valet was great and very helpful even though he knew I was self parking. The rooms are bright and very very clean. Coffee in the room or in the lobby. You need a key to get to the rooms through the elevator. Eveyone I saw greeted me with a smile and a hello. I am so glad I found this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: oldgeorgian
Reviews.Content: The first impression upon arriving at this hotel was where is the bell captain or head valet because the parking situation was chaotic. After 45 minutes I realized the problem was due to Daffy Duck being in charge of the parking operations. I know this hotel is near Disney but having cartoon character running the hotel is not good for business. This hotel since it is across the street from the convention center has elected to make parking a profit center. Hence parking at this hotel is not free. But worse than that is that the parking lot if full then requires that if you want your car near to the hotel to park in the valet parking for $17.00 a night. Over thanksgiving I stayed at a Comfort Inn in Brooklyn, whereat there was no charge for parking, but there is a charge for parking at the luxury hotel in Daytona Beach. This however was not the worse event. After being told that I had to pay for parking I was also told that I could not leave the bags (no bell captain)but would need to trudge across the street after parking. Upon going outside after checking in I was informed by a memeber of the valet staff that the parking lot was full and that I would have to pay for Valet parking. I proceeded to the parking lot only to find from the attendant that indeed the parking lot was full but that the valet parking service at the north tower could validate my ticket for regular parking.(Shouldn't the registration clerk have informed me of this?) I then proceeded to the North Tower where due to the fact that Daffy and Donald and children were running the show and I waited inline for 30 minute to give the car to a valet. So from check in to the time I actually took the bags out of the car 45 minutes. As to the room the layout was fine but no better or worse than a Comfort Inn. I did find that the two dead roaches in the bathroom, the cracked lap shade and the apparent caramel smudged on the room door were less than what should be expected at any hotel. Also I used a cup to brew tea the first evening. I guess this was a problem since the next day I found only one cup remaining in the room. Also with regard to check out I found on the bill that I was charged for both valet and self parking. (I guess I brought two cars) As to the hotel facilities I enjoyed the Legends bar. For breakfast since I thought $3.00 for toast was ridiculous I walked down the street to the Starlite Diner where you can have an excellent breakfast for less than $10.00. I utilized the exercise room which was superior to most that I have encountered at a hotel. However having the machines face the east presents a problem for early risers who have to stare into the sun. Also the TV in the exercise room is located catty corner to the rear which makes it difficult to watch. Unfortunately I believe this hotel caters to the convention crowd and the rest of its guests are treated as second cousins. I believe Conrad Hilton would not be pleased with the hotel and it current operation. The hotel should concentrate on making its profit from its accommodations and not trying to nickel and dime its guest. There should be no charge for the internet(try going wireless)nor for regular parking and a guest should be guaranteed a parking place. Also, as a Hilton rewards member my information should be readily accessible a the front desk. I should not be the person who has to have that information on my person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beachside hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neil&Sue
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our family (party of 8) for 2 nights (had 3 high floor beachfront rooms). All rooms were very comfortable and fully equipped as you would expect. Our room was at one end of the floor and had a super large balcony looking out both to Sea and inland and stayed in the sun until dusk. We found the pool superb (and very private given that the resort was relatively empty). The boys would have stayed there all day. As we only had 2 nights before returning to Orlando our experience of the area was limited although my brother loved his day rental of a Harley (about £120 all in). We didn't use too much of the hotels facilities but they were extensive and on site. We did like the bar adjacent to Bubba Gumps. Parking across the street was good for me ($8 per day) although my brother was equally happy with the valet paking which was about double the price. If you get a good deal at the Hilton, I am sure it has to be the best choice on the beach. An advance deal in my view is necessary as I wouldn't have wanted the walk-in rate. We did look at a ground-floor Cabana room, but it wouldn't have worked for us, and all Cabana's appear to be in the shade for most of the day (which in high summer might be most welcome, but not in the Autumn). If back in Daytona, this will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely But Quiet”
Reviews.Author: patandfiona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in November. Its a huge hotel and as you would expect from a Hilton it was very clean and spaceous. Sadly we were there at the end of the season and found both the hotel and Daytona Beach almost like a ghost town. Thats not a fault of the hotels, it was just the wrong time of year to be there. We have planned to return to Daytona in March 2009 for Bike Week and would certainly stay at this hotel if the rate wasnt exorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: kimmie375
Reviews.Content: First off I didnt book this hotel it was a package for my daughters cheer competition. The location was great for out visit.This hotel is HUGE so expect a long walk any where and it includes stairs and ramps. The parking is $17pd for valet and $9pd for self parking 2blocks from the north tower in which we were in.Valet guys were very nice and informative especially Jesse. Unfortunatly with as much as we needed our car which was 7-10 times a day over 5 days valet wasnt tipped for their service as they expect to be.When you pay $230pp for the trip parking should be free. To get to the rooms you must have you must have you key card which can be annoying and anyone can get to the floors regarless by telling someone to push your floor. The rooms were out dated.They didnt have the marble counters of the Hampton inn's I have stayed at or nice plush towels.Paint and wall paper was peeling.The balcony was what they call a "toe bacony"and they mean it.It was a nice view of the ocean.You do how ever have to choose between the beautiful sound or heat cuz if you open the door the heat turns off. The restaurants were only open during certain times and to expensive for the average person.Housekeeping was horrible.They didnt clean our room for 2 days even though we called numerous times.The shower didnt drain properly and when it did it backed up into the sink. In all I would not choose this hotel in the future.It is out dated,over priced,under staffed,and way to large.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at HIlton Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: cathsann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Daytona Beach HIlton for three nights while attending a convention. In order to speed up check-in, my sister suggested we use the auto-check-in. Fast and easy! We were taken to our room with no problem, helpful valet and bell staff. Unfortunately, our room was on a low floor and looked out over the roof of the lobby. And as I had read in an earlier review, there were no overhead lights in the hallway. I knew I wasn't going to be happy, so I called the front desk and they apologized and moved me right away. When I spoke with the woman at the check-in desk, she mentioned that the auto check-in is easy, but there is no "personal touch". The room we were moved to was in the North tower on the 9th floor. Very convenient to the convention facilities. The room as very well appointed and clean. I totally enjoyed my stay. Every staff member I came into contact with was courteous and smiling. There are lots of dining options, either inside the hotel, or within a short walk on the beach. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “customer service non-existent!”
Reviews.Author: laurapag
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience from start to finish. No one cared in the least bit for the guests. I stay in alot of hotels and this was one of the worst I've been in!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY @ the HILTON”
Reviews.Author: dottiestrips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton October 19 - 21st and loved it! We stayed on the 16th floor and had an ocean view room/balcony. The room was very clean and nicely furnished. The bed was very comfy. We opted to use the Hilton's valet parking and enjoyed the friendly valet service. The staff at the Hilton was very helpful and always polite and went out of there way for us. After checking into our room, I went to unpack and thought that I had lost something or maybe dropped it outside. I called downstairs, they connected me to valet and valet searched our car, found lost item, called back to let me know they found the item and then offered to bring it up to our room. If we ever head to Daytona again there is no doubt that we will stay at the Hilton. It was a great experience and we couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. I was really unimpressed with this Hilton property. For one thing, the entire place was somewhat "dingy" and in need of renovations. There was trash in the elevators, handprints on all the glass, and overall, the impression of dirtyness. The room I received was in need of major renovation. The furniture was outdated and stained. I couldnt believe how dirty the bathroom tile was,, which even made a cracking sound as I walked across it. I had to switch rooms due to sand that was all over the sheets on the bed. The second room I got was a little better, until I took a shower and the shower drain was backed up. I couldnt beleive I was staying in a Hilton. Overall, I was extrememly dissipointed in this property. I generally enjoy Hilton's and stay in many of their propertys across the country. This Hilton is not like the rest and is in need of some major impovements, For starters, the overall cleanilness of the place needs to improve. I would not reccomend this hotel or return.

Reviews.Title: “Where did the Others Stay????”
Reviews.Author: MarleneU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach August 18-20, 2008. When I checked in I was assigned a room on a lower floor in the same building as check in (South Tower?). When I arrived on the floor I found that there were no lights in the hallway--NO LIGHTS--except for a small light outside of each room. I reported this and was told it would be corrected. After I phoned two more times and after I spoke with someone who had difficulty with the English language, someone came to my room while I was out and changed my desk lightbulb! They left a note telling me the lighting problem was corrected! When I complained about this lack of communication at 10 that evening, I was finally told by someone who did understand english that there were no ceiling lights on the floor because it backed up to the garage. So, I requested a room change. Not my favorite thing to do at 10 in the evening. had I known there was a problem on the floor when I checked in at 3, I would have immedately changed room. I was initially told that there were no rooms available except those with double beds. When I protested profusely because I had reserved a queen size bed, I asked for a suite knowing full well that the hotel was not booked because the hurricane was due in on 8/20; at that time I was given a two room suite. It was fine but I should not have had to protest so much. This suite was in another building--same building as conference center--I think it is called the north building. As a single female travelor on business I felt I should have been treated more fairly from the start. I also felt unsafe on a floor with dim lighting. I am not unattractive and the hotel workers at the check in desk looked at me like I had two heads when I said this!!!!! Now, on to other things. There are restaurants within walking distance and the hotel is right on the beach. The hotel contains a deli type restaurant with over priced sandwiches and poor caffe drinks and contains a bar with sandwich type fare--it was VG. There is also an expensive restaurant in the hotel with $5 appetizers in the late afternoon and inexpensive martinis at the same time. Parking is difficult and self parking is at least a block away if not more. In the FLorida heat and humidity it is best to opt for valet parking at the outrageous cost. If I visit Daytona Beach again and if I am working on the beach again, this hotel seemed to be one of the better hotels in the area but I may opt to stay on the mainland, get up early and drive to my work daily! I am a Hilton Honors member and routinely stay at Hilton hotels. This was not one of the best but it also was not the worst. Mediocre best describes what could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to this Hilton or Daytona”
Reviews.Author: travelpal28411
Reviews.Content: I did not find this hotel to be as nice as other Hilton Hotels that I have stayed in. I had to wait for the receptionist to finish a personal phone call on her cell before she checked me in. I found the room to be outdated with a very dirty comforter. Other than the comforter, the bed was comfortable. The drain in the shower was clogged so we stood in a few inches of water. There was no refrigerator or microwave for use.-- I stayed in the older tower (I did not realize there was a new tower until I arrived). We had an oceanfront view which gave us a great view of the fireworks on Saturday nights from the pier. On the downside, it also was very loud as people are on the beach all hours of the night. Parking was ridiculous. It was either $15 for vallet or you could park in a lot behind a BBQ place across the street for $8/night. This was not mentioned to us until arriving at the hotel. -- Breakfast was pricey for the buffet at the hotel--about $18.95 or so a person, but it was decent and our waitress was pleasant. Overall, we would not stay here again, nor will we return to Daytona. We actually visited Daytona for a wedding but did not find it a place that we would ever vacation again. A better hotel choice would have been a hotel in another beach town nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was awful!”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the high rankings and positive feedback from this website. We were very disappointed when we arrived and throughout the stay. The rooms were unbelievably small -- smaller than any hotel I've stayed at (and I've been to NYC!). The rooms were also dirty, dingy and in bad condition (we had two separate rooms). Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids!”
Reviews.Author: Maray1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach Aug 1-3 with 2 children. The rooms were oceanfront and only $85 a night so this was a steal. Just some of the features that I found helpful: If you have kids, there are 2 wading pools. This was something I wasn't sure of when I booked the hotel. I have a 3 year old who loves swimming and she lived in the pool all weekend! If you have kids, try to stay in the North Tower on or near the 5th floor. The pool on the 5th floor is not as crowded as the one on the South Tower side. The South Tower has the poolside bar, so it was not as kid friendly. Also, Friday night they played a movie outside by the pool and the D Dawg Kid's Zone is there as well. They even had free popcorn and soda for the kids! The most confusing thing was checking in-you have to go to the South Tower to check in, and if you are staying in the North Tower, you have to drive to another entrance. But I have to commend the Hilton on their organizational skills in getting cars in and out. The only downsides were the balconies in the room-like the others said, they are pretty much just railings. But really, we were not in the room except to change or sleep! Also, if you don't get valet, you have to park a block away. But we only left once the whole weekend. Everything is within walking distance. We also had a problem with the A/C in the room not cooling all the way-I alerted the front desk and it was taken care of quickly. They even left a chocolate hammer from the maintenance department and left us a voicemail about the repair. Overall, I would reccommend this hotel to anyone. The location is prime, the hotel was clean, the staff was great, and the beach was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hopesicle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights as a weekend getaway, and it was a great experience. We checked in early, requested (and got) an oceanview room at no extra charge in the North tower, which is the newer part of the Hilton. Everything was very clean and well-appointed. Beach access is easy, and the hotel is directly connected with the Ocean Walk shoppes right next door. We would definitely stay here again when in the area. The staff was courteous and accommodating, can't think of any room for improvement! Of course, part of the greatness is we got it for $55/night on Priceline, can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place...”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty nice for the area. Actually, probably the nicest for the area.... The check-in was very easy and we were given a room on the 16th floor facing the ocean and it had a wonderful view. The room was spacious and we had no issues with the room. We had breakast in their restaurant and it was pretty good. We had 2 vouchers for breakfast buffet and paid for one of them for our 14yr old son. It was pretty steep, but what do you expect from a Hilton? Lots and lots of choices at the buffet and worth the $$. There are lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Couldn't believe the amount of pizza places they had!!! They were all over. Wal-greens down the street within walking distance which was nice to get beach toys. Did valet parking and each attendant was very attentive and made the valet service worthwile. One complaint was the laundry facility......or lack there of. 2 washers and 2 dryers for the whole tower. ( I hear the other tower has the same) That was rather ridiculous!!! I got my change for the machines around the corner at the soda machine....put in 1's and pushed the coin return.... The vending machine in the laundry room had old food in it...chips/cookies dated back to March (and we were there in July) and it didnt work. Oh well.... All in all it was an ok stay....if going back to Daytona Beach, I would stay there again....(although the area wasnt that pretty so we probably wont return)

Reviews.Title: “This is A Hilton???!!!”
Reviews.Author: pastorshaun
Reviews.Content: This was an awful experience for a hilton. The only plus that I can give this hotel was that it was right on the beach and the beach was clean. We came for a conference and tried to check in at three like stated. We had to wait an extra almost two hours to finish getting our rooms because they were not clean yet...we realized why later. The cleaning staff took forever to clean if they cleaned at all. We had a toilet that overflowed and it took three phone calls and three hours to get someone with a mop and some new towels, no kidding. The staff was rude almost the entire time. The beach view on one whole side is a horrible view because you can barely see the beach cause of some sling shot ride on the walk. PLEASE NOTE: read all of the fine print for all that they charge for. They charge for parking and unless you validate you have to walk a ways to get there. They charge for local phone calls, one dollar for the first minute and then 15 cents for tax on top of that. There were bottles of water that were 24 oz. that cost $3 but near the ice machine there is a pepsi machine with a 20 oz. for only $1.50. To park they charged us $50 a day for our bus, $8 a day for our van, and $20 a day for the trailer attached to the van! For six nights it cost us almost $500! I will never stay at this hotel again unless God himself audibly tells me to stay here or else!

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that are missing...”
Reviews.Author: Jagergeek
Reviews.Content: Hilton appears to be torn between portraying a luxury hotel atmosphere vs. a beach resort and succeeds at neither fully. There is only one small trickling foot wash (no shower) at the bottom of the stairs returning from the beach area. It always has a long line. The entrance to the hotel lobby from the beach is a manual set of doors with slippery tile and no mats. I saw more than one person wipe out and fall hard. Food is a problem for a family. The restaurants are either candlelit high-end affairs or a sports bar. The breakfast is bar $18 each. There is a "Deli" on the first floor but it closes at 5pm. Fortunately - several restaurants are nearby. Want to wash some of those sandy bathing suits? There were two washers and two dryers in our whole 16 floor tower (south). You'll need rolls of quarters - No change machine. We asked the front desk about getting change. They referred us to the gift shop - who told us they didn't have enough to spare. Overall - a nice hotel, but expensive and in need of some minor changes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie L
Reviews.Content: Awesome, awesome, awesome. The service was outstanding, the room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Atlantic Ocean Beach Experience”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The Daytona Beach Hilton sits right on the beach in the heart of this ocean town. It appears to be the nicest hotel on the beach and is next to the pier where vehicles are not allowed on the sand. The hotel is upscale throughout with a large lobby, a spa, two pools, a couple of restaurants and bars including a high-end steakhouse, mostly oceanfront rooms and the gorgeous Atlantic Ocean at their doorsteps. The room was not very big but comfortable with oceanfront views and sliding glass doors that open to the beach (except not a balcony). Small bathroom with an extra sink outside and comfortable beds (queens in the two-bed rooms). The workout room had nice new machines (according to my wife) and the main pool was a combo indoor / outdoor setup but not very big or elaborate. Beach chairs & umbrellas are provided by an outside company and cost $25 per day. The eateries included a standard hotel restaurant called Doc Bale’s Grill (a disappointing breakfast buffet which was not very clean and items were slow to be replenished), a coffee shop, a sports bar & restaurant, a food court, a poolside bar, an outdoor bar on the deck and best of all – a top notch steakhouse called Hyde Park. The food was terrific, service superb, great ambiance and it rivals the Ruth’s Chris and such. In addition, next door is the Ocean Walk shops which features a bunch of bars and casual eateries. Lots of fun on Saturday night and enjoyed good music. Service throughout the hotel was great. This is a great family vacation destination. Only complaints are the smaller rooms and the inadequate pool area. But the hotel is the best we seen in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Adequately Nice”
Reviews.Author: JasperGort
Reviews.Content: An older, roughly three and a half star sprawling property located directly on the Atlantic Ocean. This strikingly designed hotel is nestled between the boardwalk and the newly built "Ocean Walk" center, which is a hub of restaurants, shops, bars, and a movie theater. Go-karts and family-friendly games are found just across the street, along with the Ocean Center conference center. Most of Daytona's most famed restaurants and attractions are within minutes of the hotel. The lobby and public space of this hotel are about as swank as you will get in Daytona Beach. You'll see your share of marble, brass, mirrors, and art as you roam around the hotel. The atmosphere is relaxed, but somewhat refined. All the staples of a fine hotel can be found: spa, fitness center, pools and whirlpools, a variety of restaurants and bars, gift shop, business center, and activity center for children. The guest rooms are located in one of two towers: the south and the north. Request a room in the north tower; they are newer and better appointed than those in the older south tower. The north tower bathrooms are especially better and more spacious than those in the south tower. Note: Not all rooms in the north tower are oceanfront, unlike the south tower. All guest rooms feature Florida-tropic decor with themed Daytona art prints in the bathroom. French balconies afford breathtaking views of the ocean (or Ocean center). Cable television offers a limited selection of mostly news-related programming (this is primarily a conference hotel) and also offers two channels specifically dedicated to Daytona Beach tourism and the hotel amenities. In-room coffee and tea-makers, irons and ironing boards, hairdryers and bottled waters are available (the water is NOT free). The toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower cap, mouthwash, body soap, and hand soap) are some of the finest I've seen. And for the health conscious, there is actually a scale in the bathroom! In the south tower, you have easy access to most of the hotel's recreational amenities. However, you also have to contend with older bathrooms (funny odors, running toilets), and worn furnishings (closet door kept coming unhinged, painting was faded, etc.) In the north tower, you are closer to the Ocean Walk Village, but further from the rest of the hotel amenities (spa, outdoor pool area, gift shops, business center, etc.). However, you will most likely have a better, newer room. I stayed in this hotel for a conference, and my room was paid for. However, I asked for the rate of my oceanfront king bed room and was quoted a rate of $185 plus tax per night. Not that bad for a Hilton experience at the beach. I'll add to the other posters comments when I stress that its a good idea to do most of your dining and entertaining away from this place: they nickel and dime you to death. And you can NEVER be too cautious about the rough characters on Daytona Beach. I wouldn't venture past the boardwalk or Ocean Walk village alone, ever. The Hilton does a fine job about safeguarding the activities and amentiies on their own property, so you can feel safe when lounging around the hotel. Watch out for jellyfish!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the money”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property June 20-23rd, 2008. We paid $175 per night and Valet was $15 per day, At the time of check in we had already been on vacation for just over 2 weeks, staying at various places. We checked in very early, at 1130am. It was great that we could be accomodated since we had just made the reservation 3 hours prior. We stayed in a Oceanfront room. Let's just say "room" should be highlighted. Our room was small and a bit dated but seemed to be clean (no bugs). The furniture had nicks and scratches everywhere; I'm sure yearly Spring Breakers don't help. The bed was somewhat comfortable. What this property calls a balcony, is nothing more than 8 inches deep. The view is wonderful though. This hotel is huge. 2 Towers total, one South (the older of the 2), and the North Tower (the newer of the 2). In my opinion the rooms could use some attention to the details and maybe they could clean the huge sliding glass windows once in awhile. The main dining room, Doc Bale's, is centrally located and is where the "all you can eat buffets are". Breakfast is about $19 (includes coffee, juices, omlettes, fruits and meats etc). On the weekends the have Seafood buffet for about $40, my husband thought it was worht it and looked great. We contemplated going back to the Plaza resort, where we'd stayed 1 1/2 weeks prior, but wanted to try this Hilton out. At the Plaza we had a Oceanview Suite (vs. Oceanfront room at the Hilton) and the price difference was about $30 per night. At the Plaza we had a sitting room area, kitchenette and a balcony that could accomodate 4 people easily AND they didn't have a parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: matttristan
Reviews.Content: stayed at the resort june 20 and 21st. 1 bedroom suite, north tower. I agree with others that Outstanding lodging is hard to find in this area; the Hilton is probably the best to be found here. The ocean walk timeshares might be the place I stay at next here as I took a tour of them and they seem nice and clean. I had an oceanfront room , which did have a very lovely view of the ocean and beach. On Saturday nights, fireworks are launched from the pier that is located to the south of the Hilton. I was able to watch the display from my room. As others have indicated, the "balconies" are not balconies. You can slide open the doors and lean on a railing. There aren't enough inches to actually step out of the doors. The room itself was fine--not luxorious but fine. I had a small, uncomfortable beat up loveseat; coffee table; desk with chair; two queen size bed with nightstands; and 2 armoire that housed older tvs and included 3 dresser drawers. The bed was amazingly comfortable and provided a good night's sleep. The bathroom includes a separate sink and vanity in dressing area, with additional sink in actual bathroom. The sinks had new countertops, but the rest of the bathroom was in need of an update. Rooms are quiet and hallway noise is muted. In room internet access is $10 a day (although free WI-FI is available in the lobby). Parking also incurs a fee ($8 a day for self-park in a lot that is about one block away). The majority of staff were very friendly. the restuarent hydee park in the tower is amazing. make sure you check that out. rooms could be bigger with nice balcony.paid $295 a night plus taxes One word of caution: the Hilton is located right on the beach, but it is not a private beach. Many unsavory characters hang out in Daytona Beach, and these same characters lurk around the Hilton looking for vulnerable tourists. DON'T leave personal belongings on the beach while you go for a swim, and always be aware of your surroundings (whether night or day) while walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: sui5te
Reviews.Content: The Hilton has two "towers" - North and South. I stayed in the South Tower which is the older portion which showed it's wear and tear after years of spring breaks and bike weeks. The elevaters were aged (one of the buttons on my floor to call the elevator was broken, the button panel in the elevator was loose), the hallways were hot and stuffy, some lights were loosely attached - one was even dangling from the wires, and the "balcony" was about 12". WIth that being said - the view from the room was awesome, the staff was nice and responsive, and the location was great. Typical with Hiltons - everything in the hotel was overpriced, but there is plenty within walking distance to satisfy whatever you need. With the hotel being right on the boardwalk in-between the pier and oceanwalk "mall" (restaurants, movies, stores), walking was a pleasure. Caution for families with small children: the rooms have sliders that can be opened to the "balcony" which is really only a railing. The fitness center was welcoming and very well equipped with limited free weights, diverse machines, and advanced cardio equipment. By the way - if attending a conference in the hotel- the conference rooms are FREEZING!!! Even if in August - take a long sleeve shirt - seriously......

Reviews.Title: “Doubt I will return”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family over the Memorial Day Weekend, arriving on Friday and departing Monday. We had two rooms and paid $209 per night for each of them. We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the airport and to relatives. It also seemed the best choice among the other properties we studied in this geography. The view of the ocean from the room was very nice and I was impressed with how much the closed door muffled the sound of the waves. When you open the balcony door the AC cuts off so we did not leave the door open much. Unfortunately, as others have noted it is impossible to step outside to hear and see the ocean and close the door. The balconies really are little more than a narrow stoop making it impossible to comfortably stand outside the room with the door closed. The door did not muffle the sound of the concert that took place in the bandshell next door on Saturday night. And many times during our visit I heard noises from the rooms next door and from people walking in the hallway. The hotel was very busy with a wedding and graduation parties on top of a holiday weekend, but we experienced a similar experience with the waitstaff as that described by a previous reviewer. There were long waits and overworked staff. One waiter did come back and apologize to us multiple times for his inability to properly wait on us. He said he already had more customers than he could handle. While he seemed distressed and I appreciated his honesty, I also was annoyed with the hotel that they were not prepared to handle the crowds and by the time we left the excuses rang hollow. The lady who waited on me at the gift shop was very friendly and efficient. Likewise, the valet staff delivered our car promptly, so my staff problems mainly centered on the staff in the eating establishments. It was not uncommon to be told that we would have a 30 minute wait to be seated, but it was more frustrating when we were told a wait time and then it not to be accurate--as happened to us at restaurant and with room service. We did not eat at the Hyde Park restaurant. It has a clubby look to it and we were looking primarily for casual beachwear welcoming places for our meals so we frequented the other places. I don;t know if that experience would have been the same or different. The hotel is huge with multiple restaurants. The food court on the beach side isn't exactly a court at this time of year and I can only assume that it is more active at other times of the year with more selections--we did not eat there, but we tried the others. On top of the waits and the lack of customer service, we were greatly disappointed in the quality of the food we had at the hotel. The lunch we had at the Pelican Bar mostly went uneaten. I was the last to be served and the waitress said it was because she had sent my sandwich back as it was "too small". It wasn't the size of the sandwich I found disappointing--it was the taste. My daughter and her husband had what they described as an awful breakfast at Doc's Grill at an overpriced fee. I ordered two meals from room service--one that was passable and a breakfast that was swimming in grease and not very warm. All in all, this hotel did not live up to our expectations. The rooms were okay--tastefully decorated and clean. The television was an old-style television with HBO. The bathroom was fine but nothing special--it could have passed for any chain hotel I have frequented in the past year--not very large room. When I compare this to other resort hotels it lacks the feel of what I usually think of as a resort with extra perks and amenities. And when I compare what I paid per night with other hotels not claiming to be resorts I find this property lacking. Part of it comes from the setting. Daytona is just a crowded, busy beach town with more than its share of tattoo parlors, bikers, and party-goers. It isn't exactly a serene setting. I did not visit the spa. We walked several blocks to the North of the hotel. We made purchases at a Starbucks and an ice cream store but did not find much of interest in the immediate area. My daughter and son-in-law had a dismal meal at a nearby Mexican Restaurant. We saw a lot of younger people who were quite inebriated and my overall impression was that this was a prime party area, but not the best place for a family vacation. I doubt that we will choose this destination again and as we drove away we all agreed that we were quite happy to be leaving. I can understand that this hotel might be among the best of the choices as some of the hotels in the area did not look very good--some with individual AC units in the windows, etc. Just be prepared for mediocre food and service with a high price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: vg411973
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the absolute best location if you are looking to stay on the boardwalk, right near Ocean Walk and a very quick ride from the airport. The front desk staff was extremely outgoing and helpful, upon check in and the two other times I stopped to ask them a question. This is unusual, so I want to make a point that I think they were exceptional. That being said, the bartenders and waiters who make up the staff at both indoor bars (sports bar and lobby lounge), as well as the waitstaff and greeters at the indoor restaurant - leave alot to be desired. I was there for six nights, so I think I came into contact with most everyone. Bartenders were blase and indifferent - they would walk past you 3 times without acknowledging and kept giving excuses as to why they had to come back to take your order. And don't even ask to change a channel on one of the 10 tv's in the sports pub - will take about a 1/2 hour for them to even try. The hostess for breakfast each morning cannot handle the line of people waiting, and even if there is not a line, its an effort for them to seat you and they are not friendly at all. Same goes for the staff in the coffee shop - indifferent and completely unfriendly. The service at Hyde Park Steakhouse was exceptional - sure you are paying for it as this is an upscale restaurant, but it is well worth it. The rooms are clean but nothing special - small tv's - no balconies, but the ocean view I had erased anything bad. Disappointing pool area - and because the beach is not private/run by the hotel, there is no food service and/or beverages available on the beach (making you feel that you are not in a "resort" hotel). We had to haggle for chairs and umbrellas with the public beach employees - who charge $25 per day for two chairs and an umbrella. Last complaint about the hotel is that the towels they give out for pool/beach are a joke - my 10 year old dish towels are bigger than the beach towels they hand out to guests (i'm not exaggerating).

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheEich's
Reviews.Content: Best beach hotel i've ever staying in. Luxury at a modest cost. Staff was super friendly. Resort facility had everything and was also within walking distance to other restuarants and attractions. Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has issues”
Reviews.Author: MrRight52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days to attend a professional course. I counted at least 13 problems during this time. The main issues dealt with so many extra charges and poor maintenance. Examples are: hot, stuffy halls; conference rooms were freezing; dirty windows; bird poo on outdoor table and chairs, etc. The best part is its location -- on the beach and near most everything. Howvever, the numerous issues made stay not worth the money charged.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: renaroo
Reviews.Content: I'm here at the Hilton, staying for a 3-day convention. I'm on day 3. The hotel looks nice and is clean. The service, though, is just okay. Pretty much hotel-wide, the staff seems to be mildly pleasant, but lack the polish found at most hotels in this class. I've also found most of the staff to be fairly inattentive, not rude, just distracted, even when things are not very busy. The one exception is the Hyde Park Steakhouse. The food was delicious and the service top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay on Daytona”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloNYguy
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a family vacation to Orlando to hit the theme parks etc. But as the trip neared the end we decided to leave the Orlando area a day early and travel to Daytona to enjoy the beach and surrounding area. Like I usually do, I consulted Tripadvisor for the best spot to stay. I read the reviews and found the Hilton to have everything we were looking for. It's not the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at, but for the area it was one of the best. Some of the things we enjoyed are as follows: - The proximity to the beach (our ocean front room had a beautiful view). - It was right next to Ocean Walk which has all of the nicest shops and restaurants. - The boardwalk was right out the door - The pool was nice. The same pool went indoor as well as outdoor (through a transparent plastic curtain). - There were multiple hot tubs (one inside on outside). - The outside restaurant by the pool was very good. - It was easy to get a chair at the pool - at least during our stay. - The staff was courteous, caring and efficient. I requested extra towels and they were there within minutes. Within another minute or two we received a call making sure we got them and then being asked if we needed anything else. Some of the things we thought were average were: - The condition of the grounds and hotel exterior. Daytona is an older area so the age of the property shows just a bit. Could use some paint and the roof of the lower level showed some age when looking down on it. - The hot tub inside was strangely shallow (maybe for kids). It barely covered your mid drift. I did not try the one outside. - The price was a little more than I would have expected to pay for the area but it was oceanfront. There are others in the area that are quite a bit cheaper but they looked pretty run down. - There really is no patio. Just a small ledge when you slide open the doors facing the ocean. Overall a positive experience. I'm glad we made the trip to Daytona. I would highly recommend the hotel given it is central to all the activity on the beach. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed in the least.”
Reviews.Author: SpaceCowgrrl
Reviews.Content: My brother-in-law came to visit back in March of this year during Spring Break. The thing he wanted most while he was here was to stay directly on the beach in Daytona. We chose the Hilton because of all the excellent reviews here, as well as the fact that I'd stayed in Hiltons elsewhere and found them to be very pleasant. We stayed on Easter weekend, Friday and Saturday night. Perhaps our experience is not typical, but I feel I must share it so that others who are considering staying at this hotel have an idea of what could happen to them as well. Check-in was fine. Everyone was very friendly during the day. Our room was ocean-view, and we were happy. Around 10 PM, the air conditioner made a funny noise, then a strange smell filled the room and it quit working. We called maintenance, who came up and told us that they couldn't fix it that evening. They did not offer to move us, so we asked. They said they WOULD NOT (not "could not" but "would not") move us to another room that night. The night desk clerk even laughed and suggested we "open the windows, it's a nice night." I let the young man know this was unacceptable; he just shrugged. I couldn't believe it. Spring Break being what it is in Daytona, we had a restless night due to the noise of drunken revelers setting off firecrackers at 3 AM. The maintenance crew came by early to fix the a/c. They couldn't. The daytime desk clerk came up and was just lovely. They offered to move us to a new room; they said they would get us set up in the computer and we could move whenever we liked. We asked if we could move around 6 PM, when we got back from our daytime activities and we were told that was no problem. The desk clerk also said we'd get free breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. When we got back around 6:30 PM, the desk staff had, regrettably, changed. Someone on the evening staff had *given away our room*. They got us into a new room, but it was much smaller than our last one. Again, we said this was unacceptable - they didn't care. We didn't check the a/c - we didn't know we needed to. The a/c in this room NEVER worked. We checked with a few neighbors on the floor and found that this problem was going on in other rooms on our floor. Around 10 PM, we went to get our free breakfast vouchers for the next morning. There was a new desk staff who, while friendly, said they had no knowledge of our free breakfasts and refused to do anything about it. Upon checkout, we relayed our problems to the manager. We got an apology, and that was it. I truly could not believe our experience. After all the reviews on this site and the reputation of Hilton hotels in general, I expected better. I realize that many of you had good experiences, and I am sure they were busy that weekend what with Spring Break, Easter, and a large wedding that was taking place as well, but my business is just as valuable as everyone else's was. I will never be staying in a Hilton anywhere ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: maclikestraveling
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night weekend stay in March with my hilton points. We requested a low lying room and got it. The bell man was excellent and the valet parking guys were on top of their game. Being a quick get away for the weekend my wife and I were overall pleased with our experience at this hotel. The only concerns I would want to make other travelers aware of is the south tower is right next to the Daytona sling shot and the possiblity of noisy neighbors. The daytona sling shot is two large radio towers with a cage that thrill seekers pay to be strapped into and launched several hundred feet into the air. Because our room was right next to this we would occassionally hear people screaming if the door was open but could not hear them with the air conditioner on and the door to the very small (less than 2 feet) balcony closed. As for the noisy neighbors. It was spring break and the children in the room next to us were a bit unruly waking me up several times during the night. Because the rooms have miniature balconies- if you open the balcony door and then shut your rooms door it will slam due to the draft shaking the whole wall and definatly will wake you up. This happend several times as well. Aside from the two issues listed above I believe this hotel to provide great service in a great location right next to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Bike Week”
Reviews.Author: Got_2_see_it
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with 2 other couples stayed in this hotel during Daytona Bike week. We were very pleased with this hotel. Loved the pool/spa on the 3rd floor. Never crowded. Very clean. Friendly staff. Motorcycle parking was right on premess in an attended garage. House keeping was late in the afternoon, but right on the ball. Resaurants/bars was very nice. Plenty of seating throughout hotel. Elevator attendants provided an extra security. The view of the ocean was just spectacular. Easy check-in and check-out. Close to everything. Plenty os lounge chairs by the pool/spa area. We paid $229.00 a night (much higher due to Bike Week) and had nothing to compalin about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LimitedTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton. It is very convenient to the beach, boardwalk, and shops. The room was clean and nice. The staff was extremely pleasant. Although it was a little chilly for the beach and outdoor pool, the kids loved the pool because it was heated. The breakfast buffet was great. The only drawback was the upon checking in, the valet parking was a bit confusing and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “The Wedding”
Reviews.Author: MLS0922
Reviews.Content: A friend to the family was getting married and my son was best man. I made a reservation to stay at the hotel for myself and my wife. My son made a seperate reservation for himself and the groom. When we arrived we were checking in and the clerk asked us if we were with this wedding party and we said yes. I was given keys to the room and taken there by the bellman. Once we got to the room, we found that there was someone else staying in there. We later found out that this is the room where our son was staying. The bellman went and got us keys to a new room and took us there. After moving our items into the room I went down to the desk to straighten everything out. The front desk agent I went to was supposed to know exactly what had happened and would be able to correct the problem. When I tried to explain to her, they could not find my son or the groom in the system as having a reservation. After about 15 mins. of trying to work with this person, she was totally confused and so was I. She then passed me on to another clerk, who as luck would have it had checked in my son and the groom earlier, so she knew who they were. After she fixed the reservation, I thought everything was taken care of. When my son checked out, he found that his reservation was now in my name but with his credit card number. The hotel staff were pleasant, but of very little help.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slw00
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Hilton. The hotel is also a conference center and my husband was part of the conference so we had special pricing. There are two towers the north for the conference facilities and the main or south tower. All the rooms in the south tower have oceanfront views which are spectactular. Getting a higher floor would give you a better view. Our room had two kingsize beds and was very clean and nicely furnished. There are two sinks in the bathroom area which is convenient. We had breakfast at the hotel which was good, but like most hotels expensive. We also had dinner there one night because of a bad storm so we stayed in and went to the in-house steakhouse which was excellent but expensive. We did have a chance to eat out and I recommend Delphine Restaurant which was great. We loved the way they prepared fish. It is in town over the river on Beach Street. The facilities were nicely maintained, you are oceanfront and can walk on the concrete "boardwalk" area from right in front of the hotel. Other than special events and the Daytona 500, Daytona is a rather sleepy town with not much happening. There is a movie theater very close to the hotel. We did the self parking at the Hilton lot, only a block away. It was convenient and much less than the valet parking. All the employees we encountered at the hotel were very helpful and pleasant. We had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: FastCarRental
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Good dining and great staff. The rooms in the North tower are super small, but as a Gold HHonors member they had a plate of cheese and crackers, and a bottle of wine - nice bonus. The beach is nice there - the pool is decent - not the happening place. In the connecting building there is Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. restaurant - enjoyed it too. Dinner in the main restaurant was a let down though...the steakhouse was closed that night because the hotel was empty almost - not right.

Reviews.Title: “take your car on the beach”
Reviews.Author: chip1784
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights with a high up room with a great view of daytona beach. Nice rooms with comfortable beds. The location is perfect right in the middle of daytona beach. The best part was driving our hire car on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the beach, such as it is”
Reviews.Author: Rick355
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Daytona and want to stay on the beach, this is probably the best of what's available. Daytona though isn't upscale, so keep your expectations low and you'll be fine. The surrounding area is mostly T-shirt shops, tattoo shops, the homeless and the wandering. I had a high oceanfront room and it was very pleasant with the sliding door open and waves crashing on the beach throughout the night, but if my room was city-facing I don't think it would be anything special. The Hilton chain as usual though does have very comfortable beds. The staff was also very pleasant and competent. Car parking as mentioned in other reviews was a little expensive, but it was only a couple blocks away and not that bad to get to.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgajsalem
Reviews.Content: A great hotel- clean, friendly, comfortable, and right on the beach. If you are staying in Daytona, this is where to go. However, was not impressed with Daytona- disappointing shopping and food choices. Also, had my cell phone stolen there (not at hotel).

Reviews.Title: “A light shining in the darkness”
Reviews.Author: roger39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the beach. We had superb views from our 11th floor window. Our room had just been re decorated and was fresh and light with full length windows looking out over the sea. The room had two queens but was not large;just enough room to walk around the beds with out it all feeling too cramped. The bathroom was small but well equipped. The food in the restaurant tended to be slow in coming but ,surprisingly ,was worth the wait when it eventually arrived. The exercise facilities a nd the pool looked fine and got the sun up to about 4pm. . And the whole hotel was clean and efficient and looked as if it was thriving. This indeed was amazing considering its surroundings. Daytona Beach may once have been an attractive place but the sea front now is run down and seedy. Few hardy souls will venture out at night time I would guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: dananddawn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in June of 2007. I was there for the USTA Nationals meet which was being held directly across the street in the Ocean Center. If you are attending a convention located at the Ocean Center, this hotel is the closest. The hotel is located right on the beach & within walking distance to the Ocean Shops. Our room, which we received a special rate on due to the meet, was a king room. The room itself was small & the balcony was not really a balcony. It was a sliding glass door that opened to a railing. I was able to step out onto it but a larger person would not be able to. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom vanity area seemed to have just been redone. The best part of this room was the beautiful view of the ocean & the location. Directly on the beach, right across the street from the Ocean Center & within walking distance to restuarants & shopping. Hotel staff OK but not overly helpful. Had dinner in hotel at Doc Bales Grill. Very expensive! Service was great but we were the only people in there so I can't say what it would be like if it were full. Food was great but not really worth the prices. Walk down the beach and eat at Bubba Gumps instead of the hotel. It's less expensive & the food is better.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: dega09
Reviews.Content: We recieved a free 3 night stay at this hotel for doing a tour at the Wyndom Resorts. It is by far one of the nicest hotels I have ever been to...very pricy. They even have $3 bottles of water in the room just in case you need it! We didn't have an ocean side view, but it was still really nice. You can watch WAY over priced movies on demand in the room, but it's kind of cool because they even have some that aren't at the movie stores yet. It's also nice and close to the Ocean Walk Village which has a fair amount of things to do and across from a fun place for kids. They have lots of amenities and the room was very clean. The staff is very attentive and helpfull. It was the best free stay I've ever had at a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view”
Reviews.Author: jenbudd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for four nights. We had an ocean view room on the 9th floor. The sliding door opens, no balcony just a railing, but it was wonderful to hear the ocean. The room was a bit on the small side and the bathroom was really tiny, but there is another sink/vanity outside the bathroom so that helps. The beds are very comfortable. The pool on the lobby level is large and never crowded when we were there. The deepest the pool get is about 5 ft. The beach is right behind the hotel and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. The down sides-parking. Valet parking is $14 a day and self park is $8. The self park is across the street and over behind a restaurant. It is not monitered and I never really felt safe. I don't think the Hilton should even charge guests to park there. The elevators-you have to put your room key in a slot to select your floor. Out of the 5 days we were there my key worked once! Lots of other guests had the same trouble. We were at the pool and on our way back up to the room my key didn't work. I had to wait in line at the front desk dripping water to get a new key and the desk attendent asked for ID before she would give me another key and that didn't work either. Luckily anyone else in the elevator can use their key to select any floor. There is a kids activity area on the 5th floor of the north tower. It is about a 2 block walk from the front desk. I took my 5 year old there. There are games, puzzles and crafts for $5. There is also another pool on that level. We were there for a work conference and I think if I went again I would stay somewhere smaller with more convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great time despite terrible weather”
Reviews.Author: PennyAA
Reviews.Content: My husband really needed some time off, so we headed to Daytona Beach where we have always had a good time. Our visit was from Sept 17 to the 20th, and unfortunately it rained the entire time we where there. However, we did manage to have a good time. We had a suite in the North tower, beachfront, on the 4th fl, and loved the location. Suite was a great size, bathroom was spotless and very large, king bed was very comfortable with good quality linens, but the furniture was a little outdated. In-rooms movies were a little steep at $14.00 each, but the titles were current and helped pass the time during the heavy rains. The sports bar and the clocktower lounge in the hotel had great drinks and the typical bar food menu. The restaurants attached to the hotel were good, and the Mai Tai bar was a great spot to have a nice glass of wine to end the day. Easy walking distance to the outdoor band shelter which must be very nice during the peek summer months. Short stroll over to see live music. Boardwalk pier also very close. My recommendation would be to have advance reservations for the spa if you are intending to get any services. Very popular place and I could not get in for the three days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Take an umbrella !”
Reviews.Author: ades_workshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights 16/17 September and stayed on the top floor as part of our honeymoon. Had to leave the downstairs bar area next to the lobby as the rain was pouring through every light fitting and vent in the ceiling, which spoilt our evening. All the electrics,ie; bar tv's etc, went out out.The staff were frantically trying to vac all the water up during the rain. Bar lady did not know how to make the cocktails advertised at the bar, stating "I've never heard of that" despite being on the bar menu. Do not use the bar during rain or you will get wet !!!. Our stay in the hotel on the whole was good. The rooms are nice and clean with fantistic views of the beach and Atlantic. The beds are extremely comfortable and the down pillows are heaven. You get charged to park your car at the hotel car park across the road. Its even more expensive if you use the car park onsite which is valet parking. A good hotel with poor construction/maintenance issues to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Best plac eon the beach!”
Reviews.Author: NJout&about!
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Daytona Beach in Florida for 10 days in June while on a business trip. The hotel was nice. The staff was plesant and the pool was great! I recommend the Sports Bar to eat and the Pool for drinks and Apps.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: Jane077
Reviews.Content: Please don' t be fooled thinking the high price equates to the usual Hilton experience found at other locations within the United States. When we first arrived, we decided not to go with expensive valet parking, and had a time trying to find the self parking which was also expensive for the Hilton. We stayed in the South Tower on the 3rd Floor, the only level with no balcony. We arrived at our room and the room keys were keyed in wrong so we could not even get into the room assigned to us. We noticed that the food from the previous guest sat out in the hall until late that evening. Our toilet in the room would not stop running. We decided to take the stairwell over the elevator and found the stairwell was completely disgusting and smelled like a trash dump. Trash was actually found on the ground level and had probably been there for some time, given the smell. If you are attending a show at the Ocean Center, it is nice that the Hilton is directly across the street. The hotel is nice for a night or two, but I would not recommend staying in this hotel for a week. Especially if you are placed on the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DudesDaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton from 6/21 to 6/26. We had an oceanfront room on the eighth floor with an excellent view. The room itself was comfortable and clean. The location of the hotel is great, just across the street from the Convention Center and the Peabody Auditorium. The hotel is also part of the Ocean Walk Village with adjacent shops, boardwalk and street entertainers. We spent a fair amount of time at the pool. The water was warm. There are a lot of beach chairs, but during peak times it was hard to find two together. The pool bar bartenders and waitresses were very attentive. We had brunch in the hotel restaurant a few times and were very pleased. For quick meals, the hotel has it's own "food court" on the ocean level. It was only open Thursday through Sunday though. I can understand why as it never seemed too busy. The price of the hotel seemed reasonable compared to what one would pay in the larger cities. The water temp in the ocean was very warm. We didn't spend much time there. The Hilton is located on a strip of beach where cars are prohibited, unlike most Daytona beaches. Two beach chairs and an umbrella can be rented for about $25 a day. I parked in the self parking lot across the street from the hotel for about $6 a day. I put the car there the day we arrived and didn't use it again until we checked out. We had everything we needed within walking distance. My wife is a big coffee drinker and was pleased with the Starbucks and the Barneys coffee shops on the site. I kept in touch with my work via my laptop, using the free wireless internet in the hotel lobby area. All in all, I was very pleased with my Hilton stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel saved our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: arheine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Daytona Beach Resort/Ocean walk. There were four of us in the room and these were the best beds I have had in quite some time. The rooms are clean and there were two sinks - one in the bathroom and the other just outside - which is great when you have so many in one room. The view is great we were on the 8th floor of the north tower and the small balcony was nice opened up to see and hear the beach although it was not a walk out balcony. We had orginally been booked at another hotel on Daytona Beach and it was very undesirable so we left and the Hilton was able to take us in on the fly for four nights/5 days. We had wanted an effeciency room and had booked one at the other hotel, but the Hilton staff made up for the mistakes of the other hotel (no affiliation) by giving us a microwave and small fridge at no additional cost (reg. $10 per night each) and they gave us a great special rate. The place is huge with 2 pools we used the one on the 5th floor of the north tower because it was closer. Also very close to the board walk and beach walk areas close to great restuarants and shops like Maui Nix and Bubba Gump, also the movie theatre were all in walking distance, literaly right around the corner. The valet may turn some off, but it was very easy to get in and out. The two entrances confused us at first, but no matter we had an excellent time and all of the staff we encountered was helpful and kind. If you can manage I suggest the suites on the main floor if you are in and out to the beach alot especially with kids They are larger and have nice patios. It's not as secure having a room on the outside verses the inside but the hotel seemed up on security issues with the need for a room key to use the elevators to access floors 4 and above where many of the guest rooms are so if you don't have issue with outside accessible room you may want to try the suites. Also that section of beach has many rentals nearby for bikes, scooters, lounge chairs and umbrellas which was nice - The umbrellas and two chairs was $25 for the entire day and made a nice retreat from the sun and cool place for the cooler. Also we noticed they had a kids program seven days a week, although we did not use this it looked like those kids who did were enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful at this hotel! Can't beat the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: koolkerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Oceanfront for one night on a driving trip from Fort Lauderdale to North of Atlanta, GA. I was traveling with my mom and 2 sisters. We had the cabana suite which is located on the ground floor. These suites have 2 queen beds with a tv in the bedroom and a pull out couch in the living room with another tv. There is tables and chairs outside the room as well. Plenty of room for large families - perfect for us... Mom loves to sleep with the tv on and we wanted quiet so it works out perfect... The Hilton is always very clean and the staff is wonderful... close to Ocean Walk which has shops, Starbucks, a movie theatre, bars and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.... The best in Daytona

Reviews.Title: “best oceanfront in daytona beach”
Reviews.Author: tracyd123
Reviews.Content: wonderful stay at the daytona beach hilton--oceanfront--without a doubt, they had the most comfortable beds and down pillows on which i've ever slept. we chose to use the self-parking $6/day which is located a short walk across and down the street. all the staff were excellent--professional, courteous, helpful. the rooms were immaculate. we had a cityview room (toward intracoastal) with teeny balconies in the north tower but helpful to a smoker. a great place for breakfast right across the street is the earl street diner. 1950's feel and prices! great!! wonderful experience and enjoyed visiting the daytona 500 for ride around the track and great imax movie among other exhibits and great gift shops. wonderful experience! definitely would return!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: lishus
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights May 10 and 11booked through Expedia.This is the perfect location.Walking distance to boardwalk.Attached to Ocean Walk so movies, restaurants and treats are close.Very clean pool.We were there during Andrea so the wind was horrible and there was no beach.Pelican Bar is convenient and all food was very good.Internet is $9.95 per 24 hour period-this is probably my only con.Probably one of the top 2 hotels on Daytona Beach.Would definitely stay here again. We drove a short distance up North Daytona and ate at Bonefish located beside Olive Garden. Moderately priced but excellent cuisine/service.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: OxfordEnglish_bloke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel because it was the venue for a technical conference that I was attending. The hotel is large, but the attentiveness of the staff prevent it from becoming too impersonal. The rooms are spacious, clean and well-kept. Everything throughout the hotel has the feel of quality about it. It is situated right on the beach and has two swimming pools and several restaurants/bars/cafes. There are plenty of ballrooms/conference halls, smaller seminar rooms, etc, and together with the lecture halls over the road in Atlantic Avenue this makes it a natural conference venue. Unlike at some other conference venues, the hotel staff were very attentive with respect to business needs as well as personal needs of guests. You only had to ask and it happened immediately. Everything ran like clockwork. If there were one complaint, it would be that the airconditioning was over the top. It was strange to look out of the window at people having fun on the beach in what was so obviously sweltering heat, while we were shivering inside even with jackets on. This was more of a problem in the conference hall areas; in the guest room it was OK if you set it at an ambient 22 deg C (any lower and it got cold, any higher and it started heating!) In terms of provisions, a safe in the room would have been good, but otherwise there was everything I needed. Wireless Internet access was available for free in the "public" lobby areas, etc. The fast connection in the room also worked well, although it cost $10 per day. Overall my assessment is that although it is expensive, but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough of Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: flipflop88
Reviews.Content: I went to Daytona this weekend for a teacher's conference. The hotel that hosted the conference "accidentally" canceled the reservation I'd made 3 months ago...and had NO rooms available to make up for this shameful error! So at 10 PM , there I was stuck...in Daytona trying to find a place to stay. The host hotel put me up in another one of their properties - La Playa Resort - but after reading the sad reviews of this property here on TripAdvisor, I decided to find my own hotel. I immediately called Hilton Hotels and they found me a great room that met my needs. I asked for a smoking room, and the confirmation said that's what I got -- but the room I ended up in (Room 997 in the North Tower) -- turned out to be non-smoking, after all. Not a huge deal, I was too tired at this point and just wanted to go to sleep. When you walk into this hotel lobby, you KNOW you've arrived at a quality establishment immediately. It's immaculate, stylishly decorated (unlike so many of Daytona's cheesy "tropical" attempts at decor), and the employees look and conduct themselves as professionals. I asked not to have my car valet parked because I realized I'd forgotten to get cash before arriving. I explained this to one of the valets and he told me not to worry about it --- and meant it --- and helped me with my bags, knowing fully well that he wasn't getting a tip (at least not that night). AMAZING, eh? My room was a standard "city-view" room. The view actually would have been pretty nice, except that you see the rooftop of the hotel's lower level. But it didn't matter -- my room was spotless, stylish, and more than comfortable. The bedding in Hilton family hotels is to DIE for! They certainly don't skimp when it comes to quality bedding, and you will feel the difference the minute you slip into bed. In fact, you'll never want to get out of it, it's so dreamy! The only downside is that my room was NOT smoking, after all. I really wasn't upset, because I did not spend much time in it to begin with...but when I mentioned this in passing during check-out, they immediately apologized for the mistake and discounted my stay by about 15%, even though I wasn't complaining! Overall, this is the nicest hotel Daytona has to offer. It's modern, beautiful, and sparkling clean -- with a staff who put the SERVICE in Customer Service! Whether you're a couple looking for a nice, quiet getaway, a businessperson in need of comfortable accommodations that allow you to get some rest while you work -- or a family in search of a beach hotel that you can feel good about bringing the kids to ...The Hilton Oceanwalk Village of Daytona Beach is the ONLY place to consider!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Junior Suite but beware of the Shark Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: gatorgurl4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a getaway and we thought it was still going to be spring break but upon arriving the area looked pretty dead and the other reviewers were 100% accurate when they said the surrounding area left a lot to be desired. There are many homeless persons and vagrants wandering around all over Daytona it seems. The valet/bellhops were all friendly to us as well as the check in girl. She first put us in a cabana suite which were supposed to be the nicest rooms that lead directly onto the ocean. But when your in it you only have an eye level view of the ocean which is partially obscured by all the things outside the room. I prefer a high up view of the whole ocean.
