I wasn't impressed with it at all, it looked more like a glorified motel room and I didn't like having the noise and nonprivacy of people walking by your room on the main sidewalk. So I asked to move to the junior suite she had also offered to get a better higher view of the ocean. When I walked into that my reaction was now your talking! It was like night and day with the difference between rooms. It was room 926 and it had a separate little sink area with refrigerator when you first walked in, separate living room, nice size table, and very nice plasma flat screen tv. It had french doors that led into a separate bedroom area which had two different granite sinks/separate bathroom area which was nice in case both wanted to use the sinks. It felt like a nice little luxury apartment. We had a full oceanfront view overlooking the tower and bandshell so we could see all the happenings. They say their balconies but the balcony consists of a tiny ledge with a railing so hopefully your skinny enough to squeeze out onto it. You aren't able to sit out there just stand up on it and look out. The water in Daytona was grey which was strange, not exactly what I pictured for a nice Florida beach. I also recommend the valet parking because otherwise you have to park in a lot a couple blocks away behind this bar-b-q joint which doesn't seem that safe to me. Plus it was very quick each time we left for the bellman to get our car for us. I think they wanted a tip but at $14 to valet park I don't feel it was warranted. We also went to this strip club called the Shark lounge. If you want a good laugh you have to go there. I have never seen such an unattractive bunch of women in my life. There were two that were over 50 years old and the rest I thought were pregnant or were more flat chested then my husband, and the others looked like someone hit them with the ugly stick or they'd had one too many cigarettes. We got two drinks and it came to $14. When I went to pay up and didn't leave a tip the bartender just said thats all? I almost told her yes thats all after what I just saw and what you just charged. I felt bad for the little shark they had swimming in the tank that the women paraded out on it looked like they were trying to find a way out! All in all I was not impressed by Daytona Beach at all and it seems very run down. If it weren't for the beautiful room we got it wouldn't have been much of a trip. If I could get the same room upgrade again I'd go back otherwise probably not because the area isn't very nice and there's not a whole lot to do.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay...as always”
Reviews.Author: From Swanzey
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hilton every year when we go for Bike week and this year as it is every year was wonderful. The rooms are clean and well furnished the staff is wonderful and helpful. Although it is expensive to park...all the other hotels on the strip have the same problem...no space. We drive down from NH with a truck and trailer and for several years had to pay huge amounts of money just to park the truck and trailer...either at the Hilton lot across the street or from other venders elsewhere. It cost us $48.00 this year just to park both our bikes at the hotel this year (for only 3 days!), but luckily we have a friend who has a place south of Daytona where we parked the truck and trailer. Again though...this is a problem everywhere along the Beach in Daytona! This year I was a little disappointed though...although our room was wonderful (junior suite) and it faced the ocean..we didn't have the wonderful view of the sunrise that we've had in past years.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaRiz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night at the Hilton Oceanfront. I booked my room online through the hotel direct and got a King, oceanview room for $179/night. The hotel has been around for a while and has changed names several times, however has recently been remodeled and rebranded as Hilton. The public areas including the lobby, pool area etc were clean and well decortaed. The room was a bit small, but was newly refurbished. The bathroom vanity area was also new with granite, however the tub area was old. We did not dine at the restaurant, however did order room service and everything was perfect. I would probably return to this hotel, but not during peak travel times as the room was slightly expensive and the area was very busy.
